loans.name: Katherine

texts.en:
Katherine and her best friend Brooke (not pictured) seemed to have been destined to go into business together from the beginning. Both were in monotonous 9 to 5 jobs and felt frustrated that they weren't making any kind of difference in the world. One day in Katherine’s backyard, they talked about starting their own business together, utilizing natural essential oils to make everything from beauty to home care products. The next week, they got their business license and started KB Pure Essentials. 

The duo makes all of their products at Katherine’s house. Using recipes from doterra.com as their foundation, they modify them in search of the perfect combination of ingredients. What makes Katherine and Brooke such a great team is that they have a unified vision for where they want to take their business. They also each have their own niche in the company and are passionate about what they do; Brooke handles the business aspects, while Katherine is the chemist who creates their products. 

“Everything in our products you can pronounce,” said Brooke, who now only uses the products they sell in her own home. “I haven’t been to a grocery store in two months, and I feel great.” 

They currently sell their products online and at the local farmers’ markets.  They also employ three of their friends, who help at the markets and in the kitchen creating products.

The main challenge that the team faces during the start-up phase of their business is having the cash flow necessary to purchase ingredients for their products and to pay their employees. They will use their $6,000 Kiva loan to purchase the raw ingredients to make 3,000 units of all natural deodorant (their #1 selling product) and to pay their employees. 

In the future, Katherine and Brooke would like to grow their e-commerce presence, because of its efficiency and inexpensive overhead. They would also like to sell wholesale in high end boutiques and potentially go global. Growing sales will allow them more time to focus on creating new all natural products.

Check out KB Pure Essentials online at: http://www.kbpureessentials.com

loans.use: to purchase the raw ingredients to make 3,000 units of all natural deodorant (their #1 selling product) and to pay their employees

loans.name: Deepak

texts.en:
Deepak is 35 years old and lives in Kelahabad village, Jharkhand. He has studied till 10th grade but did not go to college as his parents could not afford to pay the fees. They wanted him to start working and reduce their work load as he was the eldest among their three sons. He lives with his family consisting of his mother, wife and two daughters who go to school. 

Deepak used to work as a mechanic in small cycle shop at Deoghar. He was very hard-working. Since there is no proper transportation to Deoghar, the nearest town, people travel either by cycle or motorcycle. Due to bad roads the cycles always need to be repaired. Gradually Deepak established his shop at Kelahabad village which is near Deoghar and has been running it for the last 10 years.  He earns around INR 250 per day. 

Earlier Deepak and his family were residing in a mud house. An IAY scheme was sanctioned for him and he constructed a proper house, adding another Rs 50,000 (from his savings) with the grant amount.

He has never defaulted on any of his borrowings till date and is running his shop successfully in the village. He is requesting this loan to buy more tools and spares for the cycle shop and he also plans to set up a grocery shop to be run by his wife.

Deepak wants save enough for his daughter’s education and marriage.

loans.use: to buy more tools and spares for the cycle repair shop

loans.name: Sol Naciente  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El grupo de crédito Sol Naciente está formado por 6 mujeres quienes con su trabajo ayudan a mejorar la economía de sus hogares para sacar adelante a sus familias, viven en  la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es de clima frió pero el calor de su gente es muy acogedor para todos los que la visitan,  su gente aun mantiene viva las llamas de su cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos, su gastronomía es muy variada la cual cautiva el paladar de sus visitantes.
Una de las socias de este grupo es la  Señorita. Evelyn, tiene 24 años de edad, es soltera y aun no ha concebido hijos, vive con sus padres con quienes comparte los gastos del hogar, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando. 
Doña Evelyn desde hace 3 años se dedica a al comercio, vende bisutería así como también compra y vende pollitos pequeños, estas actividades le dan independencia económica y así se supera en su vida personal. El dinero de su crédito va a invertir en la compra de bisutería. Su meta es crecer más en el negocio.
texts.en:
The loan group "Sol Naciente" is made up of 6 women who with their work, help to improve the economy of their households in order to move their families forward in life. They live in the city of Cuenca. This city has a cold climate, but the warmth of the people is well known to all that visit. Its people still keep alive the culture and traditions of its people. It cuisine is varied which captivates the palate of its visitors. One of the member of this group is Evelyn. Evelyn is 24 years old. She is single and does not have children. She lives with her parents with whom she shares the household expenses. They do not have their own house so they are renting.
Evelyn has been a merchant for 3 years. She sells costume jewelry for a living. She also buys and sells small chicks. These activities give her economic independence and personal success. The money from this loan will go towards the purchase of costume jewelry. Her goal is to grow more in her business.

loans.use: to buy costume jewelry.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy and apply fertilizers and more for his coffee farm.

loans.name: Vivian  Marlody

texts.es:
Ella es Vivian Marlody, en 2.013 ingresó a estudiar el programa  AUXILIAR ADMINISTRATIVO EN SALUD en la institución de educativa llamada CAMPO ALTO, Porque le pareció una buena opción a nivel educativo, además ella se inclino a  estudiar esta carrera técnica ya que le gusta ayudar a las personas,  atender el público que necesita los servicios de salud y de una manera amable sabe que les puede arreglar el día, además quiere estudiar  auditoria para así mejorar la calidad del sistema de salud de alguna manera para que la comunidad salga beneficiada.


Como la mama de Vivian es la persona que se encarga de los gastos de la casa y del estudio de ella y la hermanita, le es imposible cancelar el total del valor del semestre, ya que ella tiene ingresos de un salario mínimo legal vigente, y con el convenio que le ofrece este semestre ella podrá cancelar el semestre, por  lo que será más económico. 

Le gustaría encontrar trabajo en una EPS donde le den la oportunidad de estudiar y donde le remuneren bien por el trabajo realizado, para que  pueda pagarse los estudios futuros.

Le gustaría ayudar económicamente a la mamá con los gastos del estudio,  Ya que con ello contribuiría a que ella estuviera un poco más tranquila, al ver que hay un dinero extra y con ello se convertiría en un ejemplo a seguir para la hermana Jennifer. 

El programa de  Administración En salud  es un buen programa para conocer de cerca las necesidades que tienen los usuarios del sistema, además ofrece la posibilidad de continuar desarrollándolo, estudiando auditoria y con esto mejorar de alguna manera la calidad de los servicios en salud que necesitan las personas  diariamente.
texts.en:
This is Vivian Marlody. In 2013 she enrolled in the program of study Administrative Assistant in Health Care in the educational institution called Campo Alto, because she thought it was a good educational option. Also, she wanted to study this technical degree since she likes helping people, working with the public who need health services. She knows that she can fix their day in a friendly manner, and she also wants to study auditing so that she can improve the quality of the health system in some way so as to benefit the community.

Since Vivian's mother is the one in charge of the household expenses as well as those of Vivian and her little sister's studies, it's impossible for her to pay the full cost of the semester. She currently makes the minimum legal wage, and with the agreement offered for this semester she can pay the semester, so it will be more economical.

She would like to find work in a Health Promotion Agency (EPS) where she will have the opportunity to study and where she will be well paid for the work she does, so that she can pay for her future studies.

Vivian would like to help her mother out financially with the study expenses. It will allow her mother to feel a little more at ease to see that there is some extra money, and Vivian will become an example for her sister Jennifer to follow.

The Health Administration program is a good one to learn close-up about the needs of those who use the system, and it also offers the possibility to continue developing, studying auditing, and so then to improve in some way the quality of the health services that people need every day.

loans.use: to pay fees for a semester's enrollment

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora is 58 years old and has a live-in partner with seven children. Flora works very hard to provide for them.

Flora runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional groceries to sell in her general store.

Flora has been in this business for 38 years and sells a variety of items such as soft drinks, cigarettes, candies, beers, noodles and coffee. 

Flora would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet works hard to support her family. Janet is married and has a general store business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 15 years now.

Janet requested a loan of 14,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store. Janet would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Jose Alvaro

texts.es:
José Álvaro tiene 34 años de edad, es un pequeño productor de café del norte de Nicaragua. Su finca es de 70.42 hectáreas, de las cuales 21.12 hectáreas han sido destinadas para el rubro de café. En los últimos 3 años su producción de café ha sido de 250 a 500 quintales pergamino, y se encuentra  bajo la certificación de comercio justo (FLO). 

La visión de este pequeño emprendedor es alcanzar 28 hectáreas de café productivo, con las mejores condiciones. Para lograr esa meta, él está solicitando un financiamiento para el establecimiento de 2 hectáreas de café en este año. Con los fondos que obtenga de esta gestión podrá garantizar la compra de plantas, materiales e insumos requeridos para esta actividad.

José Álvaro está seguro que la inversión en café es rentable, dadas las condiciones climáticas donde se ubica su finca y los precios que ofrece el mercado, los cuales son menos riesgosos al estar integrado a la certificación de Comercio Justo.
texts.en:
José Álvaro is 34 years old and is a small coffee producer in northern Nicaragua. His farm is 70.42 hectares, of which 21.12 hectares have been set aside for coffee. In the last three years his production of coffee has been between 250 and 500 quintales of parchment coffee (a quintal is about 100 lb.) and his farm has Fair Trade Certification (FLO). 

The vision of this small entrepreneur is to attain 28 hectares of productive coffee with the best conditions. To achieve this goal, he is requesting a loan to establish 2 hectares of coffee this year. With the funds he gets from this transaction, he will be able to ensure the purchase of plants, materials and supplies required for this activity. 

José Álvaro is certain that investment in coffee is profitable, given the climatic conditions where his farm is located, and the prices the market offers, which are less risky by virtue of his having Fair Trade Certification.

loans.use: To establish two hectares of coffee.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Jocelyn is 37 years old and has two children who are currently in school.

Jocelyn has a rice retailing business in the Philippines. Jocelyn has been in this business for six years. Jocelyn requested a loan of 10,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice to sell. In the future, Jocelyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Josephine is 36 years old and has three children who are in school.

Josephine has a sewing business in the Philippines. Josephine requested a loan of 10,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional materials like threads, zippers, buttons, etc., for her business. Josephine has been in this business for 16 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so that she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials like threads, zippers, buttons, etc. for her business

loans.name: Nn - Ten Nua 2 Group

texts.en:
Thu is a Thai woman, living in an old traditional house with her husband and her two children. Their life is unstable because they only rely on agricultural activities, such as cultivating rice, planting vegetables and maize, and raising chickens, pigs, and buffaloes. Her children are still school-aged, thus, she puts much effort into expanding farming production, so that the children are able to fully attend school. 

Regardless of Thu's attempt, the last crop was not good and the yield decreased compared to the previous one because of bad weather. Yet, Thu is still determined to develop her business to enhance her family’s income by taking out a loan from ACE Program to buy fertilizer for the rice field. This is her first loan with ACE and she hopes that, by using this loan and knowledge from the training about agriculture by ACE, she could successfully implement her business plan. 

Thu dreams that her children will go to well-known colleges and then have good jobs and better lives than her. 

In the picture, Thu stands first from the right.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for the rice field.

loans.name: Kartik

texts.en:
Kartik (33) is from Rohani village of Jharkhand. He is married and has two sons who are studying in school. His father also lives with him. Kartik studied till 10th grade but their financial conditions did not let him study any further. He has a small grocery shop; he earns INR 6,000 per month.

Since there are a lot of competitors coming up, Kartik has started working in wholesale shop as a labourer. He plans to convert his grocery shop into a footwear shop for which he is requesting a loan of INR 18,000. He will use this loan to buy footwear and set up his shop. He also wants to purchase a water pump for his agricultural land.  

Kartik has previously taken loans from the local NGO “MESP” and repaid successfully every time. The “MESP” NGO is located in Deoghar, Jharkhand. They provide support to people in the rural areas to contribute to the income of their families and improve their living standards.

Kartik wants to earn at least enough to provide their children with education and facilities, to make them capable to stand on their own feet.

loans.use: to buy footwear in bulk for the shop

loans.name: Rohit Kumar

texts.en:
Rohit (25) is a young enterprising man from Kelahabad village, Deoghar, Jharkhand. He has studied till 7th grade. He is married and has one daughter who is studying in nursery school.  They are living together with his brother. 

Rohit has small cycle repair shop at Kapisa which is 5km away from his village. Initially he was working with his elder brother but now he has established his own shop which is running well. He earns INR 200-250 per day on average. Now his challenge is to face the competition and diversification of his business. He is also into the gas refilling business for auto-rickshaws.

Rohit had previously taken four loans from the local NGO “MESP” and repaid successfully in the stipulated time. He is requesting this loan to buy more tools needed in the cycle shop and also buy few gas cylinders to store up. He wants to save enough for his daughter’s education and for his family’s future. 

Rohit is thankful to MESP for providing the previous loans which let him expand his business. He wants to earn enough to satisfy all the basic demands of his family and is hopeful this loan will make it happen.

loans.use: to buy tools for his cycle shop

loans.name: Kereta

texts.en: Kereta is a 22-year-old single woman with no children. She makes and sells donuts and other baked goods in her community to earn a living. She has  5 years of experience with this business. Kereta needs a loan to buy a sack of flour, sugar, yeast, baking powder and dripping oil. She plans to use her profits to improve her business. Kereta has been a member of SPBD since 2014.

loans.use: to buy a sack of flour, sugar, yeast, baking powder and dripping oil.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy dripping oil, a frying pan, salt, raw bananas, raw taro and plastic bags.

loans.name: Tina

texts.en: Tina is 57 years old and married with 3 children. She owns and operates a business venture, making elei clothing. She has 4 years of experience in this line of business. Tina needs a loan to buy colored fabric paints, brushes, materials, stencils and an elei carved board. She hopes to use her profits to improve her business. She joined SPBD in 2014.

loans.use: to buy color fabric, paints, brushes, materials, stencils and an elei carved board.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fabric, colored paint, brushes, stencils, gloves and an elei carved board.

loans.name: Dios Es Amor Group

texts.es: El grupo “Dios Es Amor” está conformada por 06 mujeres trabajadoras y luchadoras que han ido mejorando con el transcurso del tiempo. Ella es Kela una socia de 37 años, casada con 04 hijos  dependientes. Kela se dedica a la venta de comidas como el cebiche. Gracias a su negocio y perseverancia a logrado mejorar su vivienda. Su último crédito lo destinará para la compra de pescado, cebolla, limón y camote. El deseo de Kela  es de ampliar su negocio pues así asegura ella tendrá mayores ganancias. El grupo “Dios Es Amor” agradece a los inversionistas Kiva por el apoyo brindado. Kela es la segunda del lado izquierdo y viste polo blanco.
texts.en: The "God is Love" group is comprised of 6 hard-working, fighting women who are improving their lives over time. One of these women is Kela, a 37-year-old member who is married and has four dependent children. Kela is in the business of selling foods, such as ceviche. Thanks to her business and her hard work, she has been able to improve her home. Her last loan will be used to buy fish, onion, lime, and sweet potato. Kela wants to expand her business and guarantee herself greater income. The "God is Love" group is grateful to Kiva investors for the support they provide.  In the picture, Kela is the second from the left side in the white polo.

loans.use: buy fish, onion, lime, and sweet potato for her food production business

loans.name: Santa Barbara Group

texts.es:
El comité  Santa Barbara se formó con la unión de varias vecinas de la ciudad de Santaní, ellas son de una zona bastante alejada de esa ciudad, que aún está en crecimiento.
Todas ellas se dedican a actividades rurales, como ser la cría y venta de animales de corral. Una de ellas es Luciana, ella cría animales como ser gallinas, cerdos, patos y demás, día a día lucha por poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de su familia.
Luciana pide este préstamo para poder comprar balanceados para seguir criando los animales que tiene. Agradece por la oportunidad que está recibiendo de seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
The Santa Barbara communal bank was formed through the coming together of several neighbors in the city of Santaní. They are from an area that is quite a distance from that growing city. All of them work in agriculture, such as the raising and sale of farmyard animals.  

One of them is Luciana, and  she raises animals such as chickens, pigs, ducks and others, striving day by day to improve her living conditions and those of her family. 

Luciana is requesting this loan so that she can buy balanced feed and keep raising the animals she has. She is grateful for the opportunity she is receiving to continue growing.

loans.use: To buy balanced feed for animals.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for eight years and works hard to support her family. 

She requested a 16,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy additional boxes of fish to sell.

Juliet would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Librada

texts.en:
Librada is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years and earns more income from a general store.

She is borrowing 17,000 PHP through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Librada has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is 48 years old and has four children. She is married and has one child who is currently in school.

She is in the agricultural business and fattens pigs in the Philippines. Lolita has been in the pig fattening business for 30 years.

Lolita requested an 11,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs. She has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Ma. Ciela

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Ma. Ciela works hard to support her family. She has a manicure/pedicure service business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. Ma. Ciela is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional materials like nail polish, nipper, etc. for her business.

Ma. Ciela has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional materials like nail polish, nipper, etc. for her business

loans.name: José Angel

texts.es:
José Angel es un pequeño emprendedor de 34 años que vive en su parcela de 1.4 hectáreas en una zona de alto potencial productivo al norte de Nicaragua. Trabaja como jornalero en fincas de su comunidad, y además cultiva café en la mitad de su parcela, para la cual está solicitando un financiamiento que le permita garantizar el suministro de insumos necesarios para el fortalecimiento y vigor de la plantación cuya edad es de 3 a 4 años.

Con este crédito, José Angel estará garantizando los requerimientos de nutrición del café establecido. El dice: “la verdad que mi finca es pequeña y no puedo seguir estableciendo nuevas áreas todavía, solo darle el manejo adecuado a las que tengo”. Por lo tanto, su meta es incrementar los rendimientos productivos y pasar de 60 a 80 quintales de café pergamino en este ciclo, a fin de mejorar sus ingresos y las condiciones de su familia.
texts.en:
José Angel is a 34-year-old entrepreneur who lives on a 1.4 acre plot in a highly productive area north of Nicaragua. He works as a laborer on farms in his community and also grows coffee in the middle of his plot. He is requesting a loan for the supplies needed for strengthening the 3-4 year-old plantation.

With this loan, José Angel will be able to ensure the nutrition requirements of the coffee. He says, "The truth is that my farm is small and I cannot continue to develop new areas, just give proper handling to the area I do have." Therefore, his goal is to increase production yields and exceed 60 to 80 quintals of parchment coffee in this cycle to improve both his income and the conditions of his family.

loans.use: to buy supplies and fertilizers for his coffee plantation.

loans.name: Nelson José

texts.es:
Nelson es un productor de 30 años que vive junto a su esposa y su pequeña hija de 4 años en una comunidad de la zona norte de Nicaragua. En su pequeña finca siembra granos básicos para autoconsumo, y cuenta con 8.6 hectáreas de café, de las cuales obtuvo una producción de 230 quintales de café pergamino en el último ciclo.

Para este joven, los cambios climáticos en los últimos años han venido generando mayor afectación de plagas y enfermedades en el café, lo cual ha enfrentado con un buen manejo agronómico y la renovación de plantas. No obstante, para mejorar la calidad de su café este joven está solicitando un financiamiento para la construcción de un beneficio húmedo que le permita darle el manejo adecuado a su producción.

El está seguro que con un manejo en la etapa de producción y procesamiento del café, logrará mejores rendimientos y precio que le permitirá hacer frente a estas inversiones, así como a las necesidades de su pequeña familia.
texts.en:
Nelson is a 30-year-old coffee producer who lives with his wife and their small four-year-old daughter in a community in northern Nicaragua. On his small farm he grows basic staples for his family's consumption, and has 8.6 hectares of coffee, from which he obtained an output of 230 quintales of parchment coffee in the last growing cycle (a quintal is about 100 lb.).

For this young man, the climate change of recent years has gradually generated a greater incidence of pests and plant diseases in the coffee, which he has dealt with through good agricultural management and the renewal of plants. 

Nevertheless, to improve the quality of his coffee, this man is requesting a loan to build a coffee wet mill, which will allow him to handle his production properly. He is certain that with proper management in the stage of production and processing of coffee, he will achieve better yields and prices, which will allow him to deal with these investments as well as the needs of his small family.

loans.use: To build a coffee processing mill.

loans.name: Savitri

texts.en:
Savitri is 54 years old and living in Rohani village, Deoghar, Jharkhand. She never went to school as her family did not allow her to. She is married and her husband works as a labourer. She has four sons; three of them have a job in the private sector while one son is working in a government office as a contract employee. 

The village is the one of the remotest in the region and even lacks basic amenities like pakka houses (not made of concrete and mortar), electricity, etc. But the village is rich in spirit and ideas of its women folk who want to be something in life. And this change in attitude has been brought by the continuous efforts of a local NGO MESP.

At this age Savitri is energetic and wants to work and not be dependent on her sons. She runs a dairy farm. She is supported in her endeavour by her family. Now she wants to make it bigger to become sustainable and leave her mark in the village.

The loan she is requesting will be used to buy two cows. She hopes this will help her to reduce her husband’s work as a laborer. She wants to save enough for her old age.

loans.use: to buy two cows

loans.name: Sheela

texts.en:
Rohani village and Deoghar district of Jharkhand are prominent for dairy development. The demand for milk is increasing day by day. Dairy farming is a commercial venture in this area, in view of the fact that Deoghar is famous for Peda (a sweet made out of milk). Now milk is being supplied from surrounding areas and from other districts also.

Sheela is 53 years old and married, living in a hut. She is a mother of two sons and a daughter Her daughter is married, one son is working as a labourer and other son doesn’t work and stays at home. Her husband works as a labourer and earns around INR 5,000 per month while her son earns around INR 3,000 per month. 

Sheela has a cow and sells milk every day in the market. Now she wants to add one more cow and for this she seeks a loan of INR 10,000. This will increase her business viability and also be a way to engage her son in the business. 

They usually have no money left for cultivation so they borrow it from the money lender who charges 60-70% interest. Thus, all the income generated from agriculture is eaten by the money lender. 

Sheela hopes to invest the surplus income earned due to this loan in cultivation and the income from cultivation to buy more cows. In this way she wants to break the debt trap.

loans.use: to buy another cow and involve her son in the dairy business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for an efficient cooking gas package

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es: Juan es soltero no tiene hijos, vive en El Alto en una casa de ladrillo y cemento que le pertenece a sus parientes, Juan se gana la vida como arquitecto, necesita credito para comprar herramientas Juan es la {unica fuente de ingresos en su hogar por lo que necesita su ayuda
texts.en: Juan is single, and he does not have children.  He lives in El Alto in a brick and cement house that belongs to his relatives.  Juan earns a living as an architect.  He needs the loan to buy tools.  Juan is the only source of income in his household, and that is why he needs your help.

loans.use: to buy materials for his architecture business.

loans.name: Harold Armando

texts.es:
Harold es un joven emprendedor de 21 años, que está comenzando a trabajar de manera independiente en la producción de café. Cuenta con una pequeña finca de 3.5 hectáreas de las cuales 1.5 son de café. Su familia siempre se ha dedicado a la caficultura, y desde hace unos 2 años este joven está cultivando por cuenta propia su café. 

Este joven dice que “uno de los principales desafíos que se enfrentan en el cultivo de café son los bajos rendimientos, pero yo estoy seguro que con un buen manejo y con la implementación de técnicas como el análisis de suelo, voy a superarlos”.

Para garantizar el mantenimiento de su cafetal, Harold está solicitando un crédito que le permita asegurar la implementación de técnicas e insumos requeridos por su plantación de café, a fin de obtener mejores rendimientos y calidad en este ciclo productivo.

Su conocimiento en este rubro y la rentabilidad estimada, le permitirá ir creciendo en esta actividad y con ello ir mejorando las condiciones de la familia que está comenzando a formar.
texts.en:
Harold is a young entrepreneur. He is 21 years old. He is just started his own business in the production of coffee. He has a small farm of 3.5 hectares of which 1.5 are coffee. His family was always in coffee agriculture for a living and he has been cultivating his own coffee for 2 years.

This youth says that "one of the main challenges that is faced in coffee cultivation is low yields, but I am sure that with good management and with the implementation of techniques such as soil analysis, I am going to overcome them".

To guarantee the maintenance of his coffee crops, Harold is requesting a loan that will allow him to assure the implementation of techniques and the required inputs for his coffee crops in order to obtain better yields and quality in this production cycle.

His knowledge in his field and the estimated profitability will allow him to grow in this activity, and continue improving the conditions of his family that is beginning to form.

loans.use: for the purchase of inputs required for his plantation.

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
Mujeres Emprendedoras se llama este grupo, y lleva ese nombre ya que todas son mujeres emprendedoras, madres de familia, que están luchando por sus seres queridos. Una de ellas es la Sra. Paulina, quien se dedica a la cría y venta de animales de corral, como ser gallinas, pollitos, cerdos y demás.
Paulina es una mujer muy luchadora, que con sacrificio y trabajo está tratando de mejorar sus condiciones de vida. Su trabajo es muy humilde, pero gracias a esto tiene para el día a día y no pasa necesidades.
Hoy pide este préstamo para comprar balanceados para sus animales, que le permitirá seguir luchando y creciendo como lo viene haciendo, además de eso agradece por esta oportunidad que esta recibiendo.
texts.en:
This group is called "Mujeres Emprendedoras" (Enterprising Women), and bears that name because all are enterprising women; parents who are striving for their loved ones.  

One of them is Paulina, who raises and sells farmyard animals, such as hens, chicks, pigs and others. Paulina is a very determined woman, who with sacrifice and work is trying to improve her living conditions. Her work is very humble, but thanks to this she is able to meet her daily needs, and is not experiencing privations. 

Now she is requesting this loan in order to buy balanced feed for her animals, which will allow her to continue striving and growing as she has been doing. In addition to that, she is grateful for this opportunity that she is receiving.

loans.use: To buy balanced feed for animals.

loans.name: Mujeres Trabajando Juntas Group

texts.es:
Este Grupo se llama “Mujeres Trabajando Juntas” forma parte del programa de comité de mujeres, donde también están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Maria, quien entre el trabajo que ella hace cuenta que vende empanadas y asaditos todas las noches, también se debe destacar el trabajo y gran esfuerzo que ella está haciendo para poder salir adelante y crecer. Maria quiere tener algún día un negocio grande de venta de comidas, con lo cual podrá seguir dando a su familia todo lo que ella no pudo tener. 
La Sra. solicita de este préstamo para la compra de sus ingredientes para la venta de comestibles, como ser carne, verduras, condimentos, harina, huevo y demás insumos para seguir haciendo sus comidas. Agradece por la oportunidad que está recibiendo de seguir creciendo y luchando.
texts.en:
This group is called “Mujeres Trabajando Juntas,” and is part of the women's communal bank program, where they are also participating in the poverty elimination survey.

One of the members is Maria, who among the jobs she does, says that she sells empanadas and fast foods every night.  Also to be highlighted is the work she is doing and the great effort she is making to get ahead in life and grow. 

Maria wants to someday have a large business selling meals, with which she will be able to continue giving her family everything that she was not able to have. 

She is requesting this loan to purchase ingredients for selling food, such as meat, vegetables, condiments, flour, eggs and other supplies she needs to continue making her meals. 

She is grateful for the opportunity she is receiving to continue growing and striving.

loans.use: To buy meat, vegetables, condiments, flour, eggs, and other ingredients.

loans.name: Luis

texts.es:
El Sr. Luis es una persona muy trabajadora, es dueño de un Copetín y además tiene piezas que alquila para vivienda. El Sr. Luis es casado, su esposa también trabaja, y tienen un hijo pequeño en edad escolar, por quien están luchando para poder darle una vida digna.
Luis quiere seguir trabajando y luchando por su familia y sus seres queridos. Pide este préstamo para la compra de materiales de construcción, con lo que podrá refaccionar su local que alquila, y de esa forma seguir luchando. Agradece por esta oportunidad que esta recibiendo.
texts.en:
Luis is a very hard-working person.  He has a snack bar.  He also has rooms that he rents to live in.  Luis is married, and his wife also works.  They have a small, school age son for whom they are struggling to give a decent life.

Luis wants to continue working and struggling for his family and his loved ones.  He is requesting this loan to buy construction materials.  He will use them to be able to refurbish the place that he rents.  This way he will continue struggling.  He is grateful for this opportunity that he is receiving.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to refurbish the places that he rents.

loans.name: Kuña Guapa Group

texts.es:
Este grupo está haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de la pobreza, donde cada una de ellas quiere ir superando su situación de pobreza por medio del trabajo en conjunto y gracias a las capacitaciones que van recibiendo.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Myrian, quien en su última encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel dos, es decir que está en un nivel medio, por lo que debe seguir trabajando y luchando por mejorar su vida. Ella se dedica a la peluquería, y tiene un negocio con el cual lucha para poder dar a su familia lo mejor y lo que no pudo tener, se ha hecho de muy buena clientela, que con esfuerzo se la ha ganado.
Pide este préstamo ya que quiere comprar tintes, shampoo, enjuagues, cremas y demás productos, ya que quiere seguir trabajando y luchando por mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
This group is participating in the poverty elimination survey, where each of them wants to gradually overcome their poverty situation by working together and thanks to the training they are receiving.

One of the members is Myrian, who in her last survey showed a level of poverty within the number two level; that is to say she is at a medium level, so she must continue working and striving to improve her life. 

She is a hairdresser and has a business where she strives to be able to give her family the best and what she was not able to have. She has acquired a very good clientele, which was earned with effort. She is requesting this loan because she wants to buy hair dyes, shampoo, rinses, creams, and other products, as she wants to continue working and striving to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy hair dyes, shampoo, rinses, creams and other products.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase large bags of grain.

loans.name: Ma. Gina

texts.en:
Ma. Gina is a married woman with four children. She is 49 years old and has one child who is still in school. Ma. Gina is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Ma. Gina has a food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a 23,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase ingredients like meat, fish, vegetables and spices for her business. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Ma. Gina has been in this business for eight years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients like meat, fish, vegetables and spices for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: plant an additional 2 hectares of coffee.

loans.name: Arnulfo

texts.es: Don Arnulfo, tiene 62 años de edad, vive con su esposa y sus 4 hijos en una aldea que pertenece a Nueva Frontera, Santa Bárbara. Tiene 15 años de dedicarse al cultivo de café, el cual vende en grano o en oro, el siempre se ha dedicado a la agricultura cultivando maíz y frijol. Esta solicitando un segundo préstamo por 15,000 lempiras con el cual va comprar fertilizantes y utilizara para limpieza de su finca. Su propósito es mejorar las condiciones del cultivo para sacar mejor cosecha y ayudar a su familia.
texts.en: Don Arnulfo, age 62, lives with his wife and their four children in a village that belongs to Nueva Frontera, Santa Bárbara. He has fifteen years of experience in the coffee-growing business, selling both roasted and unroasted beans. He has always been in agriculture, having grown corn and beans in the past. He is requesting a second loan for 15,000 lempiras, which he will use to buy fertilizers and clean his farm land. His goal is to improve growing conditions, have a better harvest, and help his family.

loans.use: clean up his farm and buy fertilizers for coffee plants.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for her daughter's education.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase an air conditioner, a TV, a face massage device and a chair.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for her son's school fees.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for his son’s education.

loans.name: Om- Sadam Group

texts.en:
Om- Sadam is a group consisting of five women, all living in Hodeidah, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 140,000 YER from AMB.

Yasamin, a member of the group, is a 38-year-old married woman with eight children. Her oldest child is 18, and the youngest is a year old. This big family lives in a simple house in a poor area. It is difficult for Yasamin's husband to provide the necessities for his children alone so she decided to help her husband in covering the expenses of the family. For two years, she has had a business selling incense and perfumes door to door to the local residents. She earns a good profit from this business, but she spends most of it on the expenses of the family. She wants to enlarge her business, but her balance is still low. For this reason, she applied for a loan from AMB in order to purchase more perfumes and incense to resell to her customers.

In the future, Yasamin plans to open a cafeteria in her area, which will help her provide her family with a lot of money.

loans.use: to purchase more perfumes and incense to resell

loans.name: Ma. Magdalina

texts.en:
Ma. Magdalina is a married woman with three children, two of whom are in school. She is 51 years old and a very hard working entrepreneur.

Ma. Magdalina has a video game machine rental business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for three years. She requested a 23,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy an additional video game machine for her business.

Ma. Magdalina would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy an additional video game machine

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase sheep to raise and sell.

loans.name: Maria Dolores

texts.en:
Maria Dolores works hard to support her family. She is married and has a frozen food vending business in the Philippines.

Maria Dolores has been in this business for 5 years now. She requested a PHP 14000 loan through NWTF to purchase more packs of frozen food to sell. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Maria Dolores would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more packs of frozen food to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more livestock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase construction materials such as cement, bricks and wood.

loans.name: Yeslem

texts.en:
Yaslem is a 51-year-old married man with four children; they live in a house in Mokala, Yemen. His oldest child is 17 years old and the youngest is one year old. Yaslem studied through elementary school, but because of the miserable conditions his family was living in, he couldn't complete his study. The main source of income for people in Mokala is raising and reselling livestock, a livelihood whose knowledge Yaslem inherited from his parents.

Currently, Yaslem has a small number of goats, but he wants to increase his capital. For this reason, he applied for a loan of 70,000 YER to buy more livestock to raise and resell.
 
Yeslem's dream is to have a large farm that will allow him to generate the financial income he needs to improve his family's living condition.

loans.use: to buy more livestock to raise and sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to replace his aging motorcycle for his transport business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase building materials such as as cement and new wood to repair his house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies with which to tend to her coffee plantations

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for equipment for efficient cooking energy from liquefied petroleum gas.

loans.name: Pablo

texts.es: Pablo lleva 12 años de matrimonio y tiene dos hijos, la familia vive en la comunidad de Barco Belen en una casa de ladrillo y cemento que es propia y tiene tanto luz como agua Aunque Pablo es profesor de escuela rural se dedica a la venta de leche para ganar más dinero, su esposa se encarga del ordeño y la leche es vendida en la comunidad, por lo que necesita credito para comprar una vaca lechera que le permita incrementar su producción y le asegure un contrato con plantas industrializadoras de leche. Pablo es confiable por lo que se recomienda ayudarlo En la foto aparece Pablo con su esposa y uno de sus hijos
texts.en:
Pablo has been married for 12 years and has two children. The family lives in the community of Barco Belen, in a house made of brick and cement that belongs to him and has both electricity and running water. 

Although Pablo is a teacher in a rural school, he sells milk to earn more money. His wife is responsible for the milking, and the milk is sold in the community. He needs credit to buy a milk cow, which will allow him to increase his production and assure him of a contract with the dairies. Pablo is reliable, so it is recommended to help him. Pablo appears in the photo with his wife and one of his children.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow for his business selling milk.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy construction materials needed to renovate his house.

loans.name: Maria Antonia

texts.es: Doña María, tiene 66 años de edad, es madre soltera, vive con una hija y sus nietos en una colonia que pertenece al municipio de Choloma, Cortes. Toda su vida la ha dedicado al negocio, ella elabora comidas como ser pastelitos rellenos con carne, tacos, enchiladas etc. SU venta es ambulante vende en las empresas. Ha solicitado varios préstamo a la institución para realizar su actividad. Actualmente solicita otro por 10,000 Lempiras y los va invertir en la compra de insumos como harina de maíz, carnes, plástico para empaque, platos, condimentos, repollo salsas etc. Tiene como plan seguir trabajando y sueña con tener establecido su negocio en la casa.
texts.en:
María is 66 years old, a single mother, and lives with her daughter and grandchildren in a neighborhood that is part of the municipality of Choloma, Cortes. All her life she has had small businesses. 

She makes food such as pastries stuffed with meat, tacos, enchiladas etc. She sells door-to-door at businesses. She has requested several loans to carry out this work. Now she is requesting another for 10,000 lempiras, and is going to use the money to purchase supplies such as corn flour, meats, plastic packaging, plates, condiments, cabbage, sauces etc. Her plan is to continue working, and she dreams of setting up her business in her home.

loans.use: To buy supplies such as corn flour, meats, plastic packaging, plates, condiments, cabbage, sauces etc. for making her meals and selling them.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for a more efficient cooking gas package.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for a more efficient liquefied petroleum gas cooking package.

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es:
Miguel Angel es un joven de la zona norte de Nicaragua que desde pequeño ha estado relacionado con el cultivo de café. Está casado y tiene dos hijos de 10 y 12 años los cuales estudian en la escuela de la comunidad donde viven. Desde hace más de 5 años cuenta con una finca de 4.2 hectáreas; de éstas 2.8 son de café, y en los últimos 3 ciclos le han producido un promedio de 135 quintales de café pergamino.

Para este joven emprendedor, el café es su principal actividad económica, y considera que es un rubro rentable si se atiende correctamente. Por lo tanto, está solicitando un crédito que le permita implementar en tiempo y forma los insumos y la mano de obra necesaria para el manejo de su plantación. Con la ejecución de estos recursos en las actividades planteadas, Miguel Angel está seguro mejorará la calidad y productividad de su finca, en particular de su cafetal.

Sus planes son seguir invirtiendo en el establecimiento de nuevas áreas de café, para alcanzar su sueño de llegar a producir unos 600 quintales de café pergamino por ciclo, para mejorar las condiciones de su familia.
texts.en:
Miguel Angel is a young man from northern Nicaragua who has been involved in the cultivation of coffee since he was a small child. He is married and has two children, aged 10 and 12, who study at the local school. For more than five years he has had a 4.2 hectare farm, including 2.8 hectares of coffee. Over the last three harvests he has produced an average of 135 quintals (hundredweight) of parchment coffee.

For this young entrepreneur, coffee is his main activity, and he believes it is a profitable source of income if looked after properly. He is therefore seeking a loan which will allow him to apply the inputs and labour needed on his plantation in a timely and effective fashion. With the employment of these resources in his farming activities, Miguel Angel is sure that he will improve the quality and productivity of his land, in particular of his coffee plantation. 

His plans for the future are to continue investing in establishing new areas of coffee, in order to realise his dream of producing 600 quintals of parchment coffee per cycle, and so improve his family's standard of living.

loans.use: to apply the inputs and labour needed on his coffee plantation.

loans.name: Edwin

texts.es: Edwin vive en concubinato desde hace 3 años y tiene dos hijos, la familia vive en la comunidad de Chijipina Grande en una casa de ladrillo y cemento que tiene luz y agua Edwin es costurero pero quiere cambiarse al negocio del ganado, la venta de leche y la producción de queso, por lo que necesita credito para comprar dos terneras para empezar su negocio Edwin es la unica fuente de ingresos en su hogar por eso necesita su ayuda, ya que la costura no rinde como Edwin quiere y necesita que su familia tenga mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en: Edwin has lived with his common-law partner for three years and he has two children. The family lives in the Chijipina Grande community in a house made of brick and cement that has electricity and water. Edwin is a tailor, but he wants to get into the business of cattle, selling milk and producing cheese. This is why he needs the loan to buy two calves to start his business. Edwin is the only source of income in his home, therefore he needs help, since the tailor business does not do as well as Edwin would like and since he needs his family to have better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy two calves to start his cattle business.

loans.name: Las Vecinas  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El grupo de crédito Las Vecinas está formado por 10 socias quienes son amigas y vecinas, viven en diferentes lugares de la ciudad de Cuenca, este lugar que es de clima frió, por su gran belleza arquitectónica fue nombrada en Diciembre de  1999 como Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad, su cultura y tradiciones aun son mantenidas por su gente. Las socias son personas amables, gentiles de un corazón cálido el mismo que enamora a todos sus visitantes por su carisma, se caracterizan por ser trabajadores laborando arduamente cada día para mejorar la economía de sus hogares para sacar  adelante a  sus familias.
Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Margarita tiene 51 años de edad, está divorciada pero en su unión conyugal ha concebido 3 hijos mayores de edad, dos de ellos son casados y viven independientes, su hijo soltero trabaja y ayuda con los gastos de la casa, la casa en la que vive es de herederos.
Doña Margarita se dedica a la atención de su tienda, trabaja de domingo a domingo sin un horario fijo, este trabajo es su pasión. 
El dinero de su crédito va a  invertir en la compra de víveres para su tienda y así aumentar su mercadería. Su meta es agrandar su negocio.
La foto pequeña es de una socia que no pudo estar presente cuando se tomo la foto del grupo.
texts.en:
The credit group "Las Vecinas" (The Neighbor women) is comprised of 10 members who are friends and neighbors. They live in different parts of the city of Cuenca, a cold climate area noted for its beautiful architecture. In December 1999, it was named part of the Cultural Heritage of Humanity, and its culture and traditions are still maintained by its people.  The members are friendly people, kind and warm-hearted, who charm visitors. They are hard workers who work hard every day to improve their household economies and get their families ahead.

One of the members is Mrs. Margarita, age 51. She is divorced, but has three grown children from her marriage. Two are married and live independently, and her single son works and helps with the household expenses. They inherited the house they live in. Margarita runs a store. She works Sunday to Sunday without a fixed schedule. Her work is her passion. The money from the loan will be invested in the purchase of supplies for her store to expand her merchandise. Her goal is to expand her business. 

The inset photo is of a member who could not be present when the group picture was taken.

loans.use: buy supplies for her general store

loans.name: Simoneides

texts.en:
Simoneides is 25 years old and lives in Centro Napu, Tudela, Philippines. He is single with no children. 

Simoneides has a beauty parlor business and earns approximately PHP 3,500 each month doing this type of work. He has requested a loan to buy additional beauty products.

Simoneides has been a member of PMPC for five years. In the future, Simoneides hopes to be able to save for future emergencies.

loans.use: to buy additional beauty products

loans.name: Melinda

texts.en:
Melinda is 43 years old and married with two children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Melinda runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items like snack foods, shampoo, soft drinks, sugar, bread, milk, cereals, sanitary napkins and other groceries to sell.

Melinda has been in this business for 13 years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, shampoo, soft drinks, sugar, bread, milk, cereals, sanitary napkins and other groceries.

In the future, Melinda would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items like snack foods, shampoo, soft drinks, sugar, bread, milk, cereals, sanitary napkins and other groceries to sell

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Rosario is married and lives in the Philippines. For the past 15 years, she has run a business selling purified water and soft-drinks. Rosario works hard to support her family. 

Rosario is requesting a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more cases of soft-drinks and containers of purified drinking water to sell. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase soft-drinks and purified drinking water to sell

loans.name: Sylvia

texts.en:
Sylvia works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Sylvia requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Sylvia has been in this business for five years now.

In the future, Sylvia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma is 50 years old and married with four children. For the past ten years, she has run a general store in the Philippines where she sells a variety of items such as soy sauce, canned goods, soft drinks, diapers, toothpaste, and other products. Thelma works very hard to provide for her family.

Thelma is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks such as soy sauce, canned goods, soft drinks, diapers, and toothpaste to sell. In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase soy sauce, canned goods, soft drinks, diapers, and toothpaste

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 43 years old and has two children who are currently in school.

Vilma has a business buying and selling multi-cabs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 25,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional multi-cabs to sell.

Vilma has been in this business for five years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional multi-cabs to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more goats to raise and resell.

loans.name: Sarab Group

texts.en:
This group is called Sarab and is composed of four women.  They applied for a loan of 90,000 YER from AMB.

The president of the group is Hajer. She is a 26-year-old, married woman, and has two children.  Her oldest child is 6 years old and the youngest one is 2 years old. She studied till elementary school, but she couldn't complete her studies, because she got married when she was very young. Due to the harsh conditions inside the family, Hajer decided to seek any business in order to provide her family with the necessary needs. She started her own business with a little amount of money as a cosmetologist.

In 2013, Hajer started her own business in making up women and brides in her area. Now, she is a famous cosmetologist in her area and works door to door. Unfortunately, she lacks the main capital in order to enlarge her business, and her income is still low. Most of her interests go to the expenses of her family. For this reason, she is requesting a loan of 20,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase makeup, cosmetics, accessories, and other items.
 
Hajer looks forward to providing her children with a lot of money and improving the living standards of the family.  Her dreams are to open a beauty salon beside her house. She relies on your support.

loans.use: to purchase makeup, cosmetics, accessories, and other items.

loans.name: Elamor

texts.en:
Elamor is a 20-year-old student working to meet her educational demands as well as her financial demands. She works part-time as a substitute teacher and is attending school. Elamor simply does not have all the needed funds to pay her tuition in full. 

Elamor is requesting a loan to pay her tuition. Her loan is part of KIEDF's efforts to finance school tuition for students from low-income families. Funds can be used for partial or complete payment of expenses related to higher education. By supporting Elamor’s loan, you're enabling access to education for students with limited options.

loans.use: to pay her tuition

loans.name: Angie Lorena

texts.es:
Ella es Angie Lorena, le apasiona la enfermería porque considera que es el arte de cuidar a través de circunstancias tanto físicas como de otro tipo con las que conviven los pacientes en el día a día. Esta profesión para el concepto de ella, pretende unificar un lazo no solo de enfermera-paciente sino de dos personas que se ponen el uno en el lugar del otro conformando una amistad que al final beneficiara  a ambos, la enfermera trata de entender al paciente, de guiarlo y ayudarlo, de cuidarlo, bañarlo, pero más que todo de dialogar con él y con los familiares, haciéndoles entender la situación en la que se encuentran y que hay que hacer para salir de ella, la enfermera no es solo alguien que  viene y va haciendo lo que le mandan, es una amiga, es quien cuida. 
Desde muy pequeña sintió  un gusto por la profesión de enfermería, imaginando cuando y como sería el momento en que interactuara con un paciente, en el  pensamiento siempre ha sentido el gusto y la pasión por ejercer como profesional de la salud, quiere ayudar a los pacientes a la recuperación. 
Ahora con 18 años de edad, se da cuenta del  papel tan importante que realiza la enfermería en la vida, a poco tiempo de iniciar las prácticas,  la emoción la  invade y junto a ello la felicidad de lograr y culminar prontamente  algunas de las metas para comenzar a generar un cambio en cuanto a la visión de enfermería en muchas personas que hacen parte de esta profesión. 
En este momento ella solicita del convenio con kiva ya que no cuenta con los recursos económicos suficientes para poder pagar el valor de las cuotas en el precio normal, ya que ella tiene otros gastos y lo que más necesita es economizar un poco de dinero, ella estaría muy agradecida si logra ser favorecida con este convenio y la ayuda que le pueden dar.
texts.en:
This is Angie Lorena. She is passionate about nursing because she believes it is the art of caring for people in their physical circumstances and also in other circumstances, such as those the patients live with day to day. This profession, in her opinion, tries to unify a bond not only in the sense of nurse-patient, but also in the sense of two people who put themselves in the other’s shoes, forming a friendship that, in the end, benefits both. The nurse tries to understand the patient, to guide and help him or her, to care for him/her, to bathe him/her. But the most important of all is to talk with him/her and with the family members, helping them to understand the situation in which they find themselves and how to work through it. The nurse isn’t just someone who comes and goes, doing what she is told; she is a friend, she is one who cares.

From the time she was very young, she had an interest in the profession of nursing, imagining when and how it would be the first time she interacted with a patient. She has always felt a liking and passion for working as a health professional. She wants to help patients during their recuperation.

Now, at 18 years old, she understands what an important role nursing plays in life. So soon after beginning the practice [portion of her program], she feels excitement and also the happiness of achieving and finishing quickly some of her goals so she can begin to change the vision of nursing held by many members of this profession.

At this time she is requesting a loan from Kiva because she doesn’t have sufficient economic resources to pay her tuition at the normal price. She has other expenses and what she most needs is to stretch her money a bit.  She would be very grateful if she were to be granted this loan and the support you can give her.

loans.use: to pay a semester of tuition.

loans.name: Graciela

texts.es: Graciela es soltera, no tiene hijos, vive en La Paz en una casa de acabado fino que le pertenece a sus padres. Graciela se dedica al comercio minorista de artículos de belleza también vende joyas de plata y de fantasía, En esta ocasión Graciela necesita un crédito para comprar mayor cantidad de joyas de plata y de fantasía para hacer crecer su negocio Graciela es la única fuente de ingresos en el hogar por lo que necesita su ayuda
texts.en:
Graciela is single and she does not have children. She lives in La Paz in a finished house that belongs to her parents. Graciela has a retail business, selling beauty products and also silver and costume jewelry.  

At this time, Graciela needs a loan in order to purchase a larger quantity of silver and costume jewelry so that she can grow her business. Graciela is the only source of income for her home, and this is why she needs your help.

loans.use: to purchase a larger quantity of silver and costume jewelry.

loans.name: Menge

texts.en: Menge is a married man. He has seven children with ages ranging from 3 years to 19 years. He describes himself as optimistic. He operates a retail business where he sells soft drinks. He has been involved in this business for 20 years. His business is located in a productive area and his primary customers are other business people and area residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be limited space. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to rent more business premise space. His business goal is to own a big distribution warehouse within five years. He hopes that in the future he will improve the welfare of his family. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to rent more business premise space

loans.name: Mourice

texts.en:
Mourice is a married man who has ten children. He describes himself to be determined. 

Mourice operates a tailoring business where he makes clothes, and he has been involved in this business for three years. His business is located in a populated area and his primary customers are regular customers. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of funds. 

Mourice will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy fabric, thread and other tailoring materials. His business goal is to have a tailoring school within five years. He hopes that in the future he will have sufficient cash flow to support his family. He will use the anticipated profits to pay for school fees for his children and save the rest.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread and other tailoring materials

loans.name: Winfridah

texts.en:
Winfridah is a 34-year-old married woman. She has three children ranging in age from eight to fifteen years. She describes herself to be focused. 

Winfridah operates a retail business where she sells charcoal, and she has been involved in this business for ten years. Her business is located in a good area. She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more stock of charcoal. Her business goal is to have several business outlets within five years. 

Winfridah hopes that in the future she will serve her community diligently. This is her fifth loan with SMEP DTM and her previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of charcoal

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda works hard to support her family. Merlinda is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Merlinda requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Merlinda has been in this business for 6 years now.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her general store business.

Merlinda would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional containers of purified drinking water to sell

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a coconut husk vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy more coconut husk to sell.

Milagros has been in this business for 26 years. Milagros earns more income from coconut wine vending.

Milagros has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more coconut husk to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase specialty cloth, materials, beading, and a sewing machine

loans.name: John Jairo

texts.es:
John se gana la vida como mensajero, trabajo que alterna con la venta de cigarrillo en el municipio de Medellín, Colombia.
Emprendió su negocio luego de sufrir un grave accidente remodelando su vivienda, ya que se desplomo el muro que estaba construyendo y lo impacto fuertemente, esto hizo que la empresa para la cual trabajo durante 10 años decidiera liquidarlo por el tratamiento tan extenso y las heridas tan severas que sufrió en su pierna.
Pero esto no detuvo a John, que su motivación más grande es poder ver a sus dos hijos completamente realizados.
En estos momentos John espera poder pensionarse y darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia, por eso solicita un crédito para comprar mercancía y surtir su negocio, ofreciendo así mayor variedad de productos a sus clientes para lograr su fidelización.
Este hombre nunca ha dejado de luchar por sus ideales, y a sus 52 años aún se le nota enérgico y con ganas de progresar.
texts.en:
John makes his living as a courier, a job he alternates with selling cigarettes in the city of Medellín, Colombia.  He launched his business after suffering a serious accident while remodeling his home.  The wall he was building collapsed and struck him hard.  Then the company for which he had been working for ten years decided to fire him because of the extensive treatment and severe leg wounds he suffered.  
But this didn't stop John, whose primary motivation is the hope of seeing his two children completely fulfilled.  At present John is hoping to be able to receive a pension and give his family a better quality of life.  He requests a loan to buy merchandise and stock his business so he can offer a wider variety of products to his customers and earn their loyalty.  This man has never given up striving toward his ideals, and at 52 he is still energetic and determined to progress.

loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en: Pauline is a 25-year-old married woman. She has two children. She describes herself to be ambitious and hopeful. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be a temporary business premise. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more clothes to sell. Her business goal is to excel within five years.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Eline

texts.en: Eline is a 29-year-old married woman. She describes herself as ambitious. She operates a beauty salon where she offers hair dressing services. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are ladies. She describes her biggest business challenge to be space and electricity. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to pay for electricity installation. Her business goal is to own a large salon within five years. She will use the anticipated profits to expand the business.

loans.use: to pay for electricity installation

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is a married woman with four children. She is 53 years old and has two children who are still in school.

She has a handicraft business in the Philippines and has been in this business for 10 years. 

Lourdes requested a 15,000 PHP loan amount through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy additional materials for her business. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

In the future, Lourdes would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional materials for her business

loans.name: Mario Elias

texts.es:
San Miguel de los Bancos un Cantón de clima cálido húmedo lleno de gente amable y trabajadora tradicionalmente se realiza las festividades por el aniversario del mismo, este Cantón es un atractivo turístico muy visitado por su variedad de flora y fauna silvestre. 
En este Cantón vive y tiene el negocio Mario, un joven luchador de 27 años es padre soltero tiene una hija de 4 años a la que ve pocos días a la semana por eso cada que puede aprovecha al máximo para compartir con su hija. 
El vive y tiene su negocio en el recinto la Florida trabaja diariamente un promedio de 10 horas entre el negocio y el empleo que tiene en una gasolinera del sector, este préstamo lo invertirá en la vivienda terminara una pequeña casita.
El Señor Mario se dedica a la producción de cerdos aprendió de este negocio con la familia este negocio le a ayudado mucho para darle un buen futuro a su pequeña hija, con la inversión de este crédito mejorara su calidad de vida y el de su familia, Mario agradece a Fundación Alternativa y a Kiva por el apoyo y las oportunidades brindadas.
texts.en:
San Miguel de los Bancos is a canton with a warm, humid climate, full of friendly, hardworking people.  Traditionally they hold festivities to celebrate their anniversary.  This canton is a popular tourist attraction due to its variety of wild plants and animals.  

Mario lives and runs his business in this canton.  He is a hardworking 27-year-old and single father of a 4-year-old daughter.  He only sees his daughter a few days a week so when he can he makes the most of opportunities to spend time with her.  He lives and runs his business in the community of La Florida.  He works an average of ten hours a day, between his business and his job at a local gas station.  He will use this loan to finish building a small house.  

Mario raises pigs.  He learned this trade from his family, and the business has helped him a lot in providing a good future for his little daughter.  This loan will improve his quality of life and that of his family.  Mario thanks Fundación Alternativa and Kiva for their support and the opportunities they provide.

loans.use: to finish his house

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is 53 years old and lives in Lapasan, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is a widow with five adult aged children.

She has a buy and sell business and earns approximately 10,000 PHP each month doing this type of business. She has a requested a loan to pay for the processing fees and job placements of her son.

She took previous loans with Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) and all were paid back in a timely manner. Rebecca has been a member of PMPC for four years. 

In the future, Rebecca hopes to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to pay for the processing fees and job placements of her son

loans.name: Ian

texts.en:
Ian lives in Cabungaan, Clarin, Misamis Occidental with his family. To make a living, Ian manages his farm and earns good income to sustain the family's needs. 

With his generated income, his previous loan used for farming has been successfully repaid. He want to gain more income. So, recently Ian borrowed a new loan to purchase organic fertilizer. 

Ian is determined to have an abundant harvest so he can invest more to improve his farm, the main source of his income. He wants to improve his farming activities to gain more profit for his family in the future.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer

loans.name: Lucita

texts.en:
Lucita is 52 years old and married with one child. Lucita works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and has been in this business for six years. She sells a variety of items such as biscuits, canned goods, juice, candies, shampoo, and detergent soap. 

She requested a 12,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase more stock like biscuits, canned goods, juice, candies, shampoo, and detergent soap to sell.

In the future, Lucita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock like biscuits, canned goods, juice, candies, shampoo, and detergent soap to sell

loans.name: Jesús Antonio

texts.es:
Jesús fue un agricultor gran parte de su vida, pero desde hace 26 años se gana la vida como comerciante vendiendo churros en Medellín – Colombia.
Abre su negocio desde las 2:00 pm hasta las 6:00 pm, y el resto de tiempo se dedica a preparar la mezcla para su producto y organizar su vivienda.
Su hijo se ha convertido en el centro de su vida y es precisamente el motivo por el cual trabaja día a día, pues su sueño es ver a su hijo convertido en un profesional y darle todo lo que necesita.
Jesús es un hombre pujante que decidió dejar el trabajo en el campo para obtener sus propios ingresos en la ciudad, él sabe que no es fácil pero con valentía podrá lograrlo.
En estos momentos necesita un crédito para comprar un carro de churros nuevo, generando así un empleo a otra persona y aumentando sus ingresos; esto garantizara una vida más estable para él y su hijo
texts.en:
Jesús was a farmer for a great part of his life, but for 26 years he has earned his living as a merchant selling churros (fried dough pastry) in Medellin, Colombia. He opens his business from 2:00 p.m. until 6:00 p.m., and the rest of the time prepares the mixture for his product and looks after his home.

His son has become the center of his life, and is the very reason he works from day to day, as his dream is to see his son become a professional and to give him everything he needs. 

Jesús is a determined man who decided to leave farm work in order to earn his own income in he city. He knows it is not easy, but with effort he will be able to achieve it. 

At this time he needs a loan to buy a new churros cart, in this way creating a job for another person and increasing his revenues; this will assure him and his son of a more stable life.

loans.use: To buy a new churros cart (fried dough pastry), and in this way create a job for another person and increase his revenues.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida is 53 years old and lives in Colupan Alto, Sinacaban, Philippines. She is married with 6 children.
 
To earn a living, Aida has a business selling suman in the community. She earns about 3,000 PHP each month doing this type of work. Aida has requested a loan to buy additional ingredients for her suman business.

Aida has been a member of PMPC for 9 years.  In the future, Aida would like to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients for her suman business

loans.name: Vicarani Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “VICARANI” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Patacamaya, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Sofía es la Secretaria. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de papa, compra y venta de ganado ovino y vacuno, artesanía en camas y tejido de chompas, venta de batidos, producción de papa.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Sofía es integrante, ella indica que es el primer año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de un promotor de la institución que fue a visitarla a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tejido de chompas a máquina; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió en un centro de formación en seis meses, posteriormente decide emprender este conocimiento como una fuente de generación de empleo.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de lana por mayor) que adquirirá en la ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener a su familia ya que ella es soltera y vive con sus padres.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones que le ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The communal bank 'Vicarani' will begin its first loan cycle as part of the Patacamaya regional office. It is composed of 8 members and is governed by a board of directors, of which Sofía is the secretary.
