The members of the communal bank have a variety of businesses such as selling potatoes, buying and selling sheep and cattle, selling artisanal beds and knitting sweaters, selling shakes, and growing potatoes.

The loan that they will take out will benefit small businesses like Sofía's. She states that this is the first year being a member of Pro Mujer. She joined after being invited by a promoter of the institution who visited her house. Currently, she has a business machine-knitting sweaters. She shares that she learned this business in 6 months at a training center. Afterward, she decided to use this knowledge as a source of employment.

The loan she will take out is to increase her capital (by buying wool at wholesale) which she will get in the city of La Paz and resell in her retail space. This business allows her to generate income to support her family since she is single and lives with her parents. When she was asked what she liked about Pro Mujer, she responded that she likes the trainings the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy wool at wholesale.

loans.name: Hiscaoco Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “HISCAOCO” iniciará el tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Patacamaya, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Rumalda es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: producción y venta de leche, venta de verduras, compra y venta de ganado vacuno, servicio de transporte, venta de comida, venta de queso.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Rumalda es integrante, ella indica que es el segundo año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de un promotor de la institución que fue a visitarla a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de comida; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió por iniciativa propia hace varios años, al observar el mercado que tiene este producto.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de verduras por mayor) que adquirirá en la ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener a su familia ya que ella es casada y tiene ocho hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las compañeras de su grupo son cumplidas.
texts.en:
The "Hiscaoco" group is beginning their third loan with Pro Mujer as part of the Focal Group of Patacamaya. It is made up of 8 members and is run by a board of directors, of which Rumalda is the president. The businesses that the members have are varied, like production and sales of milk, vegetable sales, purchase and sales of cattle, transportation services, food sales, and cheese sales.

The loan that they will receive will benefit micro-businesses like Rumalda's. She tells us that this is the second year that she has been a member of Pro Mujer. She joined after a promoter from the institution visited her home and invited her to join.

She currently has a business selling food. She began working in this business on her own many years ago after seeing the market for these products. The current loan will be used to increase her working capital (to purchase vegetables in bulk). She will purchase the goods in the city of La Paz and later sell them in her sales space.

This job helps her to generate income to support her family, since she is married with eight children. When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responded that she likes the other members of the group since they are thoughtful.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables in bulk.

loans.name: Maria Theresa

texts.en:
Maria Theresa is 44 years old and lives in Poblacion 1, Clarin, Philippines. She is married with 4 children. 

Maria Theresa has a housing rental business and earns approximately 10,000 PHP each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan to purchase necessary housing materials.

Maria Theresa has been a member of PMPC for 5 years. In the future, Maria Theresa hopes to financially support her immediate family members.

loans.use: to purchase necessary housing materials

loans.name: Ledesma

texts.en:
Ledesma is 61 years old and lives in Poblacion, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She is married with 3 children who are now adults. 

For their source of livelihood, Ledesma has a little store where she has been selling groceries and other consumable products for 10 years. She earns approximately 6,000 PHP each month doing this type of business activity. She is also receiving support from her husband who is employed by the government engineering department.

She has requested a loan to be used in purchasing additional groceries and other consumable products for retail.

Ledesma has been a member of PMPC for almost 2 years. In the future, Ledesma hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries and other consumable products for retail

loans.name: Annie Rose

texts.en:
Annie Rose is married with 1 child. Annie Rose is 37 years old and lives in Tipan, Sinacaban, Philippines.

Annie Rose sells assorted products to earn a living and has had this business for 10 years. Each month, she earns 3,000 PHP doing this type of work. 

She has requested a loan of 50,000 PHP to restock her store with basic commodities.

Annie Rose has been a member of PMPC for 6 years. In the future, Annie Rose hopes to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities

loans.name: Riza

texts.en:
Riza is married with 2 children. Riza is 39 years old and lives in Punta, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte.

Riza is a farmer and she grows pigs to sell to earn a living. She has been doing this for 2 years. She has requested a loan to purchase piglets and feed.

Riza has been a member of PMPC for 4 years. In the future, Riza hopes to have more piglets.

loans.use: buy additional piglets and feed

loans.name: Richel

texts.en:
Richel owns and operates farmland. She plants and harvests corn for sale to earn a living. She has been farming for four years and earns well for the family. Aside from this, she also has a retail store in the village selling grocery goods. 

With her determination to improve their lives, the couple decide to buy a motorcycle to use for transporting their farm produce. Since she had successfully repaid her previous loan used for farming, she is now requesting a new loan to buy new tires for her motorcycle used for carrying her farm produce. 

Richel plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy new tires for her motorcycle used for carrying her farm produce

loans.name: James Matthew

texts.en:
James Matthew is studying maritime courses at Misamis University, Ozamiz City. His parents run a business to earn a living. His previous loans were used to cover school expenses and to pay tuition fees for the second semester of this current year. 

Recently, he took a new loan to to cover school allowances and boarding house expenses for this school year.  He hopes to finish his studies to become successful and able to support his parents' needs someday.

loans.use: to cover school allowances and boarding house expenses

location.town: Carmen Annex, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
This is Emma, 35, a resident of Batasan, Quezon City, Philippines. She is married to Richard, a truck driver, and they have children. She, together with her husband, are managing their household while operating the business. She works hard to provide for their everyday needs.

Emma operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a small amount of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 PHP in sales every day.

She is requesting a 20,000 PHP loan to help her continue in the operation of her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Emma hopes that her business will expand and dreams to give her children a good education.  She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Betty Mayerly

texts.es:
Ella es Betty Mayerly, viene de un pueblo de Boyaca  a buscar una oportunidad para estudiar una carrera, después de buscar  encontró la institución superior las Mercedes y esta estudiando contabilidad financiera segundo semestre . 
Es una buena institución y ha aprendido mucho, pero le  es difícil cumplir con las cuota por que nadie le daba trabajo estable por ser menor de edad, hace poco cumplió los 18 años pero  no puedo tener un trabajo estable por no tener  experiencia, ella solicita el convenio de kiva por que tiene un trabajo  donde le pagan menos de un mínimo y de eso tiene que pagar los gastos personales  y los estudios, solo quiere una oportunidad, ya que no  tiene el apoyo de nadie.
texts.en:
Meet Betty Mayerly. She comes from a community in Boyaca looking for the opportunity to study to be a professional. After searching she found la institución superior las Mercedes and is now in her second semester studying Accounting. It is a good college and she has learned a lot but she can't afford the cost. No one would give her a good job as she was a minor. She recently turned 18 and no one will give her a good job because she has no experience.

She is requesting a loan from Kiva as she has a job that pays her less than the minimum wage and has to pay her personal expenses and her studies. She simply wants an opportunity as she has no one to support her.

loans.use: to pay a semester's tuition.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is a married woman. She has 6 children. She describes herself as ambitious. She operates a food stall where she cooks food to sell. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are of all types. She will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy stock of ingredients for preparing food and to open a cereal store. She hopes that, in the future, she be a cereal supplier. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy stock of ingredients for preparing food, and to open a cereal store

loans.name: Josphine

texts.en: Josphine is a married woman. She has 2 children. She describes herself as ambitious. She operates a dairy farm where she keeps dairy cows which produce milk for her to sell. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a fertile and favorable location and her primary customers are of all types. She identifies her biggest business challenge as lack of funds. She will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy animal feed and goats to rear. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy animal feed and goats to rear

loans.name: Felicity

texts.en: Felicity is a 34-year-old single woman. She describes herself as ambitious. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for 8 years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are of all types. She identifies lack of funds as her biggest business challenge. She will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy more stock of clothes. Her business goal is to have many branches within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will be financially stable. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes

loans.name: Maranatha Ii Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “MARANATHA II” iniciará el noveno ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Villa Exaltación, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Ingrid es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: confección de mantas, venta de chompas, artesano, servicio de transporte, tienda de barrio, venta de ropa.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Ingrid es integrante, ella indica que es el primer año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de sábanas y colchas; da a conocer que este negocio lo inicio mediante una prima quien le indico la forma de adquisición y venta de estos productos.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de sábanas y colchas por mayor) que adquirirá en las tiendas de las fronteras Bolivia - Chile y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener a su familia ya que ella es soltera y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las integrantes de su grupo porque son cumplidas.
texts.en:
The "Maranatha II" group is on its ninth loan with Pro Mujer. It is part of the Villa Exaltación Focal Group and is made up of eight members. It is run by a board of directors, of whom Ingrid is the president. The businesses run by the members include blanket making, jacket sales, artisan crafts, transportation services, general stores, and clothing sales.

The loan that they will receive will benefit microbusinesses like Ingrid's. This is her first year with Pro Mujer. She joined after a friend, who is a member of the institution, invited her. She currently has a business selling sheets and bed covers. She began this business through a cousin, who showed her how to acquire and sell these products.

The loan that she has requested is to increase her working capital so that she can purchase sheets and bed covers in bulk. She will purchase the products at near the Bolivian-Chilean border and later sell them in her store.

This job allows her to generate income to support her family, since she is single and has one child. When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responded that she likes the other members of the group because they are kind.

loans.use: to purchase sheets and bed covers in bulk.

loans.name: James Matthew

texts.en: James Matthew is studying his maritime course in Misamis University, Ozamiz City. His parents run a business to earn a living. His previous loan was used for his school tuition fees and other expenses. To pay the balances of his tuition fees, he took a new loan from GDMPC. He hopes to finish his studies to become successful and able to support his parents' needs someday.

loans.use: to pay the balances of his tuition fees

location.town: Carmen Annex, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy seeds, insecticides, herbicides, fertilizers, manure, etc. and to improve the soil

loans.name: Felomina

texts.en: Felomina is running a general store aside from farming and earns well for her living. She had her previous loans used for farming and for her business and had successfully repaid it. She helps her husband working in their farm, and after their work, she watches over her store to earn additional income.  Currently, she is borrowing a new loan to purchase additional grocery goods to sell.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to her house.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Roribel

texts.en:
Roribel previously accessed a 50,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education, in their personal, household and business expenditures.
 
She would like to apply for another 50,000 PHP loan for her to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result for better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and children’s education expense. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Roribel dreams that her variety store will someday become a grocery store and dreams to give her children a good life and education.  She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Sonia Nicauris

texts.es:
Sonia es una emprendedora mujer de 51 años de edad, tiene 3 hijos por los cuales ha dado los mejores años de su vida.
Sonia inicio con su negocio hace varios años, y aprendió del oficio de confección de ropa, laborando gran parte de su vida en fábricas textiles, hasta que un día, uno de sus jefes la convenció de montar su propio taller en casa y así fue como Sonia se convirtió en la empresaria que es hoy.
Ella en estos momentos confecciona su propia línea de ropa y eventualmente ofrece servicios de modistería.
Uno de los desafíos más grande que ha tenido que enfrentar es la situación de salud por la cual actualmente está atravesando un familiar, esto ha hecho que Sonia se vea obligada a detener su labor para estar pendiente a todo lo que necesite su familiar.
En estos momentos ella necesita un crédito para comprar insumos como tela, hilos, encajes y accesorios, objetos que le permitirán tener un incremento en su producción y cubrir todos los pedidos que actualmente tiene y no ha podido atender.
Uno de sus sueños más grandes es darle una educación de calidad a su hija y verla como una mujer exitosa.
texts.en:
Sonia is an entrepreneurial, 51-year-old woman. She has three children to whom she has given the best years of her life. Sonia began her business many years ago and learned how to make clothing. She worked for most of her life in textile factories until one day when one of her bosses convinced her to open her own shop in her home. This is how Sonia became the businesswoman that she is today.

She currently sews her own clothing line and she will eventually offer other clothing services. One of the greatest challenges that she faces is the health of one of her family members. Sonia has to put her work on hold until she tends to the needs of her family member.

She currently needs a loan to purchase supplies like thread, fabric, lace, and accessories, which will allow her to increase her production and finish all of the orders that she has not been able to finish.

One of her greatest dreams is to provide her daughter with a quality education and see her become a successful woman.

loans.use: to purchase supplies like thread, fabric, lace, and accessories, objects that will allow her to increase production.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase seeds, compost, fertilizers, pesticides and other items needed to improve his land.

loans.name: Lan

texts.en:
Mrs. Lan works in agriculture, farming poultry and cattle.

Lan is 43 years old and she is married with 2 children. She lives and works in Nong Cong district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province, with two dependents.

This is Lan's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. Lan has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Lan faces in her life is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet and a bathroom.

With her business profit, Lan hopes for her children to do well in school, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet and a bathroom.

loans.name: La

texts.en:
Mrs. La works in agriculture, farming poultry and cattle.

La is 54 years old and she is married with three children. She lives and works in Nong Cong district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province, with no dependents.

This is La's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. La has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that La faces in her life is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet and a bathroom, and a water filter system.

With her business profit, La hopes for her children to find a good job, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet and a bathroom, and a water filter system.

loans.name: Nicomedes

texts.en: Nicomedes is 50 years old, married and had two children. His wife is a grocery store staff worker. To gain income, he provides motorcycle transport services to the people in his village. He is now asking for a loan of PHP 5,000 as additional capital in his business. He will buy gasoline and crude oil for maintenance of the motorcycle. This will help him extend safe travel to all his passengers.

loans.use: to buy gasoline and crude oil for maintenance of the motorcycle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural materials to assist her coffee crops.

loans.name: Sojida

texts.ru: Сожида 30-летняя сельская женщина родом из района Шахритус. Она занимается растениеводством в течение 4 лет. Ее муж уже несколько лет как работает в России. Сожида живет в своем районе с двумя детьми и родителями мужа. Она усердная и работящая женщина, не боящаяся тяжелой работы. На своей участке земли Сожида сеет пшеницу и огородные культуры. В посевной работе Сожиде помогают ее свёкор и свекровь. Сейчас она вместе с ними проводит весенний посев. Для купли минеральных удобрений и семян картофеля и помидора, Сожида нуждается в кредите. Она очень надеется, что ей окажут финансовую поддержку.
texts.en: Sojida is a 30-year-old country woman from the Shahrituz region. She has been working in agriculture for four years. Her husband has been working in Russia for quite a few years now. Sojida lives in her region with two children and her husband's parents. She is a diligent and tireless woman who's not afraid of hard work. Sojida grows wheat and vegetables on her land, and helps her father-in-law and mother-in-law with their sowing. Now they are all preparing for the spring planting, and Sojida needs a loan to buy fertilizer, seed potatoes and tomato seeds. She very much hopes to receive financial support.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seed potatoes and tomato seeds

loans.name: Rosa Damariz

texts.es:
Querer es poder, es la frase que define a Rosa. Es una mujer que día a día ha luchado por cumplir sus metas, tiene 27 años de edad, está soltera y es madre de un niño. Hace un año estableció un ciber en su casa de habitación, el que cuenta con dos computadoras. Atiende con carisma, respeto y entusiasmo. Su negocio es su principal fuente económica, razón por la cual pone todo su empeño, quiere brindarle a su hijo una buena educación dándole un paso hacia un futuro próspero.
Ella solicita el financiamiento para la compra de dos computadoras y una fotocopiadora industrial, su objetivo principal es aumentar la producción de su capital. Confía plenamente en el préstamo que ofrece Kiva y MiCrédito, puesto que le ayudaran a incrementar su clientela, que son un punto clave para lograr estabilidad económica que le proporcione seguridad. Uno de sus planes futuros es ampliar el local, por lo que seguirá trabajando arduamente hasta lograrlo.
texts.en:
"Where there's a will, there's a way" is the phrase that defines Rosa. She is a woman who has fought every day to accomplish her goals. She is 27 years old. She is single and is the mother of a son. A year ago she established a cybercafe in her home. It has two computers, and she tends it with charisma, respect, and enthusiasm. Her business is her principal economic source, and for this reason she puts all her effort into it. She wants to offer her son a good education, giving him a step toward a prosperous future.

She is applying for the loan for the purchase of two computers and an industrial photocopier. Her principal goal is to increase the production of her capital. She is fully confident in the loan that Kiva and MiCredito offer, since they will help her to increase her clientele, which is a key point to achieve the economic stability that brings security. One of her future plans is to expand her business space, and she will continue working hard to achieve this.

loans.use: to buy two computers and an industrial photocopier.

loans.name: Thắng

texts.en:
Mrs. Thắng works in agriculture, farming food. Thắng is 39 years old and she is married with three children. She lives and works in Nong Cong district, a  rural area in Thanh Hoa province, with three dependents.

This is Thắng first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. Thắng has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Thắng faces in her life is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet and a bathroom, and a water filter system .

With her business profit, Thắng hopes for her children to do well in school, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to make enough money to provide for her kids.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and brick and to build a toilet and a bathroom, and a water filter system.

loans.name: Adela

texts.en: Adela has been operating her own retail store for many years and she earns well from this. Her husband earns from employment and with her store, she was able to support her husband's income. To improve sales, she took a new loan from GDMPC micro credit to purchase additional grocery goods to sell. In the future, Adela hopes to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery goods to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase large amount of food products to sell or trade for meat and other products to herders in remote areas to increase his income

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for clean cooking gas as an alternative to charcoal

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for a more efficient cooking gas package

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for a clean cooking gas package

loans.name: Myra

texts.en: Myra is 35 year old woman with 1 child. She owns and operates a small flea market, selling items such as lavalava, shirts, make ups, souvenirs, etc. She has been doing this for 3 years. Myra needs a loan to buy materials such as Samoan bangles, earrings, tapa cloth, table mats, kava bowls and Samoan bags for her business. She hopes to use her profits to support her family. She became a member of SPBD in 2014 to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy materials such as Samoan bangles, earrings, tapa cloth, table mats, kava bowls and Samoan bags

loans.name: Hana

texts.en: Hana is a 48 years old married woman with 6 children. She runs a small business selling pancakes, donuts and pies in her community and has been doing this for 2 years. Hana has requested a loan to buy sacks of flour, sugar, baking soda, yeast, dripping oil and a frying pan. She joined SPBD in 2014 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Hana will provide for her family's daily needs.

loans.use: to buy sacks of flour, sugar, baking soda, yeast, dripping oil and a frying pan

loans.name: Da

texts.en:
Da is 24 years old and lives with her parents in Ta Lou, Bakan, Pursat province, Cambodia. She was married and got a divorce due to the family's unavoidable circumstances. Da is earning income from farming, particularly rice. She earns approximately USD 7.00 per day. She has been a farmer for more than 6 years.

By applying for this loan Da will use it to build a hygienic latrine and septic tank for the sake of her family members and so as to improve her household sanitation practices. She will use the remaining amount to dig a well for a household water supply. Thanks to the water loan program with a special rate offered by Hattha Kaksekar Limited (HKL), Da is encouraged to focus on ensuring healthy living conditions, to safeguard the health of her family and to protect the environment.

loans.use: to build a hygienic latrine and septic tank for the sake of her family members.

loans.name: Ulziichimeg

texts.en: Mrs. Ulziichimeg, 38 years old, lives with her husband and daughter in Kherlen, an eastern town in Mongolia. She has been working as a meat processor at a private firm since 2008. Her husband raises livestock for a living. She is requesting a loan of 550 $US to buy planks for repairing her stockyard. After repair, her family's cattle won't go wonder from their stockyard and will live in a more comfortable and warm place. The borrower is very concerned about the well being of her livestock, which is fundamental to the income source of her family.

loans.use: to repair stockyard

loans.name: Rolina

texts.en:
"Rolina is 36  years old and married with 6 children. 
She has a small garden where she grows pineapples, cucumbers, taro and taamu that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for 2 years. Rolina needs a loan to buy a wheelbarrow, chemicals, bush-knives, a spade, weed spray, and barbed wire. 
She joined SBPD in 2014. Rolina will use the profits from her sales to support her family."

loans.use: to buy a wheelbarrow, chemicals, bushknives, a spade, weedspray and barbed wire

loans.name: Imasumac De Amadeo Repeto Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “IMASUMAC DE AMADEO REPETO” de la Asocicion Arariwa desde hace varios años. 

Mariela tiene 23 años de edad y vive en la hermosa ciudad del Cusco, ella alterna sus actividades diarias con su negocio de venta de comida, ella tiene pequeño restaurante donde expende diferentes platos típicos de la región y por las tardes se dedica a la venta de salchipapas, ella es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora que saca adelante a su familia, ella en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar insumos como por ejemplo arroz, azúcar, fideos y otras cosas. 

Los otros socios  se dedican a la venta de salchipapas, venta de ropa, carpintería metálica, carpinteria, venta de artesania, docente.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These communal bank members have belonged to the communal bank "Imasumac de Amadeo Repeto" of the Arariwa Association for a number of years.

Mariela is 23 years old and lives in the beautiful city of Cusco. She divides her time between her daily activities and her business of selling food. She has a little restaurant where she sells typical dishes of the region, and in the afternoon she sells salchipapas [a dish made from sausages and potatoes]. She is an entrepreneurial and hard-working woman who is raising her family. At this time she needs a loan to purchase supplies such as rice, sugar, pasta, and other items.

The other members work in selling salchipapas, selling clothing, metalwork, carpentry, selling handicrafts, and teaching.

Mariela is grateful to those who form part of this dream through this means, and she promises to make her loan payments according to the established schedule.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as rice, sugar, pasta, and other items.

loans.name: Enkhjargal

texts.en: Mr.Enkhjargal, 48 years old, lives with his wife and two children in Darkhan, second largest city of Mongolia. He is a monk and a lot of people visit him for his wisdom. He prays for the people and does't get any money in return. Instead people who are grateful give him benefaction. His wife works at private firm. Their children both go to high school. He is requesting a loan of 2850 USD to buy building materials, such as bricks, cement, planks and insulated windows for house renovation. After renovation, his family will live in a comfortable and warm place where less coal is burned and less pollutants will be released. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to buy building materials

loans.name: Phượng

texts.en:
Mrs. Phượng works in agriculture, farming food. Phượng is 44 years old and she is married with two children. She lives and works in Nong Cong district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province, with two dependents.

In 2009, Phượng joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Phượng has successfully repaid one loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Phượng has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.

One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet, a bathroom and a water filter system.

With her business profit, Phượng hopes to remodel her house, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to make enough money to provide for her kids.

loans.use: to build a toilet, a bathroom, and a water filter system.

loans.name: Lolito

texts.en: Lolito operates his farm well in order to provide for the needs of his family. He joined GDMPC in the year 2004 and his previous loan, used for farming, was successfully repaid. Currently, he borrowed a new loan to buy fertilizer and organic pesticides. He is hopeful to gain more returns from his investments and wants to expand his farm and be able to save money for the future needs of the entire family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and organic pesticides.

loans.name: Rhyme Rose

texts.en: Rhyme Rose is a single entrepreneur living in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She owns and operates a business selling cell phone loads. She's been in her business for four years . She joined GDMPC last year and had successfully repaid her previous loan used in acquiring cell phone loads for resale. Now she has requested a loan of  to purchase additional cell phone loads for sale. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional cell phones loads for sale

loans.name: Avelina

texts.en:
Avelina is married and has two children who have helped her husband in taking care of their corn production business. 

After many years of growing and harvesting corn, Avelina earns enough to open another business retailing grocery goods in their village. The business was successful so that she was able to repay her previous loan successfully. 

To increase sales she took a new loan to buy more grocery goods for sale.

Avelina wants to improve the general living situation of her entire family in the near future.

loans.use: to buy more grocery goods for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for a more efficient cooking device of liquefied petroleum gas

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for clean and efficient cooking energy from Liquefied Petroleum Gas

loans.name: Mesepa

texts.en:
Mesepa is a 65-year-old woman with 6 children.  She has 2 years of experience making and selling ice cake in her community to earn a living.  

Mesepa needs a loan to buy a deep freezer, foam cups, cordial, sugar, and plastic bags.  She plans to use her profits to renovate her house and improve her business.

Mesepa has been a member of SPBD in 2014

loans.use: to buy a deep freezer, foam cups, cordial, sugar, and plastic bags.

loans.name: Uuganbat

texts.en:
Mr. Uuganbat, 45 years old, lives with his wife and two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia.  He has been rendering taxi service to local people since 2011.  His wife has a disability and receives a state pension.  Their elder son works on a construction site.  

He is requesting a loan of 2,250 USD to buy building materials such as bricks, cement, fiberglass, and felt.  After renovating his house, his family will live in a more comfortable and warm place where less coal is burned and less pollutants are released into the air.  The borrower is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to renovate his old house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to replace her old car which has been broken several times recently and thus she was unable to run her business

loans.name: Út

texts.en:
Mrs. Út works in agriculture, farming food. Út is 52 years old and she is married with three children. She lives and works in Nong Cong district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province, with one dependent.

In 2013, Út joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Út has successfully repaid one loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.
Út has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Út faces in her life is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet and a bathroom.

With her business profit, Út hopes to remodel her house, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to make enough money to provide for her kids.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet and a bathroom.

loans.name: Gần

texts.en:
Gần works in agriculture, farming poultry and cattle. Gần is 55 years old and she is single with one child. Gần lives with no dependents in Nong Cong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Gần's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. Gần has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.

One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet and a bathroom.

With her business profit, Gần hopes to remodel her house, to maintain  a successful business, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet and a bathroom.

loans.name: Carlos Arnulfo

texts.es: Don Carlos, tiene 45 años de edad, esta casado, tiene 4 hijos y reside en una aldea del municipio de Choloma, Cortes. El se dedica a la agricultura de granos básicos y venta de leña, para obtener otros ingresos vende mercadería como ropa y calzado. Las ventas las realiza en su casa. Lleva 7 ciclos de prestamos con la institución para mantener sus actividades que le generan ingresos, actualmente solicita 15,000 Lempiras para surtir de mercadería como ropa y calzado. Tiene planes de comprar otro terreno para cultivar palma.
texts.en: Don Carlos is 45 years old. He is married, has four children, and lives in a village in the municipality of Choloma, Cortes. He works in agriculture, growing basic grains and selling firewood. To obtain other income, he sells merchandise such as clothing and footwear. He makes his sales from his home. He has had seven cycles of loans with the institution in order to maintain his businesses that generate income for him. He is now applying for 15,000 Lempiras to stock merchandise such as clothing and footwear. He has plans to buy another plot of land to raise palms.

loans.use: to buy clothing and footwear to sell

loans.name: Yiset Andrea

texts.es:
Yiset es una joven emprendedora, que ha sabido aprovechar las oportunidades que el mercado le presenta, pues hace 4 años inicio con su propio negocio que es una sala de Internet, ya que se percató que en el sector donde vive no habían este tipo de establecimientos que prestara servicios de impresión, fotocopiado y por supuesto de acceso a la web; esto le ha permitido obtener algunos ingresos y progresar al lado de su esposo que eventualmente la acompaña en el negocio.
Ella solicita un crédito para comprar un flash y una impresora, objetos que le permitirán ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes, que en su mayoría son estudiantes.
Uno de los desafíos que enfrenta es la ausencia de clientes en época de vacaciones estudiantiles.
texts.en:
Yiset is an enterprising young woman, who has known how to take advantage of the opportunities the market has presented to her. Four years ago she started her own business, an internet café, having noticed that in the area where she lived there were no businesses offering services like printing, photocopying, and access to the internet. This has enabled her to earn an income and move forward with her husband, who helps her occasionally in the internet café.

She is seeking a loan in order to buy a USB flash drive and a printer, which will allow her to offer a better service to her customers, who are mostly students. One of the challenges she faces in her business is a lack of customers during school vacations.

loans.use: to buy a USB flash drive and printer, and so offer a better service to her customers.

loans.name: Christopher John

texts.en:
Christopher John lives at Buntun with his children. He is 41 years old, a tricycle driver and a hog raiser. He has been in his business for more than 10 years. He wanted to get more income to sustain his family's daily needs. He is now asking for PHP 5,000 to buy gasoline for his motorcycle and feed for hogs. This will help maintain a good transport business and ensure healthy growth of his hogs for future merchandise. 

Someday, he hopes to keep improving his income and save funds for emergency purposes.

loans.use: to buy gasoline for his motorcycle and feed for his hogs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy jeans, skirts, blouses, shirts, shorts, among others.

loans.name: Joel Antonio

texts.es: Joel, tiene 23 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su pareja y reside en una aldea de Nueva Frontera, Santa Bárbara. Tiene 4 años de dedicarse al cultivo se café, anteriormente solo cultivaba maíz y frijol. El café lo vende en oro y pergamino en la misma zona. Ha solicitado un préstamo por 10,000 lempiras para comprar fertilizantes y darle buena asistencia a su finca para mejorar las condiciones y su cosecha. Su plan es siempre mantener ingresos para su familia.
texts.en: Joel is 23 years old. He lives in free union with his partner in a village of Nueva Frontera, Santa Bárbara. He has been growing coffee for four years. Before that, he raised only corn and beans. He sells raw coffee and parchment coffee in the same zone. He has applied for a loan of 10,000 lempiras in order to buy fertilizers and give good assistance to his plantation in order to improve the conditions and his harvest. His plan is to always have income for his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and give good assistance to his coffee plantation

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for the most efficient cooking energy from Liquefied Petroleum Gas

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for alternative clean cooking energy

loans.name: Mativa

texts.en: Mativa is a 24-year-old woman with no children.  She would like to extend her small business, selling Lava-Lava (traditional Polynesian clothing) in her community.  In order to do this, Mativa needs a loan to buy fabric, paints, brushes, milled fabrics, paint rollers, stencils, and an elei carving board.  She hopes to use her profits to save for family needs.  She became a member of SPBD in 2014.

loans.use: to buy fabric, paints, brushes, milled fabrics, paint rollers, stencils, and an elei carving board.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for clean cooking energy

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for alternative energy for cooking

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for an alternative cooking energy

loans.name: Akouvi

texts.fr: Afin de réinjecter les profits supplémentaires dans son activité de vente de farine de manioc et assurer une bonne scolarisation à ses enfants, madame Akouvi âgée de 37ans exerce comme activité la vente de farine de manioc au marché depuis 1997. Le premier prêt qu'elle sollicite à WAGES lui permettra de s'approvisionner en marchandises. Elle est mariée à un chauffeur et mère de 03 enfants tous scolarisés.
texts.en: Akouvi is 37 years old, and she has been selling cassava flour at the market since 1997.  This activity allows her to reinvest her additional profits into her business and to give a good education to her children.  She is requesting her first loan from WAGES.  This loan will help her to get new supplies of goods.  She is married to a driver and the mother of three children who all go to school.

loans.use: to buy cassava flour.

loans.name: Yawafui

texts.fr: Jeune femme de 30ans, Yawafui exerce comme activité la vente des céréales à domicile. Elle est à son premier crédit à WAGES et cet argent lui servira d'acheter des céréales. Le profit lui servira de réinvestir dans l'activité et de voir sa famille s'épanouir.
texts.en: Yawafui is a young woman, age 30, who sells grains from her home.  This is her first loan with WAGES.  She will use the money received to buy grains.  With her profits, she will be able to reinvest in her business and she will ensure the well-being of her family.

loans.use: to buy grains and other staple foods.

loans.name: Nar

texts.fr: Madame NAR est une femme qui vie à coté du guichet, elle est mariée et mère de famille. Il évolue dans la commercialisation des produits alimentaires comme le riz, sucre, savon, huile etc. Elle a une expérience de plus de 5 ans dans cette activité. NAR sollicite ce montant pour acheter et vendre des produits alimentaires. Elle aide son mari dans la gestion des dépenses quotidiennes et les  frais de scolarité de ses enfants. Elle commence sa journée à 8h pour la finir à 20h. A l’avenir elle souhaite élargir son activité commerciale et augmenter ses revenus afin de pouvoir épargner de l’argent et améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en: Nar lives very close to the local branch of the UIMCEC.  She is married and a mother.  She sells grocery products such as rice, sugar, soap, oil etc.  She has more than five years of experience in her business.  She is requesting this loan to buy and sell food products.  She is helping her husband to manage the family's daily expenses as well as their children's school fees.  She works from 8AM until 8PM.  In the future, she would like to expand her business and increase her income, in order to save some money and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy and sell food products.

loans.name: Yawa

texts.fr: Yawa vit avec son conjoint informaticien et leurs 03 enfants dont 02 scolarisés à Lomé. Pour aider son mari dans les charges familiales, elle revend des tissus coupons, des sacs et des tapettes à domicile et de façon ambulante. Son premier crédit lui permettra d'acheter plus de marchandises afin de tirer des profits. Elle espère à l'avenir ouvrir une boutique et aider son mari dans les charges familiales.
texts.en: Yawa lives with her husband and their three children in Lomé.  Her husband works as a computer specialist.  Two of the couple's children go to school.  In order to help her husband with the family expenses, Yawa resells fabrics, handbags and sandals from home and also as an itinerant seller.  Thanks to this first loan, Yawa will be able to buy more goods and to make better profits.  In the future, she would like to open a shop and continue to help her husband with the household expenses.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, handbags and sandals.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stationery goods for resale.

loans.name: Winnie

texts.en:
Winnie is a 25-year-old single woman. She describes herself as self-oriented. 

Winnie operates a retail business where she operates a grinding mill, and she grinds maize to produce maize flour to sell. She has been involved in this business for 3 years, and it is located in an area with potential. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of enough resources.
 
She will use the KES 15,000 loan to buy more stock of maize. Her business goal is to expand within the next 5 years. 

This is Winnie's first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy more stock of maize

loans.name: Sue

texts.en:
Sue is a 45-year-old lady with 6 children. 

She owns and operates a small flea market selling items such as lava-lava (type of clothing), shirts, make-up, souvenirs, etc. She has been doing this for 3 years.

Sue needs a loan to buy more items such as Samoan fans, Samoan bags, bangles, rings, earrings, kava bowls, table mats and tapa cloth. She hopes to use her profits to support her family and kids. 

She became a member of SPBD in 2014 to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy items such as Samoan fans, Samoan bags, bangles, rings, earrings, kava bowls, table mats and tapa cloth

loans.name: Iulieta

texts.en: Iulieta is a 54-year-old woman with 2 children. She wants to start a small business, selling elei lavalava in her community. In order to do this, Iulieta needs a loan to buy materials, fabric color paints, brushes, paint rollers, stencils and elei carved boards. She hopes to use her profits to save for her family needs. She has been a member of SPBD since 2014.

loans.use: to buy materials, fabric color paints, brushes, paint rollers, stencils and elei carved boards

loans.name: Ndèye Gnagna

texts.fr: Ndèye Gnaga est une femme qui est  une promotrice et évolue dans la commercialisation des produits cosmétiques. Elle a une expérience de plus 5ans dans cette expérience et demande ce crédit d’un montant de 300.000F pour acheter des produits cosmétiques comme les laits de corps, les huiles de beauté, les savons etc..   pour ensuite les revendre à ses clients. Elle aide son mari dans la gestion des dépenses quotidiennes et les frais de scolarité de ses enfants. Elle commence sa journée à 9h pour la terminer à 17h. A l’avenir elle souhaite élargir sa boutique et diversifier les produits.  Elle veut aussi augmenter ses revenus et épargner ses  bénéfices ainsi elle pourra améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Ndèye Gnaga is a retailer who works in cosmetics sales. She has five years of experience and is asking for a loan for 300,000F in order to buy cosmetic products such as body lotions, oils, soaps, etc. She will then resell these products to her clients.  

She helps her husband with the management of the daily expenses and with her children’s schooling fees. She starts her day at 9 am and ends her day at 5 pm. 

In the future, she would like to grow her boutique and diversify her products. She would like to increase her revenues and save her profits so that she can improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: buy cosmetics for resale.

loans.name: Danson

texts.en: Danson is a 53-year-old married man. He has 8 children. He describes himself to be good and honest. He operates a farm where he keeps donkeys. He has been involved in this business for 20 years now. His business is located in a busy area and his primary customers are of all types. He describes his biggest business challenge to be a lack of funds. He will use the Kes 10,000 loan to buy more donkeys. His business goal is to have a large livestock farm within the next 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will have a happy and stable family. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy more donkeys

loans.name: Allenly

texts.en:
Allenly is forty four years old and married with two children. She works very hard to provide for them. Allenly's business and family home was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Allenly  has restarted her business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter. She  has taken a PHP 6500 housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home.
She is using the this loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor. Allenly is committed to rebuilding her devastated life and in the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Oscar Orlando

texts.es: Oscar vive en casa propia con sus esposa y sus dos hijo, el se dedica a la venta y reparación de relojes, su negocio lo tiene ubicado cerca d su lugar de residencia, Oscar esta solicitando un crédito a INTEGRAL para la compra de mas repuestos y relojes por mayor para poder seguir con su negocio y asi obtener mejores ganancias y darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Oscar lives in his own house with his wife and his two children. He works selling and repairing timepieces. His business is located close to where he lives. Oscar is requesting a loan with INTEGRAL to buy more replacement parts and timepieces wholesale, so he can continue with his business, make more money, and give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more replacement parts and timepieces wholesale

loans.name: Faasalafa

texts.en: Faasalafa is a 46-years-old woman and married with 5 children. She has a small garden where she grows pineapples, cucumber, taro and taamu that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for 2 years now. Faasalafa needs a loan to buy a wheelbarrow, chemicals, knives, a spade and weedspray for her garden. She has been a member of SBPD since 2014. Faasalafa will use the profits from her sales to support her family.

loans.use: to buy a wheelbarrow, chemicals, knives, a spade and weedspray

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is a 30-year-old married woman with 4 children. She describes herself as focused and sincere. 

She operates a farm where she grows carrots, bananas, onions and vegetables. She has been involved in this business for 5 years, and it is located in a busy and productive place. Her customers are of all types. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of funds to buy farm inputs, so she will use the KES 35,000 loan to buy more seeds and fertilizer. 

Her business goal is to expand within the next 5 years, and she hopes that in the future she will be able to sustain her family financially. 

This is Ruth's first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy more seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en: Eunice is a 57-year-old married woman. She has 4 children. She describes herself to be determined and honest. She operates a farm where she keeps dairy cows which produce milk for sale. She has been involved in this business for the past 30 years. Her business is located in a busy and productive place and her primary customers are of all types. She describes her biggest business challenge to be a lack of funds. She will use the Kes 35000 loan to buy a dairy cow. Her business goal is to have a big dairy farm within the next 5 years. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Daisy is 45 years old and married with 7 children. 

She has a small garden where she grows pineapples, cucumber, taro and taamu (root vegetables) that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for 2 years.

Daisy needs a loan to buy a wheelbarrow, rake, spade, garden fork, backpack sprayer, pickaxe and fertilizers.
 
She became a member of SBPD in 2014. She will use the profits from her sales to support her family.

loans.use: to buy a wheelbarrow, rake, spade, garden fork, backpack sprayer, pickaxe and fertilizers.

loans.name: Illary - Chaska Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “ILLARY CHASKA” de la Asociacion Arariwa y todos viven en la hemosa ciudad del Cusco. 
 
Hugo sigue perteneciendo al banco comunal de la Asociación Arariwa del departamento del Cusco, Perú. El banco comunal esta en el tercer año de funcionamiento y a todos los socios les va muy bien. Hugo sigue viviendo en la histórica ciudad del Cusco del departamento del Cusco, Perú. En la ciudad del Cusco la mayoría de personas se dedican a diferentes tipos de negocios y a brindar servicios pues los negocios están fuertemente relacionados con el turismo. Hugo continúa vendiendo productos energéticos y alimenticios de la marca TIENS. Hugo con el anterior crédito le fue muy bien pudo incrementar sus ingresos económicos. En esta oportunidad Hugo requiere el préstamo para comprar más productos energéticos.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de zapatos, brindando el servicio de taxi, director de teatro y docentes. los socios que aparecen en la parte inferior de la fotografía llegaron después de la reunión.
texts.en:
The members are part of the communal bank "ILLARY CHASKA" of the Asociación Arariwa, and they all live in the beautiful city of Cusco.

Hugo continues to be a member of this communal bank with the Asociación Arariwa in the department of Cusco, Peru. The communal bank is in its third year and all the members are doing very well. Hugo still lives in the historic city of Cusco in the department of Cusco, Peru. In Cusco, most people work in various types of businesses, and to provide services, as these businesses have a strong relationship with tourism. Hugo continues to sell energy products and food by the brand TIENS. The previous loan was very good for Hugo; he was able to increase his income. 

Now Hugo needs the loan to buy more energy products. 

The other members work selling shoes, as a taxi driver, as a theatre director, and as educators. The members who appear in the lower portion of the photograph arrived after the meeting.

loans.use: to buy more energy products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy farm supplies for her coffee crop for the new season.

loans.name: Oscar Ernesto

texts.es: Oscar  habita en casa propia junto con su compañera de vida e hijo. Oscar posee un taller de carpintería en el cual fabrica y vende variedad de hermosos y finos muebles. Tiene muchos años de dedicarse al negocio y gracias a Dios y a su dedicación ha logrado mantenerlo en marcha. Muchas personas lo prefieren ya que él ofrece calidad y buenos precios en sus muebles. Últimamente los clientes han aumentado y cada día la demanda es mayor. Su sueño es poder ver florecer su negocio y sabe que para eso tiene que invertir un poco más en la producción de tal forma que logre cubrir toda la demanda. Para esto ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL para invertir en su negocio en la compra de madera, clavos, pega, barniz, junco y de más materiales que logren atraer a más clientes de tal forma que pueda logra su objetivo de mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Oscar lives in his own house with his wife and son.  He has a carpentry workshop where he makes and sells a variety of beautiful, fine furniture.  He has been in business for several years and thanks to God and his own dedication he has kept the business going.  Many people prefer his furniture over others because of its quality and low prices.  Lately, his customer base has increased so demand is growing daily.

His dream is to see his business flourish so he knows he must invest a bit more in production to meet demand.  To do this, he has decided to request a loan through INTEGRAL to buy wood, nails, glue, varnish, cane and other materials to attract more customers and reach his goal of a better quality of life for his family and himself.

loans.use: To buy wood, nails, glue, varnish, cane and other materials.

loans.name: Sol De Luna Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “SOL DE LUNA” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Alto Lima, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Eugenia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de cotillones, elaboración de tarimas, venta de comida, tejido de chompas, venta de pollos, librería, venta de golosinas, servicio de conducción.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Eugenia es integrante, ella indica que hace un año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una compañera de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de haba y uva; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió al apoyar a su madre en su negocio, posterior a aprender las la forma de venta decide emprender un negocio independiente.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de haba y uva por mayor) que adquirirá de las tiendas distribuidoras de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo implementará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella es casada  y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The communal bank "SOL DE LUNA" is beginning its first Pro Mujer cycle at the social center in Alto Lima.  The group is comprised of eight members and its board of directors is led by Eugenia, the president.  The members are involved in different business activities, including: party events, stage builders, food sales, knitted sweaters, chicken sales, bookstore, sweets sales and transport services.

The loan they are requesting will benefit small business owners such as Eugenia who has been a member of Pro Mujer for a year now.  She was invited to join by a colleague from the institution who visited her at home.  Her current business is selling beans and grapes, which is a trade she learned from her mother who she used to help.  After learning about sales she decided to set up her own business.

The loan she is requesting now is to increase her work capital to buy beans and grapes, wholesale, at the stores in the city of El Alto.  She will then sell them at her stall.  Her line of work allows her to generate an income to support her family since she is married and has three children. 

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says it is the health area training provided by the institution.

loans.use: To buy wholesale beans and grapes.

loans.name: Sandra Dinora

texts.es: Sandra de 40 años de edad es madre soltera vive con su hija en casa propia. Ella posee una tienda donde vende  productos de primera necesidad como arroz, frijoles, leche entre otros, últimamente se ha hecho de mucha clientela, pues siempre tiene lo que las personas necesitan con productos de  excelente calidad a precios realmente accesibles y con un servicio inigualable; Sandra es una mujer emprendedora con muchas ganas de salir adelante, quiere sentirse ganadora y para lograr el éxito sus mayores secretos son la constancia y la dedicación, está dispuesta a hacer crecer su negocio es por eso que le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar granos básicos, producto instantáneo, embutidos, golosinas, bebidas etc. ella tiene la confianza que con su dedicación podrá darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Sandra, 40, is a single mother who lives with her daughter in her own home.  She runs a store where she sells staple goods such as rice, beans, milk and other items.  Lately, she has had many customers since she always has on hand what people need in the way of excellent quality products at really low prices, with exceptionally good customer service.

Sandra is an entrepreneur who is determined to get ahead and feel successful.  Her best-kept secrets are her consistency and dedication.  She wants to expand her business and is requesting a loan through INTEGRAL to buy basic grains, instant products, sausages, sweets, beverages, etc.  With her dedication, she trusts she can give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: To buy basic grains, instant products, sausages, sweets, beverages, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy wholesale clothing and children's shoes.

loans.name: Tupito

texts.en:
Tupito is a 41-year-old married woman with 4 children. 

She owns and operates a small store selling items such as lavalava (a type of clothing), shirts, make-up, souvenirs, etc. She has been doing this for 3 years.

Tupito needs a loan to buy kava bowls, tapa cloth, hula skirts, men's solo, ladies' two-piece dresses, earrings, Samoan bangles, table mats, Elei lavalava and Samoan fans. She hopes to use her profits to support her family and kids. 

She became a member of SPBD in 2014 to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy kava bowls, tapa cloth, hula skirts, men's solo, ladies' two-piece dresses, earrings, Samoan bangles, table mats, Elei lavalava and Samoan fans

loans.name: Sinath

texts.en:
Sinath is 52 years old. She is a married woman with one child and she lives in Kampong Chhnang Provice, Cambodia. 

She is a grocery retailer and her husband is a motorcycle repairer. Both of them can earn approximately $10 per day. Now she would like to apply for a loan of $500 to purchase more goods for her retail shop. This loan will help her to bring in more income for her family.

In the future, she hopes that she can expand her grocery retail shop and build a new house.

loans.use: To purchase more goods for her retail shop

loans.name: Salome

texts.en: Salome is a married woman. She describes herself to be goal oriented. She operates a retail business where she sells vegetables. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a good area and most of her customers are regulars. She describes her biggest business challenge to be a lack of resources. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more vegetables to sell. Her business goal is to have a retail shop within five years. She hopes that in the future, her business will grow and her living standards will improve. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: buy more vegetables to sell

loans.name: Fale

texts.en:
Fale is a forty-eight-year-old married woman with six children.
 
She has a small plantation where she grows cabbages, green onions, tomatoes, green peppers and carrots to earn a living. She has been doing this for one year. Fale has requested a loan to buy chemicals, fertilizer, a wheelbarrow, a rake, bush knives, a garden hose and spade.

Fale has been a member of SPBD since 2002. With her profits, Fale hopes to grow her business and pay for her kids' education.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, fertilizer, a wheelbarrow, a rake, bushknives, a garden hose and spade

loans.name: Mavin

texts.en:
Mavin is a twenty-three-year-old man with two children. He describes himself to be hardworking. 

He operates a retail business where he sells sugar, bread, milk and other items. Most of the people he sells to are regular customers. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more bread, sugar and other items to sell. His business goal is to be the best within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will raise the living standard of his family. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: buy more bread and sugar to sell

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
Angelita is fifty-six years old and has one child.

She and her family survived super typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines on November 8th 2013 but her business and family home was wiped out. 

Angelita is taking out a housing loan amounting to PHP 10,000 to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family. Angelita has been an NWTF borrower since 2011. She plans to recover her general store business.

With your help, Angelita can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of super typhoon Haiyan. In future, she would like to save enough money to send her child to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to renew the sheep barn and expand it.

loans.name: Ulda Manuela

texts.es:
La Señora. Ulda forma parte del grupo de crédito Génesis, vive en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es muy visitada por su centro histórico el cual le dio el nombre Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad en Diciembre de 1999, se encuentra bañada por 4 ríos, su cultura, sus tradiciones y su gastronomía cautivan a propios y extraños.
La Señora Ulda tiene 36 años de edad, está casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 2 hijos de 14 y 4 años de edad, su primer hijo estudia en el colegio, su esposo es de profesión Abogado, la casa en la que viven es prestada de unos familiares.
Doña Ulda se dedica a los quehaceres de su hogar pero para aportar a la economía de su hogar trabaja como cajera, vende cosméticos por catalogo y también en la cría animales, le va bien y espera continuar creciendo en este negocio. Su crédito anterior  lo invirtió en cosméticos, su nuevo crédito también va a invertir en la compra de cosméticos de oferta para seguir creciendo en el negocio. Su grupo de crédito le gusta por la amistad que hay dentro del grupo, siempre se apoyan y todas se dan una mano para salir en adelante y cumplir sus metas.
texts.en:
Ulda is a part of the Génesis credit group. She lives in the city of Cuenca. This city is visited frequently because of its historic center, for which is was named a World Heritage Site in december of 1999. It is bathed in 4 rivers and its culture, traditions and cuisine captivate its own people and others. 

Ulda is 36 years old. She is married and from her marriage has 2 children, aged 14 and 4. Her oldest son is in high school and her husband is an attorney. The house they live in was lent to them by relatives. Ulda does the housework, but in order to contribute to the household budget, she also works as a cashier. She sells cosmetics via catalog and also raises animals. It is going well for her and she hopes to continue growing in this business. She invested her previous loan in cosmetics. Her new loan will also be invested in buying cosmetics on sale so she can keep growing in her business. She likes her credit group because of the friendship that there is in the group. They always support each other and give each other a hand so they can get ahead and achieve their goals.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Fanny Guadalupe

texts.es:
La Señora Fanny forma parte del grupo de crédito Génesis desde hace 3 años, vive en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es muy visitada por su centro histórico el cual le dio el nombre Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad en Diciembre de 1999, se encuentra bañada por 4 ríos, su cultura, sus tradiciones y su gastronomía cautivan a propios y extraños. 
La Señora Fanny tiene 42 años de edad, está casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 7 hijos, uno de sus hijos pasa en casa, uno estudia en la universidad, dos en el colegio y tres están en una escuelita de la ciudad, su esposo es dueño de un taller de latonería, la casa en la que viven es de un familia.
Doña Fanny se dedica al comercio, vende todo tipo de ropa, cobijas y edredones, esta actividad la desempeña 15 años, trabaja cinco días a la semana y este negocio le gusta porque tiene libertad para realizar otras actividades. Este crédito es para comprar ropa, cobijas y edredones. Su meta es tener un almacén propio para vender su mercadería.
texts.en:
Sra. Fanny has been part of the Genesis Communal Bank for 3 years. She lives in the city of Cuenca. This city attracts many visitors because of its historic downtown, which was designated a World Heritage Site in December, 1999. The place is bathed by four rivers and its culture, traditions and
local cuisine captivate native born and foreigners alike.

Sra. Fanny is 42 years old, married and as the fruit of her conjugal union has conceived 7 children. One of her children stays home, one studies at
the university, two are in high school and three attend elementary school in the city. Her husband owns a body shop. The house in which they live belongs to a family.

Fanny is a merchant. She sells all kinds of clothing, blankets and quilts. She has had the business for 15 years. She works five days a week and enjoys
it because she has the freedom to do other things. Her loan is to purchase clothing, blankets and quilts. Her goal is to have her own store to sell her merchandise.

loans.use: to purchase clothing, blankets and quilts.

loans.name: Panfilo

texts.es: El señor Panfilo tiene 51 años, él trabaja vendiendo empanadas y salteñas, el trabaja en la localidad de Sacaba, este préstamo es el primero  que tiene con la institución, el señor Panfilo va a usar este préstamo para culminar la instalación de agua a su domicilio ya que está por terminar su casita  y es mucho trabajo trasladar el agua  ya sea para la construcción como para el uso de agua potable y así de esta manera brindara mayor comodidad a su familia ya que por muchas razones la zona donde él  vive no cuenta con servicios básicos, el señor Panfilo se siente muy feliz y agradecido por esta oportunidad que le brindan para mejorar la construcción de su casa y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Panfilo is 51 years old and works selling empanadas and salteñas (a type of Bolivian baked empanada). He works in the Sacaba locality. This loan is his first with the institution. Panfilo will use this loan to finish installing running water in his house, as his house is about to be finished and it is a lot of work to bring water there, both for the construction and for usable drinking water. This way he will be able to make his family more comfortable, as, due to many reasons, the area where he lives lacks basic services.

Panfilo is very happy and grateful for the opportunity he is being given to improve the construction of his house and so to improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to finish installing running water in his house

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon is a 25 year old single man.  He describes himself to be determined.  He operates a transport business where he transports customers using his motorcycle.  He has been involved in this business for 6 years.  His business is located in a busy area and his primary customers are commuters. 

He will use the KES 70,000 loan to buy another motorcycle.  His business goal is to have a fleet of 6 motorcycles within 5 years.  He hopes that in the future, he will get enough profits to support his family.  This is his third loan with SMEP DTM.  The previous loans were repaid successfully.  He will use the anticipated profits to improve his living standards.

loans.use: buy another motorcycle

loans.name: Boniface

texts.en:
Boniface is a single man.  He describes himself to be determined.  He operates a transport business where he transports customers using his motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for 6 years.  His business is located in a busy area and his primary customers are commuters.  He describes his biggest business challenge to be insecurity. 

He will use the KES 70,000 loan to buy another motorcycle.  His business goal is to have 3 motorcycles and a public service vehicle within 5 years.  He hopes that in the future, he will get more funds to start a family comfortably.  This is his third loan with SMEP DTM.  The previous loans were repaid successfully.  He will use the anticipated profits to start another business.

loans.use: buy another motorcycle

loans.name: Adriana

texts.en:
A $1500 loan is being taken by Adriana  to improve her business.  She is married and she has four children.  She has a kiosk where many people come to buy every day.  She will buy some additional supplies such as soft drinks ( fanta, coca cola, sprite, sagiko), hard drinks ( beer ), water, noodles, cigarettes, coffee, sugar, salt and bread.

She has been involving herself in business activities since 2002.  She feels so comfortable in running her business because she can earn money every day.  Running a business has made Adriana independent because she can be responsible for herself and also helping her family.  She hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: To buy soft drinks ( fanta,coca cola, sprite, sagiko), hard drinks ( beer ), water, noodles, cigarettes, coffee, sugar, salt and bread

loans.name: Carolina

texts.en:
Carolina is 59 years old, married with four children.  She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Carolina's house was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013.  She has started rebuilding her life and is committed to regain what she lost.  Carolina is taking out a PHP 10,000 Housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family.

Carolina has been with NWTF since 2013 in her pursuit to rise out of poverty.  With your help she will be able to start once more in a new home.  In the future, Carolina would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine works hard to support her family.  On November 8, 2013, her business and home were wiped out by super typhoon Haiyan.

She has restarted her business and is now requesting a PHP 10,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor so she could build a house for her family.

With your help Catherine will be able to rebuild her devastated life sooner.  In the future, she would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Jewelyn

texts.en:
Jewelyn's greatest dream in life is having all her children finish their education and become a degree holders. She wants her children to be efficient and hired for a job, someday. Jewelyn has four children and all are going to school. Her children are in between elementary and high school level of education.

Jewelyn is 43 years old and is married. Her husband is a driver of a fuel tanker. Jewelyn is engaged in a retailing business, selling grocery items in their village. She has been doing her business for five years and she is hoping to continue managing it. 

Jewelyn is requesting a loan of PHP 20,000 to buy drinks, bread, spices, and condiments to sell. She will do her best to make her business grow and fulfill her dreams.

loans.use: to buy drinks, bread, spices, and condiments to sell.

loans.name: Relita

texts.en: Relita lives in the municipality of Tumauini. She is the married mother of two children. She has a business selling second-hand clothing. She is requesting the loan to purchase a bale of used clothing for women, men and children to fill orders that she has. She is grateful to the support that Kiva and ASKI have given her so that she can improve her finances.

loans.use: to purchase a bale of used clothing for women, men and children to fill orders that she has.

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
