Leah is a 37-year-old married woman. She has two children. She describes herself to be determined. She operates a farm where she grows vegetables. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in an area ideal for farming, and her primary customers are hoteliers. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate capital.

She will use the 20,000 Kenyan shillings loan to buy fertilizer. Her business goal is to have a stable business within five years. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is a 42-year-old married woman. She has two children. She describes herself to be visionary and productive. 

Florence operates a farm where she keeps pigs; she has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a fertile and productive place, and her primary customers are hotels and individuals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be a lack of finances. 

She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy pig feed and add more pigs. 

Her business goal is to be a successful farmer within five years. This is  her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: buy pig feed and add more pigs

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is forty-three years old. She is married and has five children, two of whom are in school.

Edna and her family survived super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013, but her business and family home were wiped out. 

She is taking out a housing loan amounting to PHP 10,000 to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family. 

Edna has been an NWTF borrower since 2012. She plans to recover through her fish vending.

With your help, Edna can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of super typhoon Haiyan. In the future, she would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Elina

texts.en:
Elina is 53 years old and married with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Elina's house was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. She has restarted her food vending and agriculture business and is committed to regain what she lost. Elina is taking out a PHP 5,500 housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build her a house for her family.

She has been with NWTF since 2013 in her pursuit to rise out of poverty. With your help, she will be able to start once more in a new home. In the future, Elina would like to save enough to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Emelita

texts.en:
Emelita works hard to support her family. On November 8, 2013, her business and home were wiped out by super typhoon Haiyan.

She has restarted her business and is now requesting a PHP 10,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor so she can build a house for her family.

With your help, Emelita will be able to rebuild her devastated life sooner.

In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business and so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Emilia

texts.en:
Emilia is 34 years old and married with three children who are in school. Emilia works very hard to provide for them.

Emilia's business and family home were destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Emilia has restarted her business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Emilia has taken a 9,500 PHP (Philippines pesos) housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home.

She is using this loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Emilia is committed to rebuild her devastated life and in the future, would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to rebuild her family home after super typhoon Haiyan

loans.name: Ederlina

texts.en:
Ederlina is fifty-one years old and married with eight children, three of whom are in school. Ederlina works very hard to provide for them.

Ederlina's business and family home were destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Ederlina has restarted her business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Ederlina has taken a PHP 10,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home.

She is using this loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Ederlina is committed to rebuild her devastated life, and in the future, would like to save enough money to send her children college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Anaclita

texts.en:
An $800 loan is offered to Anaclita to improve her business. She is married, and she is 27 years old with two children. She opened her kiosk in 2010 with her own working capital. 

She will use the loan to buy stock to keep in her store like body lotion, slippers, shampoo, salt and soap. Anaclita is generating a good income from selling.

She has been thinking of running a big business after years of involving herself in doing business. She is living in a town with her family, and her husband is a driver.

loans.use: To buy body lotion, slippers, shampoo, salt and soap

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 20 years old and has one child.

She and her family survived super typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013, but her business and family home were wiped out. 

Evelyn is taking out a housing loan amounting to 9,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family. 

Evelyn has been an NWTF borrower since 2013. She plans to recover through her business.

With your help, Evelyn can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of super typhoon Haiyan. In the future she would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house after super typhoon Haiyan

loans.name: Ivan

texts.es:
Iván tiene 38 años de edad, es un productor de café a pequeña escala en la parte norte de Nicaragua. Él vive con su esposa y su hijo de 8 meses en una comunidad del departamento de Jinotega. Siempre se ha dedicado a la caficultura y actualmente produce bajo los criterios de certificación de Comercio Justo.

Para este ciclo productivo, este pequeño productor está solicitando un financiamiento que le permita garantizar los insumos y fertilizantes para el mantenimiento y cosecha de sus plantaciones de café. 

El adecuado manejo que Iván le brinde a sus plantaciones contribuirá además a darle una mayor productividad lo cual contribuirá a mejorar las condiciones de su familia a través de la generación de más ingresos.
texts.en:
Iván is 38 years old.  He is a small-scale coffee farmer in the northern region of Nicaragua.  He lives with his wife and his eight-month old son in a community in the Jinotega district.  He has always worked growing coffee, and he currently produces under the Fair Trade certification criteria.  

For this production cycle, this small producer is seeking financing that will allow him to purchase supplies and fertilizers to maintain and harvest his coffee plantations.  The proper care that Iván provides to his crops will also allow him to produce a better harvest which will contribute to his ability to improve his family's living conditions by generating more income.

loans.use: purchase supplies and fertilizers to maintain his coffee plantation.

loans.name: Felicidad

texts.en:
Felicidad is 61 years old with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Felicidad's house was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines on November 8, 2013. She has restarted her business, and is committed to regaining what she lost. 

Felicidad is taking out a PHP 10,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family.

She has been with NWTF since 2011 in her pursuit to rise out of poverty. With your help, she will be able to start once more in a new home. 

In the future, Felicidad would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Tuyết

texts.en:
Mrs. Tuyết operates a food stall/restaurant selling fish. She is requesting a loan to purchase fish to sell. Tuyết has been involved in this business for six years. The main hardship that Tuyết faces in her business is the lack of capital.

Tuyết is 44 years old and she is married with three children. She lives in Tân Lộc Hải Lộc. 

This is Tuyết first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women.

With her business profit, Tuyết hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase fish to sell.

loans.name: Remy

texts.en:
Remy’s wish is for her family to always enjoy good health. A 31-year-old mother of two children, she runs a small sari-sari store business in their village. Her husband is a driver who also works as a carpenter in his spare time.

Remy wants to expand and extend the products she sells to her customers and is therefore requesting a loan of P7,000 to buy drinks, biscuits and breads to sell. She  hopes to increase her income through this expansion to better sustain her family's needs.

loans.use: to buy drinks, biscuits and breads to sell.

loans.name: Gener

texts.en:
Being a responsible father, Gener aims to improve his farming business to generate sufficient income and satisfy the necessities of his family. He is 45 years old and has three children attending school. Despite the hardship of living, he has the determination to uplift their status of living and educate all his children. 

To improve his farming business, he is asking for a loan of 25,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) to buy herbicide, fertilizers and certified seeds, and pay the expenses incurred in vegetable production. He is hoping that his loan will be granted to be able for him to improve the business.

loans.use: to buy herbicide, fertilizers and certified seeds, and pay the expenses incurred in vegetable production

loans.name: Dinah

texts.en: Dinah is a single entrepreneur who manages a transportation service business aside from selling rice. For more than five years, she has earned well so that she has successfully repaid her previous loan used for her motor. Currently, she is borrowing a new loan to cover the costs for licenses renewal. Dinah hopes to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to cover the costs for licenses renewal.

loans.name: Rivio

texts.en: Rivio is 46 and married. He has two school-age children. He raises his family in a rural community and makes their living through farming. To sustain the necessities of his family, he aims to expand his vegetable production business to ensure a high production. Having limited capital, he wants to obtain a loan of PHP 25,000 to buy certified seeds, fertilizers and herbicides needed in vegetable production. Through this financial assistance, he believes that he will be able to expand his vegetable plantation and increase his production. Someday, he is hoping that he will improve their status of living and educate his children.

loans.use: to buy certified seeds, fertilizers and herbicides needed in vegetable production.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is a 33-year-old man. He describes himself to be visionary and focused. He operates a butchery where he sells meat. He has been involved in this business for six years. His primary customers are individuals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be availability of finances. He will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy more stock of meat and to pay rent for his business premises. His business goal is to be a successful businessman within five years. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy more meat and to pay rent

loans.name: James

texts.en: James is a single man. He describes himself to be diligent. He operates a retail business where he sells bread, sweets, washing soap and other items. He has been involved in this business for 5 years. His business is located in a productive place and his primary customers are local customers. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of bread, washing soap, sweets and other items. His business goal is to own a wholesale shop within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will improve the general welfare of his family. This is his second loan with SMEP DTM. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of bread, washing soap, sweets and other items.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to rent more storage space for keeping bread.

loans.name: Priscilla

texts.en:
Priscilla is a 33-year-old married woman. She has two children. She describes herself to be determined. 

She operates a restaurant where she cooks food for sell; she has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in an area ideal for the business. She describes her biggest business challenge to be a lack of finances. 

Priscilla will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of ingredients for preparing food. 

Her business goal is to have a stable business within five years. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy more stock of ingredients for preparing food

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita earns a living from transportation services and rental. For many years, Teresita  has earned well and improved the business. Her earnings goes to sustain their daily living. 

To buy new tires, she borrowed a loan from GDMPC micro credit. 

She hopes to have greater returns in order to generate additional income for the purpose of providing a better and comfortable living for her family in the future.

loans.use: to buy new tires

loans.name: Gellia

texts.en:
Gellia is 45 years old and married with three children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Gellia's business and family home were destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines on November 8, 2013. Gellia has restarted her business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

She has taken a PHP 10,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home.

She is using this loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Gellia is committed to rebuild her devastated life, and in future would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda works hard to support her family. On November 8, 2013, her business and home were wiped out by super typhoon Haiyan.

She has restarted her business and is now requesting a PHP 10,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor so she could build a house for her family.

With your help, Imelda will be able to rebuild her devastated life sooner.

In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Agustinha

texts.en:
Agustinha is 29 years old and she is now applying for a loan of $600 to improve her business.  She opened her kiosk in 2000 with her own working capital of $100. She earns a good income from her business.

Agustinha will use her loan to buy some stocks to keep in her store such as books, pencils, water, body lotion and electronic equipment. She is a very hardworking woman and doing business has become her regular activity for the past 14 years. She wants to make her business bigger and improve her living conditions in the future.

loans.use: to buy books, pencils, water, body lotion and electronic equipment.

loans.name: Nicolás Darío

texts.es:
Nicolás ha sido un hombre de múltiples ideas de negocio, a sus 52 años puede decir que  ha manejado negocios grandes como distribuidoras y discotecas, pero con malas experiencias por parte de sus colaboradores; ahora se dedica a un negocio pequeño ubicado en Betulia – Colombia.
El establecimiento es una combinación entre cafetería y taberna, donde ofrece servicios de desayuno, venta de licor, venta de recargas y minutos para celular y confitería; trabaja en horarios extensos y le gusta laborar solo.
Él solicita un crédito para abastecer su negocio con surtido de productos como licor y frituras que comprándolas de contado puede obtener mejores precios y así aumentar un poco su utilidad.
Su objetivo es comprar el local donde tiene ubicado el establecimiento y así dejar de pagar arriendo, esto impactará positivamente sobre sus ingresos y podrá darle una mejor calidad de vida a su hijo.
El mayor desafío que enfrenta este emprendedor individuo es la época en la cual no hay cosecha de café, pues es la actividad económica de la región donde vive y al no estar en temporada, los clientes y visitantes disminuyen.
texts.en:
Nicolás has been a man of many business ideas. At 52 years old, he can say that he has run large businesses like distributors and nightclubs, but they were bad experiences due to his partners. He now runs a small business in Betulia, Colombia for a living.
The establishment is a combination of cafeteria and tavern, where he offers breakfast service, liquor sales, candy, and the sale of charging and minutes for cell phones. He works extensive hours and likes to work alone.
He is requesting a loan to stock his business with a variety of products like liquor and snacks, that when buying in cash he can obtain better pricing and slightly increase their profit.
He goal is to buy the shop where his business is located so he can stop paying rent. This will positively impact his income and he will be able to give his son a better quality of life.
The biggest challenge that this enterprising individual faces is the periods in which there is no coffee harvest, as it is the economic activity of the region where he lives. When it is not in season, his visitors and customers decrease.

loans.use: to stock his business with a range of products like liquor and snacks that buying in cash will obtain him better pricing.

loans.name: Juan Sebastian

texts.es:
El es Juan Sebastian, una persona  de 17 años, comprometido con lo que quiere, responsable y humilde, el mas que todo desea convertirse en un gran profesional y obtener el título de médico algún día, pero para eso necesita obtener ciertas experiencias y adquirir habilidades que los médicos no poseen, como cuidar de las personas de diferentes maneras, pero por ahora  el quiere estudiar y ser un AUXILIAR DE ENFERMERÍA  pues el piensa que así puede adquirir la experiencia y las habilidades necesarias para ser un excelente medico y así entender mejor a la gente.
El ya posee ciertas habilidades, esto se debe a que la abuela le dio una  enfermedad hace aproximadamente 2 años y el es una de las personas quien la cuida. 

Principalmente el sueño de Sebastián es ayudar a la familia y sacar adelante a la mama, el papa y el hermano menor para ser un apoyo más en el hogar, la meta es principalmente convertirse en un medico con todas las habilidades necesarias y así poder ayudar a los demás, desde niño el siempre ha querido ser un medico pero el sabe que no va  a ser fácil pero el puede serlo ya teniendo conocimientos como enfermero auxiliar,  por eso el quiere tanto ser un enfermero, por que el sabe que poco a poco se va avanzando y el quiere saber qué es ser un enfermero. 
El es aspirante a el convenio kiva por que le intereso mucho y considera que es una oportunidad para que el tenga una ayuda y poder estudiar, pues el no tiene los recursos necesarios para poder pagar el estudio, el único apollo que tiene es el del padre.
texts.en:
He is Juan Sebastian, he is 17 years old.  He is committed to what he wants, responsible and humble.  Above all, he wishes to become a great professional and earn a medical degree someday.  However, for this he needs to gain certain experience and acquire the skills that physicians do not have, such as caring for people in different ways.  For now, he wants to study to become a nursing assistant because he thinks that through this he can gain the experience and skills necessary to be an excellent doctor and better understand people.  He already has certain skills because his grandmother became ill about two years ago, and he was one of the people who cared for her.  

Sebastián's main dream is to help his family, get his mother, father and younger brother ahead, and help support his household.  His primary goal is to become a doctor with all of the necessary skills, and be able to help others.  Since he was a child, he always wanted to be a doctor, but he knows that it will not be easy but he can do it once he has the knowledge as a nursing assistant.  For this reason, he wants to be a nurse, as he knows that little by little he will advance, and he wants to know what it is to be a nurse.  

He is applying for the Kiva program because he was very interested in it, and he believes that it is an opportunity for him to get help and attend school because he does not have the necessary resources to pay for school.  The only help he has is from his father.

loans.use: pay for a semester of school.

loans.name: Eliseo Del Carmen

texts.es:
Eliseo es un joven de 28 años de edad, dedicado a la producción de café desde hace 5 años en una comunidad del departamento de Jinotega, Nicaragua. Posee una finca de 5.24 hectáreas, de las cuales 3.14 hectáreas han sido destinadas para el cultivo de café, que produce bajo los criterios de certificación de Comercio Justo.

Su producción de café hasta ahora ha sido baja, aunque ha ido mejorando en los últimos tres años pasando de 35 a 50 quintales de café pergamino. El plan de finca de este joven emprendedor comprende el aumento de estos rendimientos basado en un manejo integral de su finca. 

Para garantizar el manejo de sus plantaciones en este ciclo, Eliseo está solicitando un crédito que le permita garantizar la compra de insumos y fertilizantes necesarios para su cafetal y lograr una mayor producción.

Su sueño es lograr que su finca sea sostenible y formar una familia a la que pueda brindar mejores condiciones de vida a las que él ha tenido.
texts.en:
Eliseo is 28 years old and has been growing coffee for 5 years in a community in the Department of Jinotega, Nicaragua. He has a farm of 5.24 hectares , 3.14 hectares of which are used for growing coffee. He grows following the requirements of the Fair Trade certification.

His production up to now has been low although it has been improving in the last 3 years going from 35 to 50 quintals of parchment coffee. The plan for the farm of this young entrepreneur includes increasing these yields under the complete management of his farm. To guarantee the management of his plantation in this cycle Eliseo is requesting a loan which will allow him to buy the inputs and fertilizers needed for his coffee crops and produce more. His dream is for his farm to be sustainable and have a family for whom he can provide better living conditions than what he enjoyed.

loans.use: to buy inputs and fertilizer needed for his coffee crops.

loans.name: Hijas De Villa Group

texts.es: Un grupo conformado por  9  mujeres   responsables a distintas actividades comerciales  todos ellas  residen en el distrito de V.E.S. Así son las integrantes del grupo comunal. “HIJAS DE VILLA” una de ellas es liana de 23 Años de edad soltera y sin hijos, liana  se dedica hace  3  años al servicio de costura remalle, liana  confecciona prendas de vestir, en un pequeño local (alquilado) con el fin de progresar día a día y salir adelante,  liana a sabido ganarse a los clientes  y así poder mejorar su calidad de vida. liana  solicito el préstamo para comprar prendas de vestir (telas) la vez  y todos los integrantes se encuentran  agradecidos  con Kiva  por el préstamo otorgado  y por la confianza que se  les ha sido brindada. liana se encuentra así a la izquierda es la primera, se le distingue con un polo de color anaranjado, Se despide  Dejando la promesa  que cumplirá todas sus metas propuestas.
texts.en:
This group is made up of nine responsible women who all have different commercial activities but who all live in the V.E.S. district. These are the members of the “HIJAS DE VILLA” communal bank.

One of them is Liana who is 23 years old, single with no children. For the past 3 years Liana has been providing sewing services. She sews clothing in a small rented space with the goal of progressing from day to day and getting ahead. She knows how to make clients and by doing this improves her quality of life. Liana is requesting a loan to buy clothing (fabric).

All the members of the group are grateful to Kiva to the loan being offered and for the confidence invested in them. Liana is the first person to the left and is wearing an orange shirt. They say good-bye promising to meet all the goals they have proposed.

loans.use: to buy fabric.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is a 48-year-old married woman. She has four children, and describes herself to be focused. 

Judith operates a retail business where she sells fish and maize. Her business is located in a busy market, and her primary customers are both men and women. She describes her biggest business challenge to be a lack of capital. 

She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of fish and maize. 

Judith's business goal is to be a supplier within five years. 

She hopes that in she will improve her livelihood in the future. She will use the anticipated profits to educate her children.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fish and maize

loans.name: Tươi

texts.en:
Mrs. Tươi has a retail business selling plastic goods. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.

Tươi is 60 years old, and she is married with two children. She lives in the Hoang Hoa district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2008, Tươi joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Tươi has successfully repaid one loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

The main hardship that Tươi faces in her life is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet.

In the future, Tươi hopes for her business to do well, to buy land of her own, and to remodel her house.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet.

loans.name: Lương

texts.en:
Lương is 39 years old, and she is married with two children. Lương lives in Hoang Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. Mrs. Lương works in agriculture, farming poultry and cattle. Lương has been involved in this business for eight years.

In 2010, Lương joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Lương has successfully repaid one loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  

The main hardship that Lương faces in her life is not having a water tank and water filter. She is requesting a loan to buy a water tank and clean water filter.

With her business profit, Lương hopes to make enough money to provide for her kids, to maintain a successful business, and to buy land of her own.

loans.use: to buy a water tank and clean water filter

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is 27 years old and has two children; she works very hard to provide for them.

Gemma's business and family home were destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines on November 8, 2013. Gemma has restarted her business, and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

She has taken a PHP 6,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home. She is using this loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Gemma is committed to rebuilding her devastated life, and in the future, would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Aurea

texts.en:
Aurea is applying for a loan of $1,500 to improve her business. 

She is running a business in her house by selling secondhand clothing.  She is making a good income from selling secondhand clothing, and she wants to buy more stock with the loan. 

She is living a town near the main road, so many people come to buy, and she sells every day. 

Aurea opened her kiosk a year ago with her own working capital of $600.

loans.use: To buy shirts, shorts, and pants.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase agricultural supplies to care for her coffee crops.

loans.name: María Josefina

texts.es:
María de 55 años de edad, es casada, es madre de 3 hijos,  uno de ellos está acompañando vive allí con la esposa y el niño. La cliente tiene esposo que trabaja de vigilante en la montaña de esa comunidad, y los hijos son mecánicos y le ayudan a obtener ingresos, ellos ya no dependen de ella son adultos y trabajan para los propios gastos. 
Ella tiene experiencia de ama de casa,  hace tortillas para la venta, engorda gallinas para venderlas al fin del año,  tiene 15 años con este negocio , lo aprendió cuando  se dió cuenta que ella también podía obtener ingresos para ayudar a su esposo y así tener una mejor vida porque con más ingresos es mejor la familia.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO, es para comprar unas láminas y mejorar la cocina porque en el invierno se le  llena de agua, no puede cocinar son muchas goteras de agua y el resto es para cancelar una deuda que posee en la institución.  Con este crédito comenta que cubrirá una necesidad muy grande, porque es muy difícil soportar otro invierno con esas condiciones extremas en  su cocina.
La cliente sueña tener una cocina excelente,  para  hacer bien su trabajo que es hacer tortillas. La cliente sueña ver a los hijos con una casa propia; porque es muy importante tener un buen techo propio.
texts.en:
María is 55 years old, married, and has three children.  One of her children is married and lives with his wife and their son.  The client has a husband who works as a guard in the mountain of the community.  Her children are mechanics, and help them generate an income.  Her children no longer depend on her, they are adults and work for their own expenses.  She has experience as a homemaker.  She makes tortillas to sell and raises chickens to sell at the end of the year.  She has 15 years of experience in this business which she learned when she realized that she could also earn an income to help her husband, and in so doing, have a better life because with more income that family will be better.

The loan that she is seeking from CREDICAMPO will be used to purchase sheet metal and repair the kitchen, because in the winter it floods and she cannot cook with so many leaks.  The rest will be used to pay off her debt with the bank.  She states that with this loan, she will be able to take care of her biggest need, because it will be very difficult to make it through another winter in these extreme conditions in her kitchen.  The client dreams of having an excellent kitchen so that she can do her job of making tortillas well.  The client dreams of seeing her children in their own homes because it is very important to have your own proper home.

loans.use: purchase sheet metal and repair the kitchen because in the winter it floods and she cannot cook with so many leaks.  The rest will be used to pay off her debt to the bank.

loans.name: Santos

texts.es:
Santos es un pequeño caficultor de 32 años  que vive en una comunidad al norte de Nicaragua. En su finca posee 2.89 hectáreas dedicadas al cultivo de café, el cual produce bajo el proceso de certificación de Comercio Justo. La producción promedio de café obtenida por este productor en los últimos tres años es de 100 quintales pergamino.

Para este ciclo, está solicitando un crédito que le permita darle un mantenimiento más intensivo a su cafetal, ya que en los últimos años sus plantaciones han sido afectadas por plagas y enfermedades, las cuales está seguro podrá controlar con la aplicación de insumos y fertilizantes de manera oportuna en base a un plan de manejo integral.

En un futuro, Santos ve su pequeña finca con mejores rendimientos productivos y con más área de café, que le permita además de cubrir sus necesidades mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Santos is a small coffee grower.  He is 32 years old and lives in a community in northern Nicaragua.  On his farm, he has 2.89 hectares dedicated to growing coffee, which he produces under the Fair Trade certification process.  His average coffee production over the past three years has been 100 bushels.  

During this cycle, he is seeking a loan that will allow him to provide more intensive care to his coffee plantations because during the past few years, his crops have been affected by pests and diseases.  He is confident that he will be able to control them by applying supplies and fertilizers in a timely manner based on an integrated management plan.  In the future, Santos sees his small farm with better yields and with a larger area of coffee that will allow him to not only cover his household expenses, but to also improve his home.

loans.use: to provide more intensive care to his coffee plantation.

loans.name: Tùng

texts.en:
Tùng is 36 years old and he is married with three children. He lives in Hoang Hoa district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

He  works in agriculture, farming poultry and cattle.  Tùng has been involved in this business for eight years. The main hardship that Tùng faces in his life is not having a hygenic latrine. He is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, and bricks to build a toilet.

This is his first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women.  With his business profit, Tùng hopes for his business to do well, to make enough money to provide for his kids, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for his business.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, and bricks to build a toilet.

loans.name: Adolfa

texts.en:
Adolfa runs a general store selling a variety of grocery goods and home-use products in the local community. She earns a good income from this and has successfully repaid her previous loan used for the business.  

Recently she has taken out another loan to purchase additional groceries to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to save as a reserve for future emergencies. 

She wants to have a better standard of living in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery goods to sell.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising livestock. From raising pigs, she earns a good income to cover their needs and was able to buy a motorcycle for another business venture. 

In 2004, Teresita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her standard of living and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from GDMPC which was used for her piggery. 

Recently she has taken a new loan to buy a new set of tires in order to replace the old ones. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy a new set of tires

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is a 40-year-old married woman. She has four children. She describes herself to be focused. 

She operates a farm where she grows tea. She has been involved in this business for ten years. Her business is located in a fertile and productive place and her primary customers are tea factories. She describes her biggest business challenge to be low prices. 

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy farm inputs and pay farm laborers. Her business goal is to be a successful farmer within five years. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: buy farm inputs and pay farm laborers

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is a 39-year-old widowed woman with two children who are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Gina's house was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. She has restarted her manicure services and is committed to regain what she lost. She is taking out a PHP 10,000 Housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build her a house for her family.

Gina has been with NWTF since 2011 in her efforts to rise out of poverty. With your help, she will be able to start once more in a new home.  In the future, Gina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Julita

texts.en:
Julita is 40 years old and has five children. She is married and two of her children are currently in school.

She is in the agricultural business, farming onions and flowers in the Philippines. Julita requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Julita has been farming onions and flowers for three years now, and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Julita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and other farm supplies

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
As a married parent of nine children, Carmelita works hard to support her family.

She has a dressmaking business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from house rental and buying and selling dry goods. 

Carmelita is borrowing PHP 29,000 through NWTF to buy additional materials like fabric, thread, zippers, etc. for her dressmaking business.

Carmelita has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. 

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional materials like fabric, thread, zippers, etc. for her dressmaking business

loans.name: Nhung

texts.en:
Nhung is 34 years old and is married with 3 children. She lives with 3 dependents in Hoang Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

Nhung works in agriculture, farming poultry and cattle, and she has been in this business for 7 years. 

The main hardship that Nhung faces in her life is not having a latrine, so her family has to share a neighbor's latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet.

With her business profit, Nhung hopes to make enough money to provide for her kids and to maintain a successful business.

This is Nhung's first loan with Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet.

loans.name: Sadorat

texts.en:
Sadorat is 56 years old. She is a hardworking and smart woman. Sadorat is married and has three children. She lives with her family in a rural area. 

Sadorat is one of the kind and hardworking women of her village. Sadorat for more than 35 years has been busy with the farming business. She grows potatoes. Sadorat’s husband and some of her children are migrants in Russia because there are no factories or any organizations in their village to work in. 

Sadorat is the main provider for her family and so she works hard to earn for living. She is going to make new sowing of potatoes but she has no money. She is asking for a loan of 4,500 TJS to buy seeds and mineral fertilizer. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy seeds and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Bắc

texts.en:
Bắc works in agriculture farming poultry and cattle.

She is 41 years old and she is married with 3 children. She lives in Hoang Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Bắc's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Bắc faces in her life is not having hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and brick to build toilet.

With her business profit, Bắc hopes to make enough money to provide for her kids, to maintain a successful business, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and brick to build toilet.

loans.name: Jezreel

texts.en: Jezreel is 31. She is married and has three children. Due to financial hardship, she has engaged in a hog-raising business to help her husband in generating income. She aims to improve and strengthen her business in order to earn a higher income. Due to insufficient capital, she is asking for a loan of 44,000 PHP to buy hog feed, vitamins, additional piglets and materials needed to improve the pigpen. She is hoping that someday she will improve her hog-raising business and their status of living through this financial assistance.

loans.use: to buy hog feed, vitamins, additional piglets and materials needed to improve her pigpen.

loans.name: Emelkan

texts.ru: Эмелкан 62 года, образование средне-специальное, мать 5 детей.  Животноводством занимается на протяжении многих лет, стартовав с покупки одного теленка. На сегодняшний день в своем хозяйстве имеет 2 коровы, 6 коз. Есть все условия для содержания скота. Ежемесячный совокупный доход составляет около 10,000 сом (KGS). Эмелкан ответственна и предприимчива, умеет правильно вести хозяйство и вкладывать средства по назначению. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства Эмелкан обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом на покупку коров. Эмелкан намерена увеличить поголовье скота, тем самым увеличив прибыль от реализации молока и молочной продукции. Доходы от кредита позволят ей отремонтировать дом.
texts.en: Emelkan is 62 with a specialist high school education and the mother of five children. She has been working in animal husbandry for many years, a business she began with the purchase of one calf. She now has two cows and six goats as well as everything necessary to care for livestock, with a total monthly income of about 10,000 KGS. Emelkan is responsible and enterprising and knows how to properly care for a household and invest toward a goal. With the aim of further developing her business, she has turned to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan to purchase cows. She intends to increase the number of livestock she has in order to increase profits from the sale of milk and dairy products. Profits from the loan will allow her to renovate her house.

loans.use: to buy cows

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret is a married woman who has three children. She describes herself as determined. She operates a farm where she grows tea and cabbage. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in an area ideal for farming. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate capital. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy fertilizer and other farm inputs. Her business goal is to have a stable business within five years. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: tp buy fertilizer and other farm inputs

loans.name: San Expedito Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama San Expedito, es uno nuevo que está en su primer ciclo del programa de comités, además están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de la pobreza, que les permitirá poder conocer su vida y la de sus familias.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Victoria  quien en su encuesta mostró un nivel rojo, es decir que tiene escasos ingresos, por lo que ella está esforzándose bastante. Además de eso es decoradora, y de esa forma está luchando por mejorar y dar a su familia todo lo que necesitan. 
La Sra. Victoria solicita de este préstamo para comprar telas, alfileres, cartulinas, etc., lo que le ayudará a seguir con su trabajo de  decoradora. Agradece por esta oportunidad que está recibiendo de seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
The new group named “San Expedito” is in its first loan cycle with the committee program. In addition, the members have taken the poverty elimination survey so that they can know more about their lives and those of their families.

One of members is Sra. Victoria, whose survey indicated that she is at a red level. In other words, she has limited income. For this reason, she is trying to do her best. Victoria works as an events decorator, so she strives to improve and provide everything her family needs.

She is requesting a loan in order to buy fabrics, pins, card stock, and other supplies so that she can continue her work as a decorator. Sra. Victoria is grateful for the opportunity she has received to keep growing.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, pins, card stock, and other supplies.

loans.name: Shahriniso

texts.ru:
Шахринисо фермер, проживающая в районе А.Джоми. Ей 57 лет, однако несмотря на свой возраст она продолжает работать на грядке и заниматься посевной работой. Шахринисо имеет большой участок земли, на котором она выращивает хлопок - самый ценный продукт на экспортных рынках. В посеве и сборе урожая ей помогает семья. Шахринисо занимается земледельческой деятельностью более 15 лет. Она опытный фермер, всегда старающийся получить богатый и качественный урожай. 
В данный момент, как вы видите на фотографии Шахринисо подготовила почву и сделала грядки для нового посева. Она просит кредит, чтобы купить хлопковые семена, минеральные удобрения, а также оплатить услугу тракториста. С вашей поддержкой Шахринисо сможет продолжить свою деятельность. Этот кредит ей действительно важен.
texts.en:
Shahriniso is a farmer who lives in the A. Jomi region. She is 57, but despite her age she continues to work in the fields and perform agricultural work. She has a large piece of land on which she grows cotton, the highest-priced product on the export market. Her family helps her with the sowing and the harvest. Shahriniso has been working in agriculture for more than 15 years. She is an experienced farmer, always trying to achieve a rich and bountiful harvest.

At the moment, as you can see in the photograph, Shahriniso has prepared the soil and made beds for the new planting. She is requesting a loan to buy cotton seeds and mineral fertilizers as well as to hire a tractor driver. With your support she will be able to continue her work. This loan is very important to her.

loans.use: to buy cotton seeds and fertilizer and hire a tractor driver

loans.name: Hà

texts.en:
Hà is 44 years old, married with two children and works in agriculture, farming poultry and cattle.

Hà lives with two dependents in Nong Cong district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Hà's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.
Hà has been involved in her business for more than 10 years.
The main hardship Hà faces in her life is not having a sanitary latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and brick for building a toilet and bathroom.

With her business profit, Hà hopes to make enough money to provide for her children, that they find good jobs, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and brick for building a toilet and bathroom.

loans.name: Ninh

texts.en:
Ninh has a retail business selling dry food.

Ninh is 50 years old, single and has three children.
She lives and works in Nong Cong district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Ninh's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.
Ninh has been involved in her business for more than 10 years.
One of the difficulties that most concerns her is not having a sanitary latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and brick for building a toilet and bathroom.

With her business profit, Ninh hopes to build a new house and  for her children to graduate from college and find good jobs.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and brick for building a toilet and bathroom

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia works hard to support her family. Alicia is married and has a sewing business in the Philippines.

Alicia requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more materials for her sewing business.

Alicia has been in this business for 20 years now.

Alicia would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more materials for her sewing business

loans.name: Aileen

texts.en:
Aileen is 21 years old and single.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Aileen is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Aileen has been raising pigs for four years and earns additional income from running a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Jose Santos

texts.es: Jose de 36 años de edad el se dedica a la agricultura desde hace varios años siembra frijol y maíz,  y con las ventas que realiza de sus cosechas logra solventar los gastos que tiene en su hogar, es un hombre responsable, honesto y trabajador vive con su esposa y sus tres hijos. Jose está solicitando un crédito para poder comprar insumos para su cosecha como: fertilizantes, abonos, semillas, herbicidas, etc. ya que con lo que gana no le alcanza para cubrir esos gastos y así tener mejores ingresos y tener una mejor estabilidad económica
texts.en:
Jose is 36 years old and has been farming for several years, growing corn and beans. By selling his harvest he manages to cover some household expenses. He is a responsible, honest, and hard-working man, who lives with his wife and three children.

José is requesting a loan so that he can buy supplies for his harvest, such as fertilizers, manures, seeds, herbicides, etc., as what he makes it is not enough to cover those costs. This will enable him to have better income and better financial stability.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, manures, seeds, herbicides, etc.

loans.name: Jose

texts.es: Jose es casado y tiene un hijo, vive con su familia en El Alto en una casa de ladrillo y cemento que es de su propiedad. Jose es administrador de una pension (en Bolivia se le dice así a restaurantes de segunda y/o tercera categoría) Necesita credito para comprar viveres como arroz, fideo y carne. Jose es la unica fuente de ingresos en su hogar, aunque las pensiones en Bolivia no son restaurantes de lujo contribuyen considerablemente a la calidad de vida de los dueños, o sea, hay bastante clientela de bajos recursos que acude a estos lugares y termina satisfecha por lo que se recomienda ayudar a Jose
texts.en:
Jose is married and has a son. He lives with his family in El Alto in a house made of brick and cement that he owns. José runs a "pension" (in Bolivia this is what they call second and/or third class restaurants)

He needs a loan in order to buy groceries such as rice, noodles and meat. José is the only source of income for his household. Even though pensions in Bolivia are not luxury restaurants, they contribute considerably to their owners' quality of life; that is, there are quite a few low-income customers who come to these places and are well-satisfied. Therefore, it is recommended to help José.

loans.use: To buy groceries such as rice, noodles and meat for his restaurant.

loans.name: Mahliyo

texts.en:
Mahliyo was born in 1983. She is a hardworking woman from a rural area. She is married and has two children. She has always wanted to provide her children with a good living condition. 

Mahliyo manages family problems alone, as her husband is a migrant in Russia. Mahliyo needs to make money, so she is going to start her own business. She took part in a course, “To Get Ahead”, at a women’s organization. She got a certificate. 

She is going to organize a business with animal husbandry. Mahliyo will buy cattle, feed them for some months, and sell them in a local market. She is asking for a loan of 2,500 Somoni to buy cattle for organizing her new business. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy cattle for organizing her new business.

loans.name: José Álvaro

texts.es:
José Álvaro tiene 34 años de edad, es un pequeño productor de café del norte de Nicaragua. Su finca es de 70.42 hectáreas, de las cuales 21.12 hectáreas han sido destinadas para el rubro de café. En los últimos 3 años su producción de café ha sido de 250 a 500 quintales pergamino, y se encuentra  bajo la certificación de comercio justo (FLO).

Para este ciclo, este pequeño emprendedor está solicitando un crédito que le permita darle el mantenimiento adecuado a sus plantaciones, mediante la aplicación de insumos y fertilizantes requeridos para una buena cosecha, así como para hacer frente a las plagas y enfermedades que afectan este cultivo.

Para este pequeño emprendedor, la caficultura es su principal actividad económica. Está seguro que con su trabajo y la disponibilidad de recursos para invertir en su finca logrará mejores rendimientos en los próximos ciclos, y con ello mayores ingresos para su futuro.
texts.en:
José Álvaro is 34 years old and a small coffee producer from northern Nicaragua. His farm measures 70.42 hectares, of which 21.12 hectares is set aside for growing coffee. Within the past three years, his coffee production has resulted in an amount that is between 250 and 500 quintals (1 quintal = 100 kg) of coffee beans in parchment. José Álvaro is a certified Fair Trade grower.

For this crop cycle, this small entrepreneur is requesting a loan that will allow him to adequately maintain his plants. He plans to apply the required inputs and fertilizers that will result in a good harvest. This will also help him to deal with pests and diseases that could affect his crops.

For this small entrepreneur, coffee growing is his main business activity. He is confident in his work and having available resources to invest in his farm will result in better returns from upcoming crop cycles. As a result, he will have more income for the future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farming supplies that are required to achieve a good harvest.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.es:
Patricia en una joven y carismática empresaria de 26 años, que se dedica a la venta de mercancía como ropa, zapatos y accesorios, su negocio lo maneja ambulantemente, oficio que aprendió de su padre desde que era muy niña.
Alterna su trabajo de comerciante con el oficio de hogar y el que más le gusta, que es el papel de ser madre, pues tiene un hijo pequeño que es el centro de su vida y por el cual trabaja y lucha día a día.
Su mayor sueño es sentir la satisfacción de ver a su hijo realizado y con un buen futuro.
Hasta ahora son pocos los desafíos que ha tenido que enfrentar aparte del cansancio físico que le genera el caminar mucho para ofrecer sus productos.
Ahora necesita un crédito de $1.500.000 para surtir su negocio con más estilos de ropa y calzado, así podrá seguir ejerciendo su actividad, garantizando la educación y mejoramiento de la calidad de vida de su hijo.
texts.en:
Patricia is 26. She is a young and charismatic businesswoman who sells merchandise such as clothing, shoes and accessories. She operates her business as a street vendor, a trade she learned from her father when she was very young.

Patricia combines her work as a trader with her work at home and her preferred role which is that of being a mother. She has a little boy who is the centre of her life and for whom she works and struggles every day. Her greatest dream is to feel the satisfaction of seeing her son fulfilled and ​​with a good future.
 
So far she has had to face few challenges apart from the physical fatigue generated by a lot of walking to offer her products. 

Now she needs a loan of $800 (1,500,000 COP) to stock her business with more styles of clothing and footwear, so she can continue operating, ensuring her son's education and the improvement of his quality of life.

loans.use: to stock her business with more styles of clothing and footwear, so she can continue operating.

loans.name: Najah

texts.en:
Najah is a talented and passionate Iraqi artist and entrepreneur as well as a 38-year-old mother of four. Her journey with handicrafts started very early in life as a hobby, which she further developed by studying fine art at her local college. Though her early marriage—as is the case with many Iraqi women—altered the growth of her art career, it did not derail her passion for handicrafts. While caring for her family and during her only moments to herself, Najah honed her craft from home and sold her products to relatives and neighbors.

Two years ago, as her children were growing older and her family’s expenses were increasing, Najah decided to open a handicrafts workshop outside her home. Now, thanks to her passion for her craft and growing business, in addition to supporting her own family, she employs two other women, thereby enabling them to support their families.

Najah makes beautiful accessories and decor for weddings and social events, specializing in handmade ceramic flowers displayed on plates and in vases. Each life-like sculpture takes approximately six to eight hours to make, and Najah is constantly testing new flowers and innovating her technique. Najah further develops her skills by attending specialized courses and browsing the Internet for inspiration and trends in crafts and art.   

To expand her growing business, Najah is taking a SME loan in the amount of 10,000 USD. She will use this loan to move production and sales to a new location in a commercial area with a larger workshop and a showroom to market her one-of-a-kind pieces, an investment that will hopefully drive up sales and inventory. She also plans to hire more women to work with her, training them in her unique craft and economically empowering the women in her community. 

Based on the political and social challenges of lending in Iraq, personally identifiable information about this borrower has been altered for their protection. RI-Iraq appreciates Kiva lenders' consideration of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support for Iraqi borrowers.

loans.use: to move production and sales to a new location in a commercial area with a larger workshop and a showroom.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a 34-year-old married woman. She has three children with ages ranging from 4 years to 16 years. She describes herself to be focused. 

She operates a farm where she grows tea. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in an area ideal for farming. She describes her biggest business challenge to be unfavorable climate. 

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy fertilizer. Her business goal is to expand within five years. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Agua Buena Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “AGUA BUENA” de la Asociación Arariwa desde hace varios años atrás y les va muy bien. 

Matilde tiene 62 años y vive en la hermosa ciudad del Cusco, ella se dedica a la venta de verduras como por ejemplo zanahorias, cebollas, tomates y otras cosas mas, ella vende sus productos en el pequeño stand que tiene  en uno de los mercados populares de la ciudad del Cusco, ella es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora que saca adelante a su familia. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar verduras como por ejemplo papas, tomates, etc.     

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de imprenta, negocio de venta de artesanías, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de pasto.
 
La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members have belonged to the "Agua Buena" communal bank of Asociación Arariwa for some years, and it is going very well.

Matilde is 62 and lives in the beautiful city of Cusco. She sells vegetables such as carrots, onions, tomatoes and other things. She sells these products at a small stand she has in one of the popular markets in the city of Cusco. She is an enterprising and hard-working woman who is helping her family get ahead in life. 

On this occasion she needs the loan to buy vegetables, such as potatoes, tomatoes, etc. The other members make a living with various businesses: a printing business, a business selling crafts, a grocery store and a business selling animal feed. The member is grateful to those who form part of this dream through this site, and promises to make her installment payments in a timely manner.

loans.use: To buy vegetables such as potatoes, tomatoes, etc.

loans.name: Primas De Huayna Potosi Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “PRIMAS DE HUAYNA POTOSI” iniciará el tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Panamericana, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Irene es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: compra y venta de ganado, venta de colchones de paja, venta de canastas, venta de coca y alcohol, venta de ovejas, artesanas de canastas.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Irene es integrante, ella indica que es el tercer año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de un asesor de la institución que fue a visitarla a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de artesanías; da a conocer que este negocio fue un negocio lo aprendió de su madre, ya que en la actualidad tiene el mismo negocio, con poco capital inicio hace varios años y en la actualidad sigue trabajando en el mismo.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de lana por mayor) que adquirirá en las tiendas distribuidoras de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener a su familia ya que ella es casada y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación en salud que le ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Primas de Huayna Potosi” is starting its third loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Panamericana Community Center. This group consists of eight members and is led by a Board of Directors in which Sra. Irene serves as the president. The members of this Communal Bank engage in various businesses such as buying and selling livestock, selling straw mattresses, selling baskets, selling coca leaves and alcohol, selling sheep, and producing handmade baskets.

This loan will benefit small entrepreneurs such as Sra. Irene. She says that this is her third year since joining Pro Mujer after she received an invitation from an advisor with the organization who visited her at her house. Irene currently has a handicraft business. She is knowledgeable about this line of work because she learned the trade from her mother, who also has the same type of business. With a small amount of capital, Irene started her business several years ago and continues to manage it to this day.

The loan she is receiving now will be used to increase her capital for buying wool in bulk. She acquires her supplies from the distribution stores in the city of El Alto and then uses them to make the products that she sells from her retail space. Working in this manner allows her to generate income for sustaining her family. Irene is married and has four children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Irene said that she enjoys the health seminars that are offered by the organization.

loans.use: to buy wool in bulk.

loans.name: Estela

texts.es: Estela de 32  años de edad, reside en casa propia en zona urbana con su esposo y  sus dos  hijos. Ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de ricas pupusas. Día a día se levanta muy temprano para ir al mercado y tener frescos y listos los ingredientes que le permiten hacer sus deliciosas pupusas. Tiene mucha clientela ya que cuando de pupusas se trata ella tiene las mejores y con los precios más accesibles. Ha decidido hacer este crédito a INTEGRAL para invertir en su negocio ya que su sueño es verlo crecer de manera que pueda así mejorar su calidad de vida. Piensa invertir en la materia prima necesaria como: maíz, arroz, chicharon, queso, frijoles, tomates, repollo, etc. de esta manera espera lograr su sueño y poder dar a su familia una mejor oportunidad de vida.
texts.en:
Estela is 32 years old. She lives in her own house in an urban zone with her husband and two children. She makes a living through making and selling  rich, stuffed tortillas. Day to day, she rises early to go to the market and have ingredients fresh and ready that allow her to make her delicious, stuffed tortillas. Estela has many customers because when it comes to stuffed tortillas, she has the best and at the most accessible prices. 

Estela has decided to take this loan from INTEGRAL to invest in her business, seeing as her dream is to see it grow. In this way it can improve her quality of life. She is thinking in investing in necessary, raw materials such as: corn, rice, pork rind, cheese, beans, tomatoes, cabbage, etc. In this way she can hope to achieve her dream and be able to give her family a better chance at life.

loans.use: to buy corn, rice, pork rinds, cheese, beans, tomatoes, cabbage, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cassava in bulk and to pay the cost of transporting her product.

loans.name: Hiền

texts.en:
Mrs. Hiền works in agriculture, farming poultry and cattle. Hiền is 34 years old and she is married, with two children. She lives in Nong Cong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Hiền's first loan with the Fund for Than Hoa Poor Women. She has been involved in this business for more than ten years.
One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her, is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, and bricks to build a toilet and bathroom.

In the future, Hiền hopes to make enough money to provide for her children, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, and bricks to build a toilet and bathroom.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a responsible housewife who engages in raising hogs for sale. It is her way of helping her husband in generating income. She and her husband are aiming for a successful life, to give their children a better living. 

Mary plans to improve her hog-raising business, but she has insufficient capital. For this reason, she is asking for a loan of PHP 35,000 to buy hog feed, vitamins, and vaccines needed in hog-raising. She believes that her loan will help her to further improve her business.

loans.use: to buy hog feed, vitamins, and vaccines needed in hog-raising.

loans.name: Isidra

texts.en:
Isidra is forty-eight years old and married with eight children, five of whom are in school. Isidra works very hard to provide for them.

Isidra's business and family home were destroyed by Super Typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Isidra has restarted her business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

She has taken a PHP 10000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home.

She is using this loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Isidra is committed to rebuilding her devastated life and in the future would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Felisberta

texts.en: Felisberta is taking a loan of $600.00 to improve her business. She is married and she has three children. She runs a kiosk that helps her to generate income for her family. She will use the loan to buy stocks to keep in her store, such as fish, bread, noodles, slippers, coffee, sugar, salt, milk and salt. She opened her kiosk a year ago with her own working capital of $300.00. She is a hardworking woman and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy fish, bread, noodles, slippers, coffee, sugar, salt, milk and salt for her kiosk.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: Don Juan, tiene 56 años de edad, esta casado, tiene 5 hijos, y vive en una aldea que pertenece a Protección , Santa Bárbara. Siempre se ha dedicado a la agricultura, cultiva maíz, frijoles y café desde hace 14 años. estos granos los vende en el mercado local de la zona. Ha solicitado un préstamo por 10,000 Lempiras para comprar insumos y fertilizantes para asistir la finca de café y sacar buena producción. Su meta es tener mas cultivo de café para mejorar las condiciones con su familia.
texts.en:
Don Juan is 56 years old, married, and has five children. He lives in a neighborhood that is part of Protección, Santa Bárbara.

Juan has always been a farmer. He has been growing corn, beans, and coffee since the age of 14. His output is sold at the local market in the area. Juan is requesting a loan in the amount of 10,000 HNL so that he can buy supplies and fertilizers for maintaining his coffee farm and achieving good production. His goal is to have more coffee plants so that he can improve the conditions for his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and supplies for his coffee farm.

loans.name: Paulita

texts.en: Paulita earns a living from her farm. Besides planting and harvesting corn, she also has a coconut farm, growing and harvesting coconuts to sell.  Paulita successfully repaid her previous loan from Gata Daku MPC, which she used to pay her children's school tuition fees. Recently, she borrowed a loan to buy organic fertilizer for her coconut farm and buy additional gasoline for sale. She wants to see her children finish their studies in the future. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions for her family.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer for her coconut farm and buy additional gasoline for sale.

loans.name: Phán

texts.en:
Phán is 51 years old and single with three children. She lives and works in Nong Cong district, a  rural area in Thanh Hoa province, with one dependent.

Phán has a business farming poultry and cattle. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Phán faces in her life is not having a hygenic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, and bricks to build a toilet and bathroom.

This is Phán's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. In the future, she hopes for her business to do well, for her children to find a good job, and to make enough money to provide for her kids.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement ,and bricks to build toilet and bath-room.

loans.name: Cristy Lou

texts.en:
Cristy Lou has a retail store, serving several customers. She sells assorted groceries and beverages to generate additional income for the family. 

Cristy Lou has four years' experience in this field. She is working hard every day in order to provide income for the family, aside from her husband's income from carpentry works.

Cristy Lou requested this loan to buy additional grocery goods to sell. She is aiming to develop her business and increase her profits to have a better future for the family.

The story of Cristy Lou and her business is just one of the many examples of Gata Daku Multi-Purpose Cooperative's (GDMPC) support for economic development clients.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery goods to sell.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida is 53 years old and married with three children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell, such as shampoo, rice, groceries, etc.

Aida has been in this business for 32 years.

In the future Aida would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items like shampoo, rice, groceries, etc., to sell.

loans.name: Atyrbubu

texts.ru: Атырбубу обращается в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за повторным кредитом. Она является участником группы "Ийгилик-3", кроме нее в группе состоят еще 2 человека. Полученный ранее кредит позволил Атырбубу развить ее бизнес и получать прибыль в размере 10,000 сом (KGS) от занятия полеводством, на сегодняшний день у нее есть земельный надел размером 1,50 ГА, где она выращивает фасоль. На полученный кредит Атырбубу планирует приобрести минеральные удобрения, ГСМ и потратить часть средств на подготовку к весенне-полевым работам. Прибыль от кредита позволит Атырбубу купить большой дом для ее дружной семьи.
texts.en: Atyrbubu has turned to Bai Tushum Bank for a successive loan. She is a member of the Iigilik-3 group along with two other people. The loan she received previously allowed her to develop her business and receive profits of about 10,000 KGS from her farming, and she now has a 1.5 hectare piece of land on which she grows beans. Atyrbubu plans to use funds from this loan to cover the cost of mineral fertilizers, fuel and preparing the fields for spring planting. Profits will allow her to buy a bigger house for her loving family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline works hard to support her family. Evangeline is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to buy fish, ice, and plastic bags for her business.

Evangeline has been in this business for 10 years now.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fish, ice, and plastic bags for her business.

loans.name: Beverly

texts.en:
Beverly works hard to support her family. Beverly is married and has a fish-vending business in the Philippines.

Beverly requested a PHP 16,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) in order to buy more fish to sell.

Beverly has been in this business for 15 years now and also earns additional income from food-vending.

In the future, Beverly would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Nadgie

texts.en:
Nadgie is a married woman, with three children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Nadgie is 48 years old and has three children who are in school.

Nadgie has a hollow blocks-making business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase additional sacks of cement and sand for her business.

Nadgie has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of cement and sand for her business.

loans.name: Aidalyn

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Aidalyn works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from a general store. Aidalyn is borrowing PHP 50,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) in order to buy fishing gear and fingerlings for her fishing business.

Aidalyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money, so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and fingerlings.

loans.name: María Santana

texts.es:
María  de 50 años de edad, estudio bachillerato en salud,  está acompañada su compañero de vida al igual que ella es empleado tienen tres hijos, una de sus hijas está en EEUU. María trabaja como promotora de salud en la comunidad donde ella reside tiene 21 años de dedicarse a este empleo, esto lo aprendió a base de capacitaciones y fue elegida por miembros de su comunidad.

 El crédito lo invertirá en cancelar deudas con otras instituciones, sus sueños son seguir trabajando para que sus hijos tenga un futuro mejor, el dinero ella lo invertirá en vivienda, salud y educación de sus hijos
texts.en:
María is 50 years old and studied for a health diploma. She is in a relationship with her life companion, who is also employed, and they have three children. One of her daughters lives in the United States. María works as a health promoter in the community where she lives. She has been at this job for 21 years. María was chosen for this job by members of her community and learned how to perform her duties through training seminars.

Her loan will be invested in the repayment of debts with other institutions. Her dreams include continuing to work so that her children can have a better future. The income she earns will be invested in her home, as well as the health care and education costs for her children.

loans.use: to pay off debts with other institutions.

loans.name: Duglas Eliseo

texts.es:
Duglas de 20 años de edad,  es padre de un niño de un año de edad. Él y su esposa no saben leer  nunca fueron a la escuela. Se acompañaron y lo que más desean es darle el estudio a su hijo.
Duglas  trabaja de jornalero, ayudante de albañil,  la pareja es ama de casa, ellos viven  con los padres de él y los hermanos, él comenta que con el crédito lo apoyaría  la esposa con el destazo para tener mejor ingreso.
Duglas tiene experiencia desde que tiene 8 años,  el papá le enseño a sembrar frijol y maíz ya que es el cultivo del sustento diario y  de ayudante de albañil tiene 6 años de trabajar alrededor de la comunidad máximo a otros cantones del municipio.
El préstamo que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO,  es para comprar cerdos para la venta y para destazo y con este negocio pretende tener mejores ingresos y con esto lograría que la esposa tenga trabajo en la casa, atiende al niño a la vez atiende el negocio del destazo. 
El cliente comenta con mucha tristeza que no puede leer,  pero que trabajara muy fuerte para darle  estudio al niño y para el futuro desea comprar un terreno y hacer la casa para darle una vida digna a la esposa y al niño.
texts.en:
Duglas is 20 years old and a father to a one-year-old baby. Duglas and his wife never went to school and cannot read. What the couple most wants in life is to give their son an education.

Duglas works as a building site labourer; his wife is a housewife. The couple lives with Duglas' parents and siblings. Duglas tells us that this loan will support his wife with the slaughtering of the animals and to have a greater income.

Duglas has been working since he was eight years old. His father taught him to sow corn and beans for sustenance. Duglas has been a building site labourer for six years. He has been working around the community and in other municipalities.
