This loan from "Credi Campo" will be used to buy pigs to sell and for slaughter. With this business, Duglas intends to increase his income and provide his wife with work at home. She can then look after their son and the business at the same time.

Duglas tells us that it saddens him greatly that he cannot read but that he will work very hard to provide his son with an education. In the future, Duglas would like to buy land to build a house so that he can give his wife and son a decent life.

loans.use: to buy pigs to sell and for slaughter.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en: Teresita and her husband are both farmers who live in a rural community planting and harvesting vegetables for sale. She is 55 years old and has three adult-age children. To satisfy their daily necessities, she and her husband aim to improve their vegetable production business in order to increase their income. They plan to expand their vegetable plantation but they have limited capital. For this reason, she is asking for a loan of PHP 25,000 to buy fertilizers and herbicides needed in onion production. She is hoping that her loan will enable her to improve her farming business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and herbicides needed in onion production.

location.town: Brgy. Bone South, Aritao, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Leo

texts.en: Leo is married and has three children. He lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. To make a living, he produces coconut wine from his farm earning a good income for his family. It is better to sell his wine in town to gain more income for there he can sell it for more. In order to meet customer and buyer demand, he has had to buy additional coconut wine to sell. He borrowed a new loan from GDMPC to buy additional coconut wine to sell. In the future, Leo wants to buy a motorcycle to use for carrying his wine. Leo wants to improve the general living situation of his family in the near future.

loans.use: to buy additional coconut wine to sell.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita owns and operates a motorcycle transport service to make a living. With her generated income from this business, her previous loan, used for buying spare parts and accessories, was successfully repaid.

Teresita requested a loan recently to purchase new tires in order to improve the services and to make them safe. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase new tires.

loans.name: Rosenda

texts.en:
Rosenda  is  married and lives with her family. She has a retail business, while her husband does farming. She sells assorted kinds of grocery goods to generate additional income. She has done this for many years, earning well to support her husband's income and provide for the needs of her family. 

Rosenda requested this loan to buy more stocks of grocery goods to sell. She is aiming to develop her business and increase her profits, to continue providing for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of grocery goods to sell.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen works hard to support her family. Helen is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Helen requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to purchase rice, soft drinks, canned goods, chips, eggs, etc.

Helen has been in this business for 5 years now. She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she requests an additional loan to further build her business.

In the future, Helen would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase rice, soft drinks, canned goods, chips, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is thirty-three years old and married with two children, who are in school. Janet works very hard to provide for them.

Janet's business and family home were destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Janet has restarted her business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

She has taken a PHP 10,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home.

She is using the loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Janet is committed to rebuild her devastated life, and in the future, would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Julie

texts.en:
Julie is 51 years old and widowed with six children.

Julie works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Julie has borrowed and repaid 16 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for twelve years and also earns an income from selling seafood.

Julie aspires to save money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Jessa

texts.en:
Jessa is 20 years old with one child. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Jessa requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell.

Jessa has been in this business for 3 years. In the future, Jessa would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell.

loans.name: Jenevie

texts.en:
Jenevie is twenty years old and has one child.

She and her family survived super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013, but her business and family home were wiped out. 

Jenevie is taking out a housing loan amounting to PHP 6,500 to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family. 

Jenevie has been a NWTF borrower since 2013. She plans to recover through her fish vending.

With your help, Jenevie can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of super typhoon Haiyan. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is married and she works hard to support her family.

She sells personal products in the Philippines and also earns additional income from a general store and pig fattening. Regina is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF in order to purchase more items like body lotion, footwear and other personal products.

Regina has been sustaining her business activities through her past twelve loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more items like body lotion, footwear and other personal products.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 9,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients like coffee, sugar, bread, etc. for her food vending business.

Nenita has been in this business for 30 years. Nenita earns additional income from a general store.

Nenita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like coffee, sugar, bread, etc. for her food production business.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine works hard to support her family. On November 8, 2013, her business and home were wiped out by super typhoon Haiyan.

She has restarted her business and is now requesting a PHP 10,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor so she can build a house for her family.

With your help, Josephine will be able to rebuild her devastated life sooner.

In the future, she would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 38 years old and married, with five children, three of whom are in school. Josephine works very hard to provide for them.

Josephine's business and family home was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Josephine has restarted her business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Josephine has taken a PHP 10,000 housing loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase materials to rebuild her family's home.

She is using this loan to purchase building materials and to pay for construction labor.

Josephine is committed to rebuilding her devastated life and, in the future, would like to build and expand her business, to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and to pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Jovelyn

texts.en:
Jovelyn is 27 years old with three children, two of whom are in school.  She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Her house was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. She has restarted her business and is committed to regain what she lost. Jovelyn is taking out a PHP 10,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family.

Jovelyn has been with NWTF since 2013 in her efforts to rise out of poverty. With your help, she will be able to start once more in a new home. In the future, Jovelyn would like to save enough money to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Judita

texts.en:
Judita works hard to support her family. Unfortunately, on November 8, 2013, her business and home were wiped out by super typhoon Haiyan.

Juditha has restarted her business and is now requesting a PHP 7500 housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor so that she can build a house for her family. 

With your help, Judita will be able to rebuild her devastated life sooner. In the future, she would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Venus

texts.en:
Venus is married and he works hard to support his family.

Venus has a food production business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from a variety store. Venus is borrowing PHP 25,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) in order to buy more stocks of peanuts for his food production business.

Venus has been sustaining his business activities through his past seventeen loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. Venus hopes that his hard work will help him to attain his dream to save money to expand his business, in order to support the financial stability of his family.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of peanuts to sell.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is a female Ugandan, aged 36, a widow, and a resident of Kiyahura Kabwora. She has 5 children between the ages of 15 and 3, and four of them attend school; she takes the responsibility of paying tuition and providing their basic needs.
Her main business is the sale of old clothes in weekly village markets but she also does agriculture on a small scale to supplement the limited income.
She has approached Ugafode for a loan of 2,000,000 to buy clothes, with hopes of increasing her sales in the looming Easter season. Her dream is to improve her business and rent a shop in the town. She is an honest and hardworking person.

loans.use: To buy clothing for resale

loans.name: Ilser Del Carmen

texts.es: Entre libros y cuadernos se encuentra Doña Ilser, de 52 años de edad y madre soltera de un hijo. Es de oficio comerciante, se dedica al negocio de librería.  Inicio a la edad de 35 años con el dinero de la liquidación de su empleo. Solicita el préstamo para comprar Artículos Escolares, Lapiceros, Reglas y Cuadernos.  Dentro de un futuro no muy lejano tiene planeado incrementar el tamaño de su negocio e insertar nuevos productos en su librería.
texts.en: From books to notebooks, Ilser welcomes us with much enthusiasm. She is 52 years old, and a single mother of a son. She is a vendor who sells books. She started when she was 35, using money from the liquidation of her business. She is requesting a loan to buy school supplies, pens, rulers, and notebooks. In the near future, she plans to increase the size of her business and introduce new products to her bookstore.

loans.use: to buy school supplies, pens, rulers, and notebooks.

loans.name: Rocio

texts.es: Rocio era una muchacha de aproximadamente 18 años que desde que llego de su tierra natal llego con la meta de estudiar y ser alguien en la vida, una tarde llego a casa de un familiar y le dijo lo que quería estudiar para salir adelante y tener un futuro estable y consolidado, roció escogió como carrera Contabilidad Financiera porque este tiene un campo competitivo, escogió esta carrera como una opción de vida y de futuro,a si que ella quisiera tener el convenio de kiva porque lo que gana no le alcanza para pagar las necesidades que ella tiene y ella no quiere dejar de estudiar.
texts.en:
Rocio was a young girl, approximately 18 years old, when she arrived from her native country with the goal of studying and being somebody. One afternoon she arrived at a relative's home and she told them that she wanted to study to get ahead and to have a strong and stable future. Rocio chose accounting as a major, because it is a competitive field. She picked this major as an option for her future and for her life. 

Consequently, she wanted to have the agreement with Kiva, because the amount she earns is not enough to pay for the necessities she has and she does not want to stop studying.

loans.use: to pay for one semester of tuition.

loans.name: Shurentsetseg

texts.en:
Mrs. Shurentsetseg, 35 years old, lives with her husband and three children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Shurentsetseg has been running a grocery store since 2008, while her husband is a sentry at a private firm. Two months ago, she gave birth to a son.

Shurentsetseg is requesting a loan of 1700 USD to buy building materials such as bricks, cement, planks and fiberglass for her house renovation. After renovation, her family will live in a warmer and more spacious home where less coal will be burned, thereby reducing the pollutants released into the air.

loans.use: to renovate her house

loans.name: Maria Del Rosario

texts.es: Maria de 46 años de edad es madre soltera vive en casa propia con su hijos, ella se caracteriza por ser una mujer honesta, trabajadora y sobre todo muy emprendedora. Hace 15 años que logro establecer una pequeña tiendita en su hogar de residencia y gracias a Dios y a su arduo trabajo y dedicación el negocio es muy reconocido en la zona por lo que ya cuenta con mucha clientela. Para Maria es muy importante mantener activo este negocio ya que es su principal fuente de ingresos. Para ella lo más importante son los clientes ya que sabe que manteniéndolos satisfechos con el servicio que presta seguirán prefiriéndola y su negocio seguiría siempre activo tal como es su sueño. Es por esta razón que ha decidido solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL para invertir en la compra de mercadería para la tienda tales como: huevos, golosinas, azúcar, arroz, leche, frijoles, pan dulce y de más artículos que parezcan atractivos para los clientes. De esta manera espera lograr su sueño de seguir mantenido activo su negocio y por consecuencia seguir trabajando por un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Maria, 46, is a single mother who lives in her own home with her children. She describes herself as an honest, hardworking, and above all, a hard-working woman. Fifteen years ago she succeeded in setting up a small grocery store at her home and thanks to God and through her hard work and dedication the business has become well-known in the area hence she has a lot of customers. 

For Maria, it is very important to keep this business alive as this is her main source of income. What is the most important for her are her customers as she knows that by keeping them satisfied with the service that she is offering, they will continue to choose her and her store will continue to be in business just as she dreams. It is for this reason that Rosa has decided to seek this loan from Integral to invest in the purchase of merchandise for the store such as eggs, sweets, sugar, rice, milk, beans, sweet bread and other items which are of interest to the customers. In this manner, Maria hopes to make her dream a reality, that of keeping her business alive and as a result to continue working for a better family.

loans.use: to buy eggs, sweets, sugar, rice, milk, beans, sweet bread, and other items.

loans.name: Reyna Faustina

texts.es:
Reyna de 40 años de edad, casada, con  un hijo menor de edad, el cual esta estudia.  Es originaria de Leon, lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente del país. Se caracteriza por ser trabajadora, responsable, con ganas de superación personal. En sus ratos libre le gusta disfrutar de la compañía de su hijo. Lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos no puedo estudiar, pero le hubiera gustado estudiar enfermería. En la actualidad lucha día a día para brindarle un futuro mejor a su hijo. 

Gracias a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante tiene por actividad económica la venta de mercadería como: pantalones, camisas, faldas, short, pillamas, ropa de cama, ropa interior. Ella dedica a su negocio unas diez horas diarias ofreciendo su producto. De forma ambulante y en su casa de habitación. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de ropa para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. Reyna agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Reyna, who is 40 years old, is married and has a minor son who is in school. She is originally from León, a place that is located in the western zone of the country. She is known for being hard-working and responsible, with a will for personal achievement. In her free time, she likes to enjoy the company of her children. Unfortunately, due to the lack of economic resources, she was not able to go to school, but she would have liked to study nursing. Now she strives day by day to offer a better future to her son.

Thanks to her effort and her will to advance, she has a business of selling merchandise such as pants, shirts, skirts, shorts, pajamas, bed linens, and underwear. She works in her business some 10 hours a day, offering her products as a street vendor and from her home. The purpose of the loan is to invest in working capital and stock her business of buying and selling clothing so that in the not-too-distant future she can obtain better income. Reyna is grateful for the help that the Kiva investors offer to people of scarce resources and poor countries such as Nicaragua so that they can have a means of dignified work.

loans.use: to stock her business by buying clothing such as pants, shirts, skirts, shorts, pajamas, bed linens, and underwear.

loans.name: El Progreso Group

texts.es:
La asociación comunal  el progreso está conformada por ocho integrantes siete mujeres y un hombre, padres y madres responsables con quince hijos bajo su  responsabilidad. Son originarios del Sauce lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente del país. Se caracterizan por ser trabajadores, responsables, con ganas de superación personal. Lamentablemente por falta de recurso económicos no pudieron estudiar una carrera y se vieron obligados a trabajar desde temprana edad, para ayudar con los gastos del hogar. En la actualidad luchan día a día para brindarles un futuro mejor a sus hijos.
Gracias a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante la coordinadora es María  y tiene por actividad económica la venta de productos comestibles como: arroz, frijoles, azúcar, leche, pan, huevos, detergente, aceite, jugos, gaseosas. Ella dedica a su negocio unas doce horas diarias ofreciendo su producto. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de productos comestibles para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. El progreso agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
The communal bank El Progreso is made up of 8 members, 7 women and one man. All are responsible mothers and fathers who have a total of 15 children under their care. They are from Sauce, located in the western part of the country. It is known for its hard workers who are responsible and have aspirations for personal growth. Unfortunately, due to a lack of resources, none of them were able to go to school and they have had to work since they were young so they could help with household expenses. Currently, they are fighting every day to give their children a better life. 
Thanks to their efforts and wishing to get ahead, the coordinator Maria, sells groceries like rice, beans, sugar, milk, bread, eggs, detergent, oil, juices and sodas. She works for 12 hours a day. Her goal is to invest working capital into her business and stock her store and sell more product so that in the near future she will be able to make more money. El Progreso thanks the lenders at Kiva for their help of those who have limited resources and help poor countries like Nicaragua so that they can have dignified work.

loans.use: invest in working capital and stocking their business.

loans.name: Vilma Del Carmen

texts.es:
Vilma de 35  años de edad, madre soltera con dos hijos bajo su responsabilidad, es originario del Sauce, lugar que está ubicado en la zona norte de la región. Se caracteriza por ser trabajador, responsable, con ganas de superación personal. En sus ratos libre le gusta disfrutar de la compañía de sus hijos. Lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos no pudo cursar una carrera y se vio obligada a trabajar desde temprana edad, para ayudar con los gastos del hogar. En la actualidad luchan día a día para brindarles un futuro mejor a sus hijos. 

Gracias a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante tiene por actividad económica la venta de ropa nueva como: pantalones, shrores, faldas, vestidos, pillamas, ropa interior, juegos de sabanas, toallas. Ella dedica a su negocio unas diez horas diarias ofreciendo su producto. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de ropa, para que  en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos.  Vilma agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Vilma, who is 53 years old, is a single mother of two children under her care. She is from El Sauce, which is located in the northern area of the region. She is known for being hardworking, responsible, and driven to improve herself. When she has free time, she enjoys spending it with her children. Unfortunately, she wasn't able to get a higher education because she lacked the financial resources and had to start working at a young age to help with household expenses. Currently, she works hard every day in order to give her children a better future.

Her effort and drive enabled her to start her own business selling new clothing like pants, shorts, skirts, dresses, pajamas, underwear, sheets, and towels. She dedicates about ten hours a day to her business, offering her products to customers. The purpose of this loan is to invest in working capital and stock up on clothing for her business, so that she can earn higher income in a not-too-distant future. 

Vilma is grateful for the help Kiva lenders offer people with limited financial resources in poor countries like Nicaragua so they can earn a decent living.

loans.use: to stock up on clothing for her business.

loans.name: Ricardo Alberto

texts.es:
Ricardo Alberto es un cliente de Kubo Financiero y esta es su historia.
Ricardo tiene 44 años esta casado, pero no tiene hijo. El inicio su negocio que es un centro de copiado y papelería hace seis años, en el negocio sacan copias, hacen engargolados, recargas de celulares y también vende artículos de papelería. Esta solicitando el préstamo para comprar unas refacciones para arreglar su copiadora. Ricardo dice que su principal logro es haber formado un buen negocio que es estable, su reto ahora es hacerlo crecer. El se considera una persona trabajadora y responsables, le gusta cumplir con sus compromisos.
texts.en:
Ricardo Alberto is a client of Kubo Financiero, and this is his story.

Ricardo is 44 years old. He is married but has no children. He began his business, which is a copy center and stationery store, six months ago. At the business, they make copies, do spiral bindings, recharge cell phones, and also sell stationery items. He is applying for a loan to purchase some replacement parts to repair his copier. Ricardo says that his principal achievement is to have formed a good business that is stable. His challenge now is to make it grow. He considers himself a hard-working and responsible person, and he likes to keep his promises.

loans.use: to buy replacement parts to repair a photocopier

loans.name: Nelson José

texts.es:
Nelson es un productor de 30 años que vive junto a su esposa y su pequeña hija de 4 años en una comunidad de la zona norte de Nicaragua. En su pequeña finca siembra granos básicos para autoconsumo, y cuenta con 8.6 hectáreas de café, de las cuales obtuvo una producción de 230 quintales de café pergamino en el último ciclo.

Para este joven, los cambios climáticos en los últimos años han venido generando mayor afectación de plagas y enfermedades en el café, lo cual ha enfrentado con un buen manejo agronómico y la renovación de plantas. 

Con el fin de continuar garantizando el mantenimiento adecuado de sus plantaciones de café, Nelson está solicitando un crédito que le permita asegurar la compra e implementación de los insumos y labores culturales que demanda este cultivo, a fin de lograr mejores rendimientos y calidad en el ciclo productivo actual. 

El está seguro que su trabajo y deseo de superación le permitirá incrementar sus ingresos, y con ello mejorar su vivienda y darle una buena educación a su hija.
texts.en:
Nelson is a 30-year-old producer who lives with his wife and four-year-old daughter in a community in northern Nicaragua. On his small farm, he cultivates basic grains for personal consumption, but he also has 8.6 hectares set aside for growing coffee. During the last crop cycle, he was able to produce 230 quintals (1 quintal = 100 kg) of coffee beans in parchment.

For this young man, weather changes in recent years have brought about more incidents of coffee pests and diseases. He tackles these challenges with good farm management and by replacing his plants.

In order to guarantee adequate maintenance of his coffee crops, Nelson is requesting a loan that will secure the purchase of supplies and the payment of farm labor that is demanded of this crop. In the end, he expects to achieve an increase in output and quality from this current production cycle.

Nelson is confident in his work and wants to excel by increasing his earnings. This will allow him to improve his home and provide a good education for his daughter.

loans.use: to buy supplies and pay for the necessary labor in order to maintain his coffee crop.

loans.name: Ellery Concepcion

texts.es: Juventud, divino tesoro, ¡ya te vas para no volver! Cuando quiero llorar, no lloro. Y a veces lloro sin querer. Plural ha sido la celeste historia de mi corazón. Era una dulce niña, en este mundo de duelo y de aflicción; con estas majestuosas palabras la Señorita Ellery de 28 años de edad, residente de la Ciudad, Capital Managua, nos da la bienvenida y nos expone su meta próxima a realizar la cual será graduarse con honores de sus actuales estudios superiores, ella es una joven que se dedica a sus estudios de manera excepcional; solicitando un crédito para realizar su curso de titulación y salir adelante; estimando que el crédito a solicitud le será de mucha ayuda ya que podrá ver los frutos, esfuerzos que ha venido cosechando durante muchos años; obteniendo como planes a futuros seguir estudiando para obtener un post-grado, aplicando todos sus conocimientos aprendidos en un puesto de una determinada empresa y poder sacar adelante a su familia.
texts.en:
Youth, divine treasure, you leave never to return! When I want to cry, I don't cry. And sometimes I cry without wanting. The heavenly story of my heart has been diverse. I was a sweet girl, in this world of grief and sorrow. With these majestic words, Señorita Ellery López, 28 years old and resident of the capital city Managua, welcomes us and explains her next goal to us - to graduate with Honors from her current Higher Education studies. She is a young girl who works exceptionally at her studies.

She is asking for a loan to pay her graduation fees and move forward, appreciating that the loan will be a great help to her as she will be able to see the fruits of the effort she has been putting in for many years. Her plans for the future are to continue studying in order to obtain a postgraduate degree, then to apply all of her learned knowledge in a post in a particular company and in turn to be able to help her family.

loans.use: to be able to graduate and move forward.

loans.name: Leonida Lorna

texts.en: Leonida Lorna is 57 years old and married with five children. She works very hard to provide for her family. Leonida Lorna's business and home were destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines on November 8, 2013. Leonida Lorna has restarted her business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter. Leonida Lorna has taken out a PHP9,500 housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home. She is using this loan to purchase building materials and to pay for construction labor. Leonida Lorna is committed to rebuilding her life and in the future she would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and to pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Albertina

texts.pt:
Mãe viúva de 39 anos de idade, tem 3 filhos, vivendo com 2 e que ainda estudam, 1 vive com um familiar, e cuida de 1 sobrinho que esta sob sua responsabilidade, estudou ate 5ª classe, vive na casa própria a base de negócio que faz todos os dias em sua casa, esta a repetir o crédito pela 2ª vez.
Com o dinheiro pretende comprar: cerveja 2M, cerveja preta, cerveja impala, refrescos e vinhos para ampliar o seu negocio.
Seu maior sonho é progredir no seu negocio, continuar a garantir escola para seus filhos ate que eles consigam emprego sustentável.
Tem como desafio, o facto do seu negocio não sair sempre bem, principalmente nesta época de chuvas, mas mesmo assim tem lutado para superar
texts.en:
Albertina is a 39-year-old widowed mother of three children. Two of her children live with her and are still in school and one of them lives with a family member. She looks after a nephew who's under her care. She completed 5th grade and lives in a house that she owns. Her means of livelihood is her business which she runs from home on a daily basis. This is her second loan.
With the money she intends to purchase various kinds and brands of beer, refreshments and wine in order to expand her business.
Her biggest dream is to make progress in her business and continue to provide schooling for her children until they can get viable jobs.
Her challenge is the fact that her business doesn't always do very well, especially during this rainy season, but she still strives to overcome that.

loans.use: to purchase various kinds and brands of beer, refreshments and wine in order to expand her business.

loans.name: Bordados Express Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “BORDADOS EXPRESS” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Villa Exaltación, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Janneth es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de maní y pasancalla, venta de mochilas, venta de muebles, bordados artesanales, venta de frazadas.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Janneth es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una vecina que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de dulces; da a conocer que este negocio lo inicio al apoyar a su madre quien realizaba la venta del mismo producto, pasados los años decide emprenderlo independientemente.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de dulces por mayor) que adquirirá en las tiendas de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener a su familia ya que ella es soltera y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación que le ofrecen en la institución.
texts.en:
The communal association "BORDADOS EXPRESS" will start its first cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Centro Focal de Villa Exaltación [Focal Center of Villa Exaltación]. It is comprised of eight members and is directed by an executive board of which Janneth is the President. The members' businesses are varied and included among them are: sale of peanuts and sweet popcorn, sale of backpacks, sale of furniture, artisanal embroidery, sale of blankets.

The loan will help the group of micro-entrepreneurs, of which Janneth is a member. Janneth says that it is her first time working with Pro Mujer, and she entered by invitation of a neighbor who is a member of the institution. Currently she has a business selling sweets; it is worth noting that she started her business with the support of her mother who made a living selling the same product. With the passage of years, Janneth decided to start out independently.

The loan will be used to increase her capital (purchase of sweets at wholesale) which she acquires in the stores of the city El Alto and later commercializes in her sales space. This form of work permits her to generate resources to maintain her family since she is single with two children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the training offered by the institution.

loans.use: to buy sweets at wholesale

loans.name: Inacio

texts.pt:
O Sr Inácio de 52 anos de idade, casado, junto com sua esposa na foto é pai de 7 filhos dos quais 3 são independentes vivendo nas casas próprias, 4 estão a frequentar a escola no ensino primário e secundário e sustenta seu irmão e dois sobrinhos. Ele é pensionista militar na reserva e  também prática agricultura da sequeira para sustentar a sua familia.
Com o presente empréstimo será aplicado para comprar material de construção (porta, janela, varões,cimento e pagamento de mao-de-obra) para reabilitar a sua casa que se encontra no estado avancado da degradação. seu maior desafio é melhorar as condições habitacionais.
texts.en:
Inácio is 52 years old and married. He has seven children, three of whom are independent and live in their own homes and four attend primary and secondary school. He supports his brother and two nephews. He's a retired military pensioner and also does farm work in order to support his family.
The current loan will be used to purchase construction supplies (a door, a window, rods and cement) and to pay for labor so that he can repair his house which is in an advanced state of decay. His biggest challenge is improving his living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase construction supplies (a door, a window, rods and cement) and to pay for labor so that he can repair his house.

loans.name: Juan

texts.en:
Juan has been interested in cars since he was a boy and sought to work with them throughout most of his life. While working in the car industry, he noticed that dealers often sell cars with previously attached accents. This inhibited dealers from holding larger supplies of desirable accessories. Thus, Luxury Trims was born.
 
Founded in 2010, Luxury Trims removes dealers from the equation and allows Juan to sell chrome and other aesthetic accessories. Juan has met with rapid success and even secured an exclusive deal with a Thailand manufacturing company for sole rights on certain products. With a high demand and large customer base, Juan has suffered a slow January this year. Due to heavy snowstorms, he was unable to meet with most of his clients and now needs a loan to help get his business back on track. 

Help Juan purchase inventory and expand his business!

loans.use: to purchase inventory.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy groceries and snack foods to add to her business.

loans.name: Cindy Beatriz

texts.es: Cindy tiene 24 años de edad  y reside junto a su hija de 6 años de edad  en casa propia. Ella es una mujer trabajadora quien trabaja muy duro para sacar adelante a su hija. Debido a las dificultades económicas el esposo de Cindy se vio obligado a emigrar al extranjero en busca de mejores condiciones de vida y hasta el momento Cindy es la que responde por el cuido de su hogar. Cindy habita en condiciones muy humildes y desea ir mejorando su citación poco a poco por lo que ha tomado la decisión de construir una pila con baño ya que no cuenta con un lugar adecuado para reguardar el agua. Por lo anterior solicita este crédito a FUSAI para comprar los materiales necesarios como: cemento, arena, ladrillo, etc.
texts.en: Cindy is 24 years old. She lives with her 6-year-old daughter in her own house. She is a hard-working woman who works very hard to raise her daughter. Due to economic difficulties, Maria's husband was forced to emigrate overseas in search of better living conditions, and up to now Maria is the one who accounts for the care of her home. Cindy lives in very humble conditions, and she wants to go on improving her home little by little. For this reason, she has made the decision to construct a washroom with a bathroom, since she doesn't have a suitable place to store water.To do this, she is applying to FUSAI for this loan to purchase the necessary materials, such as cement, sand, bricks, etc.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, and bricks to build a washroom with a bathroom

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia  works hard to support her family. On November 8, 2013, her business and home were wiped out by super typhoon Haiyan.

She has restarted her business and is now requesting a PHP 10,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor so she could build a house for her family.

With your help, she will be able to rebuild her devastated life sooner.

In the future, Letecia would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Angeline

texts.en:
As the widowed mother of four children, Angeline works hard to support her family.

She has a rice milling business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming rice.  Angeline is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF in order to buy new equipment for her rice milling.

Angeline has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream of saving enough money to be able to continue sending her children to college.

loans.use: to buy new equipment for milling rice.

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
Lilibeth is forty three years old and married with nine children. She works very hard to provide for them. Lilibeth's business and family home was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Lilibeth has restarted her business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

She has requested a housing loan of 10,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home. She is using the this loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor costs. Lilibeth is committed to rebuild her devastated life and in future would like to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay construction labor costs

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia is fifty nine years old, married, and has seven children.  

Letecia and her family survived super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013, but her business and family home were destroyed. 

She is taking out a housing loan amounting to Php 10,000 purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family. 

Letecia has been an NWTF borrower since 2012. She plans to recover economically by selling fish.

With your help, Letecia can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of super typhoon Haiyan. In the future, she would like to save enough money to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Davis

texts.en:
Meet Davis, a husband and father of two school-going children. He is also a mixed farmer based in the rich highlands of Litein area of South Rift Kenya. He has been farming for the past ten years to make ends meet. His primary source of income is derived from selling milk, eggs and horticultural produce. Like most horticulture farmers in the region, Davis experiences challenges dealing with crop diseases and expensive inputs

Davis is seeking your financial assistance to improve the state of his horticulture farm. He seeks to buy more chemicals to control diseases that endanger his harvest. Through this loan, he will be able to improve his horticulture farm and get more income out of it. This will enable him to improve his economic activity by mitigating crop failure risks and making enough income by the end of the season to take care of his family and reinvest in farming.

loans.use: to improve his horticulture farm.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert, a husband and father to five children, is a mixed farmer based in Eldoret, Kenya. He has been farming for 6 years now. His primary income sources comes from selling milk, eggs,and different crop varieties: He is very passionate about horticultural farming. However, with horticulture, there is a great challenge of controlling crop diseases.

With your financial aid, Robert seeks to improve his horticultural practices by buying modern tools and chemicals to control the ever emerging crop diseases. He is certain that by putting this loan to use, his income will increase and thus improve his family's living standards.

loans.use: For improving his horticultural farm.

loans.name: Karine

texts.en:
Karine is 58 years old and lives in the city of Dilijan. She is not married and she lives alone. She had a vocational education, and then for many years she worked for the Military Police, and now she works at the Military Commissariat as a secretary. 

She says that the type of work that she has done over these past years, and the people with whom she has works till now (being mostly men)changed her character, but she is doing her best to keep her femininity. She is very busy and works nearly without holidays, and always being fully engaged in her work, she did not have an opportunity and enough time to have a family and children. Anyway, as Karine says,she has got used to her way of living.

Now she is asking for a loan of 400,000 Armenian drams (AMD) since she wants to do some cosmetic repairs on her house. She hopes for Kiva support and gives you her thanks in advance.

loans.use: to do some cosmetic repairs on her house

loans.name: Justus

texts.en:
Meet Justus. He is a father of five lovely children. Like most farmers from Kitale, he is very committed to a mixed mode of farming, which he has been doing for the last 13 years. 

Madoamadoa, his dairy cow, gives him milk for family consumption and he sells the surplus along with eggs from his poultry farm. He also makes money by seizing small opportunities that come now and again, by venturing into small businesses. Milking Madoamadoa- a word only the most romantic Swahili speakers would use when referring to their lovers - forms Justus' primary hobby. 

Justus doesn't find selling milk as enjoyable, since the milk prices in the region are always low. He seeks to diversify and venture into poultry which has proven a success to many in the region. With your loan, Justus seeks to buy poultry which will provide his family with food and additional income. With the additional income, justus has committed to provide a solid foundation for his children through better education.

loans.use: to purchase poultry.

loans.name: Bon Berger Group

texts.fr: La Cliente Godelive est une commerçante  d’une expérience de 15 ans, âgée de 46 ans, mariée et mère de 11 enfants dont 4 étudient et les autres sont déjà grands. La cliente est membre d’un collectif d’Affaires « Bon berger». Elle est vendeuse de friperie. Elle installe ses marchandises sur la rue  dans une avenue animée de la ville. Elle sollicite un prêt auprès de Hekima pour accroitre son activité. Elle va acheter 1 ballon de friperie.  Elle démarra ses affaires avec le fonds  reçu de son mari. Son conjoint est un chauffeur de poids lourds. Dans l’avenir, elle souhaite accroitre son crédit, acheter une parcelle, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Elle remercie Hekima pour son soutien aux femmes entrepreneurs non bancables, en leur accordant de microcrédit, pendant, ce moment de posts conflits dans la région de l’Est du pays. Il sied de signaler que certaines clientes portenet leur bébés.
texts.en:
Bahati is a merchant with 15 years of experience. She is 46 years old and married with 11 children, 4 of whom still go to school while the others are now all grown up. 

Bahati is a member of the business group Bon Berger. She is a reseller of second-hand clothing. She conducts her sales on a busy street where she sets up a stall. She initially launched her business with funding from her husband, a truck driver.

Bahati is seeking a loan from Hekima to bolster her activity. She plans to buy 1 bale of used clothing. 

Bahati’s hopes for the future are to strengthen her credit, buy some land, and provide for her children with respect to food and tuition. 

Bahati wishes to thank Hekima for offering micro-financing to businesswomen who cannot use the traditional banking system, especially in these post-war times in the Eastern region. 

It should be noted that some group members are carrying their child.

loans.use: to buy one bale of second-hand clothing for resale.

loans.name: Unidos Somos Mas Group

texts.es:
Katty, es una mujer casada y tiene un hijo de 4 años, ella vive en un  barrio vulnerable de Esmeraldas, y su negocio de golosinas lo tiene en el centro de la ciudad, donde alquila un puesto para vender más sus productos.
Ella inicio su negocio, desde hace 4 años, con un pequeño capital que le prestó una amiga, con el paso del tiempo se dio cuenta que sus productos si tenían salida en el mercado y consiguió de oportunidad un pequeño local de alquiler, donde se encuentra administrando su negocio hasta la actualidad.
Su hijo ya empezara a ir al centro de educación inicial, su esposo es jornalero no tiene un empleo estable y apoya mucho al negocio de su esposa.
Katty espera tener un local propio y amplio más surtido y poder ofrecer novedosos productos para fiestas infantiles. ella quiere que su hijo sea mecánico industrial y desde ya ahorrará para apoyarlo en sus estudios.

INFORMACION ADICIONAL
Katty, forma parte del grupo "UNIDOS SOMOS MAS" son  7 integrantes. quienes se conocen desde hace mas de 8 años y siempre han participado de varias actividades comunitarias. Cada integrante recibirá $500,00 y tienen diferentes negocios como ventas de ropa, tienda de alimentos, y venta de calzados.

NOTA: la persona que levanta la mano en la fotografía es la líder del grupo.
texts.en:
Katty is married and the mother of a four-year-old son. She and her family live in a rough section of the city of Esmereldas, but Katty has a business in the city center, where she rents a stand to sell candy and snacks. Katty's husband is a day laborer who helps her a great deal with the business and their son has begun attending preschool. 

Katty started her business for years ago with a small amount of capital that a friend lent her. Over time, she found that there was a market for her products and took advantage of the opportunity to rent a small stand where she still runs the business today. 

Katty hopes to find a larger location and to be able to provide new products for children's parties. She would like for her son to become an industrial mechanic and has already begun to save for his education. 

ADDITIONAL INFORMATION:

Katty is a member of the "UNIDOS SOMOS MAS" ["TOGETHER WE'RE GREATER"] group, which consists of seven members. The group members have known each other for eight years and have participated in a variety of activities in the community. Each member will receive $500.00 for their businesses, which include clothing and shoe sales and a grocery store.   

NOTE: the person raising her hand in the photo is the group leader.

loans.use: to purchase candy and open her own candy store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more gari in bulk to sell to her clients.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.es:
Marcelina, es una Sra., de 63 años de edad, es casado, tiene tres hijos los cuales ya son independientes, vive con su esposo, desde niña aprendió dentro de su familia todo lo relacionado con la crianza de ganado, ha sido la manera que tiene para obtener los recursos económicos con los cuales ha salido adelante junto a su familia. Trabaja todos los días junto a su esposo.
Para Marcelina el financiamiento será de mucha utilidad porque podrá comprar ganado para repasto, con la el aumento de ganado a futuro la producción de lácteos será mucho mayor tanto para el consumo familiar como para comercializarlo. 
Su visión es seguir trabajando para cancelar sus deudas y cubrir los gastos familiares.
texts.en:
Marcelino is a 63 year old man. He is married and has three children who are now independent. He lives with his wife and learned everything related to cattle-raising at home as a boy. This is how he has been able to generate the economic resources with which he has pulled through with his family. He works every day with his wife.

This loan would be of great use to Marcelino as he will be able to buy cattle for breeding. With the increase in cattle, dairy production will be much larger in the future, both for his family consumption and for sale. 

His vision is to continue working to pay his debt and to cover the household expenses.

loans.use: to buy cattle for breeding

loans.name: Turambane Group

texts.fr:
Créscence  fait partie du groupe Turambane  et habite à Gitega. Elle a 35 ans et est mariée à Zacharie, un commerçant. Ensemble ils ont 5 enfants âgés de  3  à 12 ans.

Elle  fait le commerce de bananes depuis 10 ans.

Elle est à son  quatrième crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit Kiva qu’elle obtient, elle va augmenter son capital et acheter  une grande quantité de bananes à  revendre, pour gagner plus.
texts.en:
Créscence belongs to the Turambane group and lives in Gitega. She is 35 years old and married to Zacharie, who is a trader. They have five children together, whose ages range from three to 12 years old.

She has been selling bananas for the past ten years and is on her fourth loan from Turame. With the Kiva loan she is granted she is going to increase her capital and buy a large quantity of bananas to resell so she can make more money.

loans.use: to increase her capital by buying a large quantity of bananas for reselling so she can make more money.

loans.name: Merla Catalina

texts.es:
Merla, una mujer de 45 años,con ojos oscuros y una mirada agradable, nos da la bienvenida a un mundo colorido y variado, un espacio donde predomina la comercialización de la canasta básica del hogar; su pulpería.
Las contadas arrugas en la cara de Merla, marcadas por las expresiones de amabilidad durante los cuatro años trabajando, demuestran la constante lucha por salir adelante, ya que antes de ser comerciante en su propia casa, vendía frutas en el mercado de la ciudad, donde sintió al final un mayor desgaste físico que le obstaculizaba seguir en ese puesto. No obstante, gracias al amor por el trabajo, encontró una nueva alternativa para seguir activa y decidió iniciar con la pulpería en su casa. 
Donde la gran demanda de clientela, más la búsqueda por mejoría de su salud, ahora solicita el préstamo para construir un inodoro y ofrecerles los mejores servicios a sus usuarios y a su familia.
texts.en:
Merla, a woman of 45, dark, with dark eyes and a pleasant look, welcomes us to a colorful and varied world, a space dominated by the sale of products for the basic family grocery basket, her grocery store.

The few wrinkles on Merla's face, made by expressions of friendliness during four years of work, show the constant struggle to advance, since before becoming a businesswoman in her own house, she sold fruit in the city market, where in the end she felt a great physical weariness that prevented her from continuing in this work. Nevertheless, thanks to her love of her work, she found a new alternative for continuing to be active, and she decided to set up a grocery store in her house. Here, due to the great demand of her customers, in addition to seeking to improve her health, she is now applying for the loan to construct a toilet and offer the best services to her customers and to her family.

loans.use: to construct a toilet and offer the best services to her customers and to her family.

loans.name: Delmy Yasmin

texts.es:
Delmi de 36 años de edad,  está acompañada, es madre de tres hijos dos viven con ella y el otro viven con la abuela; el esposo trabaja como jornal con los vecinos, cultiva maíz, frijol y hortalizas.

Actualmente ella se dedica a la venta de las hortalizas que cultiva su esposo,  anteriormente trabajaba en un comedor en el pueblo cercano, ella  vende la hortalizas en los alrededores de donde ella vive.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO, es para comprar tres puertas y una ventana, para su vivienda. ella piensa seguir trabajando con créditos pues piensa construir un espacio para la cocina. Sus sueños son que sus hijos estudien y sean profesionales, el dinero de las ganancias los invertirá en la alimentación de su familia.
texts.en:
Delmi is 36 years old, is married, and is the mother of three children, two of whom live with her.  The other son lives with his grandmother.  Her husband works as a laborer with their neighbors.  He grows corn, beans and vegetables.  Currently, she works selling the vegetables that her husband grows.  Previously, she worked in a restaurant in a nearby town.  She sells the vegetables in places near where she lives.

The loan that she is requesting from CREDICAMPO will be used to purchase three doors and a window.  She plans on continuing to work with the loans as she is thinking of building an area for a kitchen.  Her dreams are for her children to attend school and become professionals.  She will use her earnings to feed her family.

loans.use: para comprar tres puertas y una ventana, para su vivienda.

loans.name: Nueva Esperanza Group

texts.es:
YANETT, mujer de 31 años que vive en Borbon en un barrio muy vulnerable, ha visto que la activida de cria y venta de pollos es muy rentable en este sector de la provincia de Esmeraldas.
ella tiene 3 hijas y desde hace mas de un año es clienta de FODEMI, ella inicio esta actividad, con el proposito de tener la comida diaria en su casa; pero se dio cuenta que podia obtener multiples ganancias si se dedicaba a esta tarea, fue asi que empezo a liderar un grupo de vecinos y se convirtio en cliente de FODEMI, ha pagado bien sus cuotas y esta creciendo considerablemente en su negocio.
meciona que con el producto de su trabajo ha podido apoyar a sus hijas en sus estudios, mantener su hogar y su negocio.
ella programa reuniones en su barrio para planificar actividades en beneficio de su comunidad.
su producto, lo comercializa en borbon, en las tiendas, comedores y azaderos.
por el momento ha contratado a un chico para que le ayude con el cuidado de los pollos y le apoya con el estudio en el colegio.
ella espera crecer mucho en su negocio, para dar trabajo a mas jovenes que no tienen la posibilidad de encontrar un trabajo en esta localidad. 

INFORMACION ADICIONAL

En el grupo hay 9 personas, 4 de ellas son mujeresy 5 hombres, realizan actividades variadas y todos viven en borbon, hay negocios que se realizan fuera del pueblo.
texts.en:
Yanett, a woman of 31 who lives in a very vulnerable neighborhood of Borbon, has seen that the business of raising and selling chickens is very profitable in this sector of the province of Esmeraldas. She has three daughters, and for more than a year she has been a client of FODEMI. She began this business with the purpose of having daily food in her house, but she noticed that she was able to obtain multiple earnings if she worked at this task. It was thus that she began to lead a group of neighbors and became a client of FODEMI. She has paid her bills well and she is growing considerably in her business.

She mentions that with the product of her work, she has been able to support her daughters in their studies and maintain her home and her business.

She organizes meetings in her neighborhood to plan activities for the benefit of her community.

She sells her products in Borbon, in the shops, dining establishments, and grills.

For the moment, she has hired a boy to help her care for the chicks, and she helps him with his schooling. She hopes to grow a lot in her business so that she can give work to more young people who don't have the possibility of finding work in this location.

Additional information: In the group there are 9 people; 4 of them are women, and 5 men. They have various businesses, and all live in Borbon. There are businesses that they work in outside of the town.

loans.use: to buy 100 chickens, balanced feed, vitamins, watering troughs and feeders.

loans.name: Clarisa

texts.en:
Clarisa is a 23-year-old single lady. She resides in Mwenezi District, Zimbabwe. Clarisa has been working as a Camfed Learner Guide, teaching life skills education in local schools to improve the well-being of students by enhancing their learning environment. In addition, Clarisa rents a table at the local flea market where she sells products such as bags, shoes, jeans, shirts, skirts, track suits, and t-shirts. She has been running this business for one year and three months now and it has enabled her to support her family.  

With the Kiva loan, Clarisa will purchase more bags, shoes, jeans, shirts, skirts, track suits, and t-shirts to increase her supplies. Her hope is to grow the business and open her own store. This will bring stability to her business and will enable her to provide for her family’s basic needs. Her desire is also to create sustainable employment in her community.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes for her stock

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es: Miguel tiene 60 años, es un trabajador pensionado de la Universidad Nacional Autonoma de México (UNAM), desde hace 10 años se dedica a manejar un taxi. El esta casado y tiene 4 hijos, pero ya todos son independientes. esta solicitando el préstamo para hacer algunas mejoras en su vivienda como pintura, impermeabilización y reparar algunas fisuras. Miguel dice que le gusta ser cumplido y responsable. Sus principales logros es haber sacado adelante a sus hijos, les dio educación y un buen lugar para vivir, sus retos son seguir trabajando y seguir estando ben con su familia.
texts.en:
Miguel is 60 years old. He is married and has four children, but they have already moved out.  He is a pensioned worker from UNAM (the Autonomous National University of Mexico).  For ten years he has worked driving a taxi.   

He is asking for a loan to make some repairs on his home, such as painting, waterproofing, and fixing some cracks.  Miguel says that he likes to be polite and responsible.  His main achievements have been getting his children ahead, giving them an education and a good place to live.  His challenges are to keep working and keep doing well for his family.

loans.use: to make improvements (such as painting, waterproofing, and fixing cracks) to his home

loans.name: Feagai

texts.en: Feagai is 40 years old and married with 6 children. She designs printed lavalava selling them to earn a living and has been doing this for 3 years. Feagai has requested a loan to buy more tools for her business such as  rubber designs, sand paper, brushes, fabric, fabric paint, iron roofing, cement, cooking oven. She plans to use her profits to help with her family daily needs and reinvest some back to her business. She joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy rubber designs, sand paper, fabric, fabric paint, iron roofing, cement, cooking oven

loans.name: Miriama

texts.en:
Miriama is a 31-year-old married woman with 3 children. 

She runs a small business selling Chinese biscuits in her community and has been doing this for 2 years. 

Miriama has requested a loan to purchase more ingredients for her biscuits such as bags of flour, sugar, cooking oil, onions, soya, and a carpet for her home improvement. She joined SPBD in 2010 to gain access to capital. 

With her earnings, Miriama will provide for her family's daily needs.

loans.use: to buy bags of flour, sugar, cooking oil, onions, soya, and a carpet for her home.

loans.name: Leonardo

texts.en:
Leonardo is 64 years old and lives in Gata, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. He is widowed with four children, now at their adult age.

Leonardo is engaged in farming, particularly rice production activity, for 20 years already, and earns approximately PHP 12,000 each cropping from doing this type of work. At the present, he is also receiving a monthly pension from the services he rendered before as a government employee. 

He has requested a loan to be used in purchasing medicines for his daily maintenance. Leonardo has been a member of PMPC for almost two years. In the future, Leonardo hopes to save more in our cooperative for future needs.

loans.use: to be used in purchasing medicines for his daily maintenance.

loans.name: Jose Indalecio

texts.es: Jose de 36 años de edad vive junto a su compañero de vida y sus tres hijos; el se dedica a la agricultura específicamente al cultivo de maíz, tiene muchos años de trabajar en este rubro y se ha hecho de experiencia muy valiosa que le permite obtener las mejores cosechas , el terreno de cultivo está ubicado en una zona de incidencia agrícola, el comercia en todas las zonas aledañas y ya tiene mucha clientela fija, estas personas siempre prefieren su producto pues es de calidad y a precios realmente accesibles además el servicio es inigualable, Jose es un hombre dedicado a su labor, luchador siempre dispuesto a trabajar duro para alcanzar el éxito, quiere aprovechar el auge de su negocio para aumentar la producción y así poder tener mejores ganancias, necesita invertir en insumos pero necesita de capital por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar semillas, abono, insecticida, herramienta, etc. el tiene buenas referencias de pago y está seguro que podrá saldar su deuda a tiempo, y a la vez tiene la confianza que podrá darle a su familia la vida que se merecen.
texts.en:
Jose is 36 years old and lives with his life's companion and their 3 children. He is a farmer, specifically cultivating corn. He has worked in this specialty for many years and has very valuable experience that allows him to produce the best harvests. The land he farms is located in an agricultural zone. Jose sells his harvests in the surrounding areas and he already has a large fixed clientele that always prefers his produce for its quality and Jose's really accessible prices plus his unmatched service.

Jose is dedicated to his labors, a determined farmer who is always disposed to work hard to achieve success. He wants to take advantage of the recent surge in his business to augment production and, thus, to be able to enjoy better earnings. Jose needs to invest in inputs but he needs capital.  For this, Jose is turning to INTEGRAL for a loan  that will permit him to buy seeds, fertilizer, insecticides, farm tools, etc. Jose has good payment references and he is certain that he will be able to pay off his debt on time, and at the same time, he is confident that he will be able to offer his family the life they deserve.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer, insecticides, farm tools, etc.

loans.name: Cristo Salvador Group

texts.es: Estefany   de 19 años de edad soltera  y sin hijos,estefany tiene un  pequeño negocio de venta de productos de belleza  ya hace unos  2  años. En un local  (alquilado) estefany  ha llegado a fidelizar  a sus clientes   el cual le ha generado ganancias para poder cubrir los gastos de su hogar,  En el futuro le gustaría tener un local propio donde poder vender sus productos y obtener mayores ganancias económicas. Con el préstamo otorgado lo invertirá en comprar más productos de belleza como (lápiz labial, perfumes, colonias, cosméticos etc.) y  así seguir satisfaciendo las necesidades de sus clientes   y así poder salir adelante. A la vez  estefany  y todos los integrantes se encuentran  agradecidos   con Kiva  por el préstamo otorgado   y por la confianza que se  les ha sido brindada. Estefany  se le distingue por su cartera  de color (canela oscuro), las dos socias que no asistieron al desembolso son: la señora Juana que  se le distingue cargando a su bebe, no puedo estar en el desembolso por motivo de trabajo, y la señorita katya que se encuentra  a su costado no puedo tampoco estar en el desembolso por motivo de estudio(a las dos socias se le tomo la foto en un mercado), Se despide  Dejando la promesa  que cumplirá todas sus metas propuestas.
texts.en:
Estefany is 19 years old, single and does not have children.  Estefany has had a small business selling beauty products for about two years.  In a rented retail space, Estefany has been able to gain a loyal customer base that has generated earnings for her to cover her household expenses.  In the future, she would like to have her own retail space where she can sell her products and generate greater earnings.

With the loan she has been granted, she will purchase more beauty products such as lipstick, perfumes, colognes, cosmetics, etc.  Through this, she will be able to continue to satisfy her customers' needs and she will be able to get ahead.  

Estefany and all of the members are very thankful to Kiva for the loan that they have been granted and the confidence that they have been given.  Estefany is in the picture with a dark tan purse.  The two members who did not attend the meeting are: Juana, who is holding her baby and could not attend because of work, and Katya, who is next to her and could not attend because of school (the two members were photographed in a market).  She would like to sign off by promising to achieve all of her proposed goals.

loans.use: beauty products.

loans.name: Mialina

texts.en:
Mialina is 61 years old and lives in Mialen Clarin, Mis Occ. She is married and has six adult children.

Mialina has a carinderia (restaurant) business, which she has had for six years. She has requested a loan to pay for nursing board licensure examination of her daughter. Mialina has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Mialina hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to pay for nursing board licensure examination of her daughter

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena owns and operates a transportation service with the help of her husband. Rowena has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns well to provide for her family. With her generated income, she successfully repaid her previous loan used for vehicle repair.
 
In 2010, Rowena joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Recently, Rowena took a new loan to buy tires to replace the old ones. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family in the near future.

loans.use: to buy tires

loans.name: Mateo

texts.en:
Mateo is 64 years old and lives in Sta. Cruz, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. He is widowed with two children now in their adult age. 
Mateo is engaged in hog-fattening activities for four years already, and earns approximately PHP 6,000.00 each month from doing this type of work. At present, he is also receiving a monthly honorarium as an elected Barangay Official in his community. He has requested a loan to be used in purchasing six sacks of booster and grower mass feeds. Mateo has been a member of PMPC for almost two years. In the future, Mateo hopes to expand his hog- fattening business.

loans.use: to purchase six sacks of booster and grower mass feeds.

loans.name: Rujim

texts.en: Rujim, a hard working man, is single and earns an income from his transportation services, aside from his salary from another job.  He has been employed by a private institution for more than seven years.  Aside from this, he also has a farm where his investments go.  With his generated income, his previous loan was used for motor repairs and was successfully repaid.  Recently, Rujim took a new loan to buy fertilizer such as manure to improve the farm and be able to increase his income.  In the future, he wants to improve the general living situation of the entire family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer such as manure.

loans.name: Dlores

texts.en:
Dlores is forty-eight years old and married with five children. With two children in school, Dlores works very hard to provide for them.

Dlores's business and family home were destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Dlores has restarted her business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

She has taken an 8,000 PHP housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home.  She is using this loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor. Dlores is committed to rebuilding her devastated life and in future would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Rosario works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from internet cafe.  Rosario is borrowing PHP 12000 through NWTF in order to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

Rosario has been sustaining her business activities through her past 19 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of spices to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Aijan

texts.ru: Айжан обращается в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за повторным кредитом. Она участник группы "Ийгилик-3", кроме нее в группе состоят еще 2 человека. Полученный ранее кредит позволил Айжан развить ее бизнес до 1 дойной коровы и 5 овец. Также Айжан занимается полеводством на собственном земельном наделе в 1,0 ГА, где на сегодняшний день она выращивает фасоль. На полученный кредит Айжан планирует приобрести минеральные удобрения, ГСМ и подготовить почву для весенне-полевых работ. Прибыль от кредита позволит Айжан купить бытовую технику для дома и сделать пристройку к дому.
texts.en: Aijan is turning to bank Bai-Tushum for a repeat loan. She is a member of the Iygilik-3 group as well as other two members besides her. The previous loan allowed Aijan to grow her business to one milk cow and five sheep. Also Aijan is in field crop cultivation and has her own plot of land which is 1 hectare where she grows beans. She plans to use the loan to buy mineral fertiizer, GSM and prepare the land for the spring cultivation. Aijan will use the profit from the loan to buy equipment for home and build an adjacent structure to the house.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic is thirty-two years old with three children who are in school. Marivic works very hard to provide for them.

Marivic's business and family home were destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Marivic has restarted her business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

She has taken a 10,000 PHP housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home. She is using this loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Marivic is committed to rebuilding her devastated life and in future would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Thanh

texts.en:
Thanh, 30, lives in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City with her family, including her daughter and husband. Her husband is a worker at a local company. Thanh earns money through her food stall selling noodles and other meals. She started this business three years ago. 

Thanh would like to get a loan to buy a larger stock of food to better meet her customers' needs and increase her turnover. She hopes her business will ensure that her family members, and especially her child, will have a better education and a better future.

loans.use: To buy food for selling at her stall.

loans.name: Cheng Hean

texts.en:
Originally from a rural village in Kampon Cham province’s Kampong Siem district, Cheng Hean is a 59-year-old mother of three children, one of whom is still dependent on her. She and her husband sell Khmer noodles and snacks in her village. Together, they can earn about 60,000 KHR per day from the current business and can manage to save about 20,000 KHR each day.

Cheng Hean has been with VisionFund for two cycles and completely paid back the loans. The past loans have helped her better support her family. Now she is applying for a loan of 3,000,000 KHR to buy materials for her son’s jewelry-making business. She hopes this loan will enable her son to earn more income from his business.

loans.use: to buy materials for her son’s business

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Kampong Siem district

loans.name: Chhorn Chhay's Group

texts.en:
Originally from Battambang province and a mother of five children, Chhorn is 64 years old and a local farmer who strives for a living via rice cropping. Involved in her current business for 12 years, Chhorn is able to generate almost 24,000 Cambodian riels (KHR) per day to meet the family's need. She has been with VisionFund (a Kiva partner) for eight cycles and her living condition is getting better than before.

Now, Chhorn leads a group of four to get a new loan. She and one of her co-borrowers are applying for 1,400,000 KHR each while her remaining borrowers are applying for 1,000,000 KHR each. As a leader, she will manage her loan portion to buy fertilizer and seeds, and to pay for labor costs for her rice field. She hopes to improve her condition of living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds, and to pay for labor cost

loans.name: Pov's Group

texts.en: Pov is a resident from the Dambae district of Kampong Cham province.  She is 31 years old and has one kid who is in school. Rice and cassava farming are the main sources of income for feeding the family. Her 13 years of involvement in her current business have enabled her to earn around 34,000 KHR per day. Pov has been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for five loans including this loan with a successful repayment record. Now, her living conditions are getting better. She is seeking a new loan and she is a group leader of two. She and her co-borrower are seeking the same loan amount of 2,000,000 KHR each. As a leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy insecticide and fertilizer and to pay for plowing and labor fees for her cassava farm. She hopes that she will gain a good yield and sell at a high price to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy insecticide and fertilizer and to pay for plowing and labor fees

loans.name: Cheth Kha's Group

texts.en: A young father of two, Cheth, aged 29 lives with his family in a rural area located in Kampong Cham province. He supports the family by growing cassava. This is his third loan with VisionFund. He requested the money to buy fertilizers and pesticides. Also, he will use a portion of his loan to pay a plowing fee and will reserve some money to pay for labor fee during harvesting. Cheth hopes to generate more income so that he can send all his children to university.

loans.use: to pay a plowing fee and to buy fertilizers and pesticides

loans.name: Yeng Vet's Group

texts.en:
Originally from a village of Battambang province’s Moung Russey district, Yeng is 34 years old and married. For more than 15 years, she and her husband have been farming rice as the primary source of the family’s income and they can earn about KHR 40,000 per day to meet the family’s needs. 

Yeng has been a member of VisionFund for one cycle already and she wisely and successfully used the first loan to make her living conditions better. She is now leading her group to ask for a loan. Yeng is going to use her share of the loan to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland and use a portion of it to spend on labor fees. She hopes this loan will enable her to earn more income from her current business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Sareang Saroet's Group

texts.en:
Sareang, 24, lives with her two children in a rural village of the Thmor Koul district, Cambodia. She is a widowed mother. To feed the family, Sareang earns a living as farmers who have been farming rice for three years. To supplement the income, she has been selling grocery items as well. The current business earns her about 20,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s need.

This is the first microloan for Sareang with VisionFund. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes to increase her crop yields so as to generate more income to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland

loans.name: Emiliana

texts.en:
Emiliana is 26 years old, and she is now applying for a loan of $800 to improve her business. She opened her kiosk in 2000 with her own working capital of $70. She earns a good income from her business.
