She will use her loan to buy  wooden building. She is a very hardworking woman and doing business has become her regular activity for the past 14 years. She wants to make her business bigger and improve her living conditions in the future.

loans.use: To buy wooden building

loans.name: Khin

texts.en:
Khin is married with three children. The family lives in an urban area in Kandal province. Khin buys and resells lotus seed, which is a typical fruit in Cambodia, while her husband takes care of the farming business. The income they earn is just enough to cover their daily expenses.

Khin has a dream to see her son finish university. Knowing that VisionFund offers education loans, Khin decided to apply for a loan to cover the school fees of her son, who is studying civil engineering in the city.

loans.use: To pay for higher education costs

loans.name: Chariya

texts.en:
Living in a rural area located in the Steung Meanchey district, Chariya is 28-year-old widow and mother of one daughter who is too young for school. She works a cashier in a local restaurant to support her family. Having been in the business for three years, she can earn enough daily income from her current job (approximately KHR 21,000) to meet the family’s needs. 

This is the first loan for Chariya with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Now she is applying for a loan to pay for her university’s tuition fee. She hopes to stay in school until her graduation.

loans.use: to pay for her university tuition fee

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes, a 56-year-old married mother of three grown children, lives in Gango, Ozamiz City. She has a buy-and-sell business of rice that earns her approximately PHP 10,000.00 each month. 

A member of PMPC for four year, Lourdes has requested a loan to purchase inventories for her enterprise like bags of rice to sell. In the future, she hopes to improve her living conditions with enough savings for her retirement.

loans.use: to purchase inventories for her business

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: el cliente de 23 años de edad se dedica a la agricultura desde hace varios años y eso le ha dado la capacidad y el conocimiento necesario para asistir sus cultivos, su principal siembra es el maíz y el maicillo, comercializa sus cultivos en agencias de compra-venta de granos básicos que están cerca de su lugar de residencia, con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas ayuda en los gastos que su familia tiene, vive en casa de sus padres con ellos  y sus hermanos, también rabaj como empleado en una fábrica, el está solicitando un crédito para poder comprar insumos agrícolas que le ayuden en la siembra de sus cultivos como: abonos, semillas, fertilizantes, etc. y mejorar el terreno para realizar sus siembras y así poder tener mejores ganancias y seguir ayudando el los gastos de su casa sin ninguna limitación.
texts.en:
The 23 year old client has worked in agriculture for many years, and that has given him the ability and the knowledge to properly care for his crops.  His primary crops are corn and sorghum.  He sells his harvests to agencies that buy and sell basic grains that are near his home.  With the earnings from his sales, he helps with his family's expenses.  He lives at home with his parents and his siblings.  He also works as an employee in a factory.

He is seeking a loan to purchase agricultural supplies that will help him to plant his crops such as: manure, seeds, fertilizers, etc. and improve his land to plant his crops.  This will allow him to improve his earnings and continue to help with his household expenses with out any restrictions.

loans.use: purchase manure, seed, fertilizers, etc and improve his land.

loans.name: Eduvejes

texts.en:
Eduvejes is 51 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Eduvejes is borrowing PHP 5000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Eduvejes has been raising pigs for 20 years and also earns additional income from food vending and selling personal products.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Emely

texts.en:
Emely is 46 years old and married with five children, one of whom is in school. Emely works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a rice and charcoal retailing business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice and charcoal to sell.

Emely has been in this business for 3 years.

In the future Emely would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice and charcoal to sell

loans.name: Elenita

texts.en:
Elenita works hard to support her family. Elenita is married, and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Elenita requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like canned goods, cooking oil, coffee, snack foods, sugar and other groceries to sell.  Elenita has been in this business for eleven years now.  She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her general store business.

Elenita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items like canned goods, cooking oil, coffee, snack foods, sugar and other groceries to sell.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina works hard to support her family. Gina is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Gina requested a PHP 28000 loan through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell in her fish stall.

Gina has been in this business for 30 years now.

Gina would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to resell in her fish stall.

loans.name: Luciana

texts.en:
Luciana is 59 years old and married, with one child. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Luciana's house was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. She has restarted her business and is committed to regain what she lost. Luciana is taking out a PHP 5,500 housing loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc.(NWTF) to purchase building materials and to pay for construction labor to build a house for her family.

She has been with NWTF since 2011, in her pursuit of her rise out of poverty. With your help, Luciana will be able to start once more, in a new home. In the future, she would like to save enough money, so she could send her child to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and to pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Roberto

texts.en:
Roberto is 21-years-old and is the second of nine children in the family. His sister Catherine supports the family through her bakery business in the Philippines.

Roberto is studying for his Bachelor of Science in Information Technology and is currently on his fourth year of this four-year course.

Roberto is borrowing 6,000 PHP to pay for tuition for the second semester of the 2013-14 school year.

When he graduates, Roberto plans to be gainfully employed so she can help to improve the quality of life of his family.

loans.use: to pay tuition

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy knitting machines and parts

loans.name: Abdillah

texts.en:
Abdillah runs a small stall selling mobile accessories and mobile phone airtime credits. Abdillah lives in Jakarta, an urban area.  Abdillah is married and lives with four people in the family house.

Abdillah began working with Ruma four years ago because he wanted to increase his income.  He feels really excited to expand his business in selling mobile phone airtime credits and servicing bill payments. As the business runs, he hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital in order to do more transactions on weekends.

loans.use: To process more airtime and bill payments transactions on a weekly basis

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to build a new room in her house from which she can run her workshop

loans.name: Efraín

texts.es:
Efraín de 69 años de edad, es casado tuvo 7 hijos con la esposa,  él no estudio porque en el tiempo que él se creció los padres decían que con las letras nadie se mantendría,  tiene 4 hijos en estados unidos ellos realizaron 3° año de bachillerato y otro noveno. Todos son mayores de edad,  acepto el ultimo que tiene diecisiete años que está estudiando último año de bachillerato.
Aprendió este trabajo desde que estaba con el padre en el cultivo de maíz es lo principal y aprendió este oficio desde que era niño de 7 años,  el aprendió otro trabajo con el ganado y también trabaja con dulce de panel hoy el  ya no trabaja como antes,  depende de las remesas que le mandan los hijos de él; y un poco de cultivo de maíz y frijoles para el consumo personal (familiar).
El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar una vaca para tener la leche en casa;  porque en la zona es escasa la leche y el que tiene no vende por poquitos solo por cántaro o si  no lo procesan; por eso la necesidad de comprar la vaca y tener la leche en la casa.
texts.en:
Efraín is 69 years old, is married, and has seven children with his wife.  He did not attend school because when he was growing up, his parents told him that with letters no one can support themselves.  He has four children in the United States who reached their third year of high school, and another who reached ninth grade.  All of his children are adults, except for the last one who is 17 years old and is in his last year of high school.  Efraín learned this trade when he was with his father, growing corn.  This is his primary crop, and he learned how to grow it when he was seven years old.  He also learned how to work with cattle and how to work with honeycombs.  He no longer works like he used to, and he depends on the money that his children send him, and on the corn and beans he grows for his and his family's consumption.

The loan that he is requesting will be used to purchase a cow in order to have milk at home because in his region milk is rare, and those who have it do not sell it in small amounts, only in jugs, or they process it.  For this reason, he is need of purchasing a cow in order to have milk at home.

loans.use: purchase a cow to have milk at home.

loans.name: Abdul

texts.en:
Abdul runs a small stall which sells mobile phone airtime credits. Abdul lives in Jakarta, an urban area.  Abdul is married and lives with three people in the family house. 

Abdul began working with Ruma one month ago because he wants to increase his income.  He feels really excited to expand his business in selling mobile phone airtime credits and serving bill payments. As the business continues, he hopes to get a Kiva loan as a working capital loan in order to do more transactions on weekends.

loans.use: To process more airtime and bill payment transactions on a weekly basis

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new 3 gauge knitting machine for her workshop

loans.name: Daouda

texts.fr:
Monsieur DAOUDA, né à Koredougou, il est marié et père de 2 enfants et il réside chez lui-même avec son épouse dans une famille traditionnelle à Loulouni un arrondissement de la région de SIKASSO 3ième région administrative de la république du MALI. 
Monsieur DAOUDA mène des activités d’achat et de vente des marchandises de boutique ( sucre, riz, bonbon, huile, cigarette etc) il y'a plus de 2 ans, il s'approvisionne à Sikasso.
 Il est à son premier prêt  individuel avec l’Institution de Micro Finance Soro Yiriwaso dans le souci de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante.   
Ce prêt lui permettra de faire l’achat de 2 sacs de 50 kg du sucre, 2 sacs de 50 kg de riz, 2 bidons de 20 litre d’huile, 2 cartons de 12 paquets de bonbon et 3 cartons de cigarettes au grand marché. Sa vente se fait dans sa boutique à Loulouni, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes  au comptant et à crédit. 
Il envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 30.000 francs CFA par mois. Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer le prêt et son intérêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en: Daouda was born in December 1985 in Koredougou. He is a married father of two who lives in his own house within a traditional family framework in Loulouni, a district in the region of Sikasso, the third administrative region of the Republic of Mali. Daouda has been buying and selling products through his shop (sugar, rice, sweets, oil, cigarettes, etc...) for over two years. He gets his supplies from Sikasso City. This is his first personal loan with the Soro Yiriwaso Micro Finance Institution, which he wants to use in order to better meet the needs of his ever-growing customer base. This loan will allow him to purchase two 50 kg sacks of sugar, two 50 kg sacks of rice, two 20-litre containers of oil, two 12-pack cartons of sweets and three cartons of cigarettes from the main market. He sells these products from his shop in Loulouni to a customer base made up of both men and women, where he accepts cash and credit in payment. He is planning on making an average monthly profit of 30,000 CFA. These profits will allow him to pay back the loan, with interest, and to invest the rest back into his business.

loans.use: to purchase various products for his shop

loans.name: Issa

texts.fr:
Monsieur ISSA est à SANANKORO, il est marié, père de 4 enfants et il réside avec son épouse dans une famille traditionnelle à SANANKORO un village de l’arrondissement de LOULOUNI dans la région de SIKASSO 3ième région administrative de la république du MALI. 
Monsieur ISSA mène des activités d’achat et de vente des noix d’acajoux (anarcadium) il ya plus de 4 ans, il s’approvisionne à SANANKORO, à N’DALLEN et les villages environnants de SANANKORO.
 Il est à son premier prêt  individuel avec l’Institution de Micro Finance Soro Yiriwaso dans le souci de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante.     
Ce prêt lui permettra de faire l’achat d’une tonne d’anarcadium pour la revendre  à LOULOUNI à une clientèle composée d’homme  au comptant et à crédit. 
Il envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 40 000 francs CFA par mois. Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer le prêt et son intérêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en: Issa was born in 1977 in Sanarkoro. He is a married father of four who lives with his wife within the framework of a traditional family in Sanankoro, a village in the district of Loulouni in the region of Sikasso, the third administrative region of the Republic of Mali. Issa has been buying and selling cashew nuts for over four years. He gets his supplies from N'Dallen and Sanankoro and its surrounding villages. This is his first personal loan with the Soro Yiriwaso Micro Finance Institution, which he wants to use in order to better meet the needs of his ever-growing customer base. This loan will allow him to purchase one tonne of cashew nuts. These cashews will be resold in Loulouni to a customer base made up of both men and women, where he accepts cash and credit in payment. He is planning on making an average monthly profit of 40,000 CFA. These profits will allow him to pay back the loan, with interest, and to invest the rest back into his business.

loans.use: to purchase cashew nuts

loans.name: Fatogoma

texts.fr:
Monsieur FATOGOMA né en Avril 1980 à KADIOLO, il est marié, père de 6 enfants et il réside avec son épouse dans une famille traditionnelle à KADIOLO Noumousso un cercle de la région de SIKASSO 3ième région administrative de la république du MALI. 
Monsieur FATOGOMA mène des activités d’achat et de vente des matériels électriques ( panneaux solaires, batteries, file électrique etc) il y'a plus de 10 ans, il s’approvisionne à BAMAKO.
 Il est à son cinquième prêt  individuel avec l’Institution de Micro Finance Soro Yiriwaso dans le souci de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante. Les prêts antérieur ont été correctement remboursés.    
Ce prêt lui permettra de faire l’achat de 5 panneaux, 15 batteries et 12 rouleaux de fil électrique à BAMAKO. Sa vente se fait dans sa boutique à KADIOLO à une clientèle composée d’homme et de femme  au comptant et à crédit. 
Il envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 80 000 francs CFA par mois. Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer le prêt et son intérêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Mr. Fatogoma was born in April 1980 in Kadiolo. He is married with six children and lives with his wife in a traditional family in Kadiolo Noumousso, a district in Sikasso, the third administrative region of the Republic of Mali.

For over ten years Mr. Fatogoma has been buying and selling electrical equipment (solar panels, batteries, electric wire, etc.) He gets his supplies in Bamako.

This is his fifth individual loan with the  Soro Yiriwaso micro-finance institution, to better satisfy an increasing number of customers. The previous loans have been repaid in full.

This loan will enable him to purchase five panels, 15 batteries and 12 rolls of wire in Bamako. Sales are conducted in his shop in Kadiolo, to a clientele composed of men and women, for cash and on credit.

He expects average monthly profits of 80,000 CFA francs. This profit will enable him to pay off the loan and its interest, and invest the rest in his activity.

loans.use: buy electrical equipment

loans.name: Sanata

texts.fr:
Madame SANATA est née  à TINFOUGA, mariée et mère de 4 enfants elle réside avec son époux et leurs enfants dans une famille nucléaire à BANCONI un des quartiers périphérique de la ville de Sikasso  troisième région administrative de la république du Mali.
Sanata après avoir mené beaucoup d’activités sans succès  s’est initiée des activités d’achat et de vente des pagnes wax et des tasses et  ustensile de cuisine il y’a environ 5 ans. 
 Dans le souci de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elle décida d’intégrer l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il y a 3 ans. Après quatre prêts solidaires (prêt du groupe) dans une association des femmes de son quartier, elle est à son quatrième prêt  individuel. Tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés.                                                                                                          Ce quatrième prêt lui permettra d’acheter 10 pièces de pagne wax et  10 colis de tasses en aluminium à Bobo Dioulasso (Burkina Faso) et qui seront vendus à Sikasso de façon ambulante à une clientèle composée  des femmes.
Elle envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 30 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en: Sanata was born in 1968 in Tinfouga. She is a married mother of four who lives with her husband and children within the framework of a nuclear family in Banconi, one of the outlying districts of Sikasso City, within the third administrative region of the Republic of Mali. After leading many unsuccessful ventures, Sanata got started in the business of buying and selling wax prints, mugs and kitchen utensils. She has been doing this for five years. In order to better satisfy her ever-growing customer base, she decided to become involved with the Soro Yiriwaso Micro Finance Institution three years ago. After taking out four group loans, allocated through a women's association within her district, this will be her fourth personal loan. All of the previous loans have been paid back in full. This fourth loan will allow her to purchase ten printed wax sheets and ten packs of aluminium mugs from Bobo-Dioulasso in Burkina Faso. She will then travel about Sikasso selling these products to a female customer base. She is planning on making an average monthly profit of 30,000 CFA, which will allow her to meet her family's expenses, pay back the interest on her loan and invest the rest back into her business.

loans.use: to purchase various products

loans.name: Komlan

texts.fr: Marié à une revendeuse, et père de 03 enfants scolarisés, Mr Komlan pour subvenir aux besoins de la famille à démarré la vente de boissons. Il s'approvisionne à la Brasserie de Lomé et espère avec le profit tiré de la vente rénover sa boutique et subvenir aux besoins de la famille. Il a une ancienneté de 14ans dans l'activité.
texts.en: Komlan is married to a reseller and the father of three children who all go to school.   He sells drinks to meet the needs of his family. He stocks up at the Lomé brewery.  With the profit from the sale of drinks, he is hoping to renovate his shop and meet the needs of his family.  He has been in this business for the past 14 years.

loans.use: to buy drinks.

loans.name: Jose Mauricio

texts.es: Don José de 48 años de edad se dedica a la agricultura desde hace varios años y eso le ha dado la capacidad y el conocimiento necesario para asistir sus cultivos, su principal siembra es el maíz y frijol, comercializa sus cultivos en agencias de granos básicos que están cerca de su lugar de residencia, con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas ayuda en los gastos que su familia tiene, vive con su esposa y sus hijos, Don José  está solicitando un crédito para poder comparar insumos agrícolas que le ayuden en la siembra de sus cultivos como: abonos, semillas, fertilizantes, etc. y mejorar el terreno donde desea realizar la siembra que es el muestra la fotografía y así poder tener mejores ganancias y seguir ayudando en los gastos de su casa sin ninguna limitación.
texts.en:
José is 48 years old, and has worked in agriculture for many years, which has given him the skills and knowledge necessary to care for his crops.  His principal crops are corn and beans.  He sells his harvests to basic grain agencies that are near his home.  With the earnings from his sales, he helps with his family's expenses.  He lives with his wife and their children.

José is seeking a loan to purchase agricultural supplies that will help him to grow his crops such as: manure, seeds, fertilizers, etc. and to improve the land that he plans on planting his crops.  The land can be see in the photograph.  This will allow him to improve his earnings and continue to help with his household expenses with out any restrictions.

loans.use: purchase manure, seeds, fertilizers, etc. and improve his land.

loans.name: Kangni

texts.fr: Âgé de 37ans, Mr Kangni est revendeur de produits cosmétiques. Il s'approvisionne au Grand Marché de Lomé et est à son second crédit à WAGES. Ce prêt lui servira d'acheter des produits cosmétiques afin de répondre aux besoins des clients. Il souhaite avoir une boutique et subvenir aux besoins de la famille. Marié, il a 02 enfants(05 et 03ans) dont 01 scolarisé.
texts.en: Mr. Koffi, aged 37, is a vendor of cosmetic products. He gets his supplies at the Grand Market of Lomé and is on his second WAGES loan. This loan will be used to purchase some cosmetics to respond to customer needs. He would like to have a store and to meet the needs of his family. A married man, he has two children (5 and 3 years old), of whom one is in school.

loans.use: to buy beauty products.

loans.name: Inocencio

texts.en: Inocencio Jr. is 29 years old and single. In order to have an additional source of income, he has a hog-raising business within his community. He aims to improve his business and increase his income to support his parents and save some money for his future. He would like to acquire more pigs to raise but has inadequate capital. For this reason, Inocencio is asking for a loan of PHP35,000 to buy hog feed, vitamins, vaccines and additional pigs to raise. With this loan, he believes that he will be able to improve his business and increase his income. He is hoping that someday, he will become successful and financially stable.

loans.use: to buy hog feed, vitamins, vaccines and additional pigs to raise.

loans.name: Eric

texts.fr:
Eric is a 35-year-old man who lives in a district of the capital. He has been running a vehicle washing service in a corner of his space for more than a year. Thanks to his energetic personality and competence in his field, Eric has an ever-growing clientele whose demand he would like to continue to meet.

For this reason, Eric is seeking a loan of 200,000 XAF to purchase a second machine for cleaning vehicles. The income he earns from this loan will help him to increase his revenue and his customer loyalty. It will also allow him to better prepare his work site and support his family.
texts.en: Eric is a 36-year-old man who lives in a neighborhood in the capital. He has been running a vehicle washing company in a part of the capital for two years. Thanks to his dynamic energy

loans.use: to purchase a second machine for cleaning vehicles

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To prepare his land for use where he will harvest his crops by purchasing manure, irrigation and pesticides.

loans.name: Otinkorang Group

texts.en:
These members are part of the group called Otinkorang and are made up of three women who live in the same neighborhood. They sell baf loaf (fried flour), charcoal, second-hand clothing, handbags, cloth and materials 

The group representative, Richlove  (the woman standing in the middle in the photo), is 32 years old. Richlove received an education up to the primary school level. Richlove is single and lives alone. In order to meet her own expenses, Richlove has been selling second-hand clothing, bags, skirts and ladies' tops on the pavement for 11 years.  Richlove gets her supplies from a market in Ghana. 

In order to further strengthen their buying power and better satisfy client demand, Richlove and the other members of the Otinkorang Group are requesting their sixth loan from ID-Ghana. Their previous loans were repaid in full.

loans.use: To buy second-hand clothing, bags, skirts and ladies' tops to sell on the pavement .

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en:
Hasan is a 29-year-old married man from Deir el Balah city. He lives with his wife in a small house and works as an employee in the public sector. He earns a low income which is not enough to cover all of his family's needs. Hasan wanted to improve his living conditions so he started his own business, transferring goods in the local market using a rental rickshaw. It is a good business and the demand is high. 

Hasan requested a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy his own rickshaw for his work. By taking this loan, Hasan will be able to increase his income and productivity. Hasan appears in the photo with his rickshaw.

loans.use: to buy his own rickshaw for his work.

loans.name: Gulsara

texts.en:
Gulsara is industrious woman. She is a student at the Tajikistan State University, studying their second course in Politics and Business. 

This course is in the faculty of Accountancy and Auditing. Gulsara is one of their best students. She takes part in many competitions between students. 

Gulsara is married. Her husband is a master of repairing houses. She does not have enough money to pay for education, so she is asking for a loan to pay for tuition. She looks forward to your support.

loans.use: To pay for tuition

loans.name: Salvador

texts.es: Salvador de 31 años de edad vive junto a su compañera de vida y sus hijos, él se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijol tiene 6 años de dedicarse a la agricultura por lo que se ha hecho de mucha experiencia en el rubro, es muy conocido en la zona y ya tiene buena clientela pues obtiene las mejores cosechas, por lo tanto comercia producto de primera calidad y a precios muy accesibles, además el servicio es inigualable, don Salvador  quiere aumentar la producción, pero necesita de un apoyo de capital por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar semillas, abonos, herbicidas, fertilizante, etc. y mejorar el terreno que es el que muestra la fotografia. Él  tiene referencias de tener una moral intachable, responsable y de muy buena paga, confía que podrá responder a la deuda y al mismo tiempo podrá darle a su familia una vida plena.
texts.en:
Salvador is 31 years old and lives with his life partner and their children. He has been growing corn and beans for 6 years, thus has a lot of experience in the industry. He is well known in the area and has good customers, as he grows the best crops. He sells first-quality products at affordable prices, and gives unparalleled service. 

Don Salvador wants to increase his production, but needs capital. He is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL that will allow him to buy seeds, fertilizers, herbicides, fertilizer, etc. and improve the land that is shown in the picture. He has references that state he is of good character, responsible, and will make his repayments. He is confident that he will be able to repay the loan and, at the same time, give his family a better life.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, herbicides, fertilizer, etc. and improve the land

loans.name: Margie

texts.en:
Margie is a 36-year-old widow with three children, two of whom in school.

She and her family survived super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013, but her business and family home were wiped out. 

Margie is taking out a housing loan amounting to 6,500 Philippine Pesos to buy building materials and to pay for construction labor to build a house for her family. 

Margie has been an NWTF borrower since 2013. She plans to repay her loan through selling fish.

With your help, Margie can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of super typhoon Haiyan. In future, she would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy building materials and to pay for construction labor

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is 40 four years old, and married with four children, two of whom are in school. Marites works very hard to provide for them.

Marites's business and family home was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Marites has restarted her business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Marites has taken a 9,000 Philippine Pesos housing loan through NWTF to rebuild her family home.

She is using this loan to buy building materials and to pay for construction labor.

Marites is committed to rebuilding her devastated life, and in future would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy building materials and to pay for construction labor

loans.name: Marivel

texts.en:
Marivel works hard to support her family. On November 8, 2013, her business and home were wiped out by super typhoon Haiyan.

She has restarted her business and is now requesting a 10,000 Philippine Pesos housing loan through NWTF to buy building materials and to pay for construction labor so she can build a house for her family.

With your help, Marivel will be able to rebuild her devastated life sooner.

In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy building materials and to pay for construction labor

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia is 50 years old, and married with six children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines, and has asked for a loan of 20,000 Philippine Pesos through NWTF to buy items like chips, canned goods, noodles, egg, soap, etc to sell in her store. 

Letecia has borrowed and repaid 19 loans from NWTF in the past. She has been running the general store for one year and also earns an income from buying and selling fish, and food vending.

She aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items like chips, canned goods, noodles, egg, soap, etc. to sell

loans.name: Hashim

texts.en:
Hashim started his business two years ago, when he worked as a pharmacist in one of the pharmacies in the capital to look after his family. He was able to accumulate a good amount of money and opened his own pharmacy. Hashem earns good profits, but he faces a hardship of inadequate capital to meet the high demand of the patients. He warmly thanks Kiva lenders who helped him in his first loan. 

That loan helped him very much in developing his business and purchasing more medical requirements. His profits also increased since he become able to meet the demand of different types of customers. After he has successfully repaid all the installments, he is requesting to take another loan to expand his business more by purchasing more medical requirements. His dreams are diversifying his business and starting up a big pharmacy. 

For this business, Hashim applied for a loan of 500,000 YER from AMB. He will use this loan to buy more medical requirements and medicines. Hashim looks forward to improving his business and expanding it more, as well as opening more branches in the capital city. He hopes to improve the standard of living for his family.

loans.use: To buy more medical requirements and medicines

loans.name: Om Majed 3 Group

texts.en:
Amira, 29, is the leader of the group Om Majed 3, which is comprised of four women who live in Hodeidah, Yemen. She lives with her three daughters in a simple house. After her husband traveled abroad to work, Samira assumed all the responsibility for the family. The situation was wretched, but she didn't give up and strove to improve their conditions.

In 2010 Samira started her own business selling women’s clothes, perfume and incense. She started out with little money but was then fortunate to receive financial support from her mother to continue running her business. For this, Samira is very thankful.

Now Samara depends on herself financially in her business. She makes modest profits, most of which go to cover the family's expenses. She would like to further develop her business, but she has little in capital.

Samira’s group is now applying for a 110,000 YER loan through AMB. Samara herself will use 50,000 YER of it to buy more clothes, perfume, incense and other items to sell to her customers. With the anticipated expansion of her business she hopes to provide her daughters with a secure future.

loans.use: to buy more clothes, perfume, incense and other items to sell to her customers

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Razia is a 35-year-old, married woman. She has been doing a business of selling milk for the past 11 years. She has two cows and one buffalo in milk. She sells milk to many of her neighbors, along with butter that she makes from the milk. Her business is good enough for her to lead a decent life. 

She has six children. She is very motivated to provide them with a beautiful life, with good education, food, and clothing. She has improved her business to meet the day-to-day expenses of life.   

It’s Razia's third year with Kashf Foundation. She is happily running her business through the support of it. Now, she has requested a loan of PKR 40,000 to purchase one more cow. She hopes to get an increase in the production capacity of milk which, ultimately, will help in generating more cash.

loans.use: to purchase one more cow.

loans.name: Nazira

texts.ru:
Назира милая и доброжелательная девушка из города Душанбе, столицы Таджикистана. Ей 25 лет, она еще не замужем. Назира занимается собственным бизнесом на центральном рынке города. Она продает национальные мужские одеяния, в частности распашные халаты "джома" и "яктаг", пояс-платок, тюбетейку, чалму и т.д. Пожилые мужчины таджики в основном носят эти одеяния. А также данные одеяния мужчины носят на религиозных мероприятиях.
Назире в ее бизнесе помогают родители. Она с их поддержкой и помощью занимается данным бизнесом уже более трех лет. Сейчас она обратилась за кредитом для увеличения товарооборота. На сумму кредита она планирует увеличить ассортимент мужских одеяний и привлечь больше клиентов.
texts.en:
Nazira is a nice and kind-hearted woman from Dushanbe, the capital of Tajikistan. She is 25 years old and not yet married. Nazira runs her own business in the central market of the city. She sells ethnic Tajik-style men's garments, in particular "joma" and "yakmag" robes, handkerchief belts, skullcaps, turbans, etc. Elderly Tajik men primarily wear these garments. Men also wear these types of garments for religious ceremonies.

Nazira's parents help her with this business. With their help and support, she has been running this business for more than three years already. Now she has requested a loan to increase her sales turnover. With the lent amount, she plans to increase her assortment of men's garments and attract more customers.

loans.use: to buy an assortment of ethnic Tajik-style men's garments for developing her retail business.

loans.name: Darkhanbaatar

texts.en:
Darkhanbaatar is 38 years old, and lives with his wife and two children in Darkhan, which is the second largest city in Mongolia. His children go to high school. 

He and his wife have been selling recyclable materials since 2004. He is asking for a loan of 3,000 US dollars to buy recyclable materials in large amounts, so that he and his wife can continue to run their business without worrying about shortage of inventory. 

Darkhanbaatar is a very hardworking individual who strives for better future.

loans.use: to buy recyclable materials

loans.name: Sitorai

texts.ru: 24-летняя Ситораи вместе с мужем в течение года занимается торговлей. Она из города Куляб. У нее двое маленьких детей в возрасте 2 и 4 лет. Ситораи и ее муж занимаются куплей и продажей детской одежды. Прибыль с бизнеса единственный источник дохода семьи. Они ценят свой бизнес и всегда думают о его расширении. В данный момент им нужно закупить сезонный товар для увеличения продаж. Для реализации цели Ситораи просит кредит, в котором они действительно нуждаются для купли нового товара и привлечения клиентов.
texts.en: 24-year-old Sitorai and her husband have been in the retail business for a year. She is from the city of Kulob. She has two young children who are 2 and 4 years old. Sitorai and her husband buy and sell children's clothes. The profits from this business are the family's only course of income. They value their business and always think about expanding it. They currently need to buy seasonal merchandise to increase their sales. To accomplish this goal, Sitorai is requesting a loan which she truly needs to buy new merchandise and attract customers.

loans.use: to buy seasonal children's clothes to develop their retail business.

loans.name: Nuevo Amanecer  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Nuevo Amanecer está formado por 8 mujeres quienes son personas amables, carismáticas, luchadoras y muy trabajadoras, que luchan día a día para sacar  adelante a sus familias y mejorar la economía de sus hogares. Viven por la comunidad de Zhidmad en Cuenca, este lugar se encuentra rodeado de naturaleza y vegetación, su gente se dedica a la cría de animales, agricultura y muchos, trabajan en la ciudad en diferentes actividades regresando en la noche a sus hogares. 
Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Rosa tiene 34 años de edad, está casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 4 hijos de  14, 11, 7 y 4 años, su primera hija   estudia en el colegio y sus tres hijos siguientes estudian en una escuelita del sector, su esposo labora como cocinero, la casa en la que vive es propia.
La Señora Rosa se dedica a los quehaceres de su hogar y a cuida de sus hijos, pero para ayudarle a su esposo económicamente labora como empleada domestica y también se dedica a la crianza de cerdos. Su crédito va a  invertir en los estudios de sus hijos, va a comprar uniformes, útiles escolares y libros que les hacen falta. Su meta es de llegar a tener un negocio propio en su casa como una tienda.
texts.en: The communal bank Nuevo Amanecer is formed by 8 women who are kind, charismatic, brave and very hardworking; who struggle day by day to improve the lives of their families and improve their family finances. They live in the community of Zhidmad in Cuenca. This place is surrounded by nature and vegetation. Its people work raising animals, in agriculture, and many work in the city in different activities and return to their homes in the evening. One of the members of this group is Rosa. She is 34 years old, married, and fruit of her marriage are 4 children, who are 14, 11, 7 and 4 years old. Her oldest daughter studies in high school and her other three other children study in the little school of the area. Her husband works as a cook. She owns the house where she lives. Rosa does the household chores and takes care of the children, but in order to help her husband financially she works as a domestic employee and also raises pigs. She will invest this loan in her children's studies. She will buy the books they need. Her goal is to be able to have an own business such as a store in her house.

loans.use: Comprar uniformes, útiles escolares y libros.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
As a married mother of eight children, Lolita works hard to support her family.

She has a rice retail business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from food vending.  

Lolita is borrowing 12,000 PHP through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) in order to buy more stock of rice to sell.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. 

Lolita hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stock of rice to sell.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Myrna works hard to support her family.

She has a general store in the Philippines and also earns additional income from motorcycle transport.  

Myrna is borrowing 30,000 PHP through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase additional stock to sell like canned goods, soap, toothpaste, and eggs for her general store. She successfully paid back her previous loan and now requests a new loan to further build her business.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her past 24 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell like canned goods, soap, toothpaste, and eggs.

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for nine years. She also earns more income from buying and reselling ice. 

She is borrowing 30,000 PHP through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase bread, chips, biscuits, and canned goods to sell in her general store.

Merlyn successfully paid back her previous loan and now requests a new loan to further build her business. She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. 

She dreams to save enough money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase bread, chips, biscuits, and canned goods to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Lilybeth

texts.en:
Lilybeth is 36 years old, married, and has three children. Two of the children are in school. Lilybeth is a very hardworking entrepreneur.  

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines and has been in this business for five years.

Lilybeth requested a 23,000 PHP loan amount through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) in order to buy more fish to sell.

In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
Jessica, a 27-year-old married mother of one, works hard to provide for her family. She has been running a general store for five years in the Philippines, and also earns income from pig fattening.

Having borrowed and repaid seven previous loans from NWTF, Jessica has requested a new one for PHP 20000 to buy additional stocks to sell such as snack foods, canned goods, sugar, soap, noodles, etc. She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks to sell such as snack foods, canned goods, sugar, soap, noodles, etc

loans.name: Andres

texts.es: Andres, de 30 años, es un experto en bordar con su máquina, los colegios forman parte de su  clientela pues borda sus logotipos. Su necesidad de ser oportuno es prioritaria y requiere tener otra maquinaria, pero su desafío es lograr tener dinero para comprarla. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará una bordadora, para dar respuesta a su mercado efectivamente.  Desde hace 3 años emprendió su propia aventura de generación de ingresos autónomo, observando como su madre una experimentada confeccionista, pagaba por el servicio de bordado en otras empresas que muchas veces incumplían con este servicio y ella se estresaba porque no cumplía a  tiempo a su clientela causándole un efecto negativo a su negocio. Fue así como su hermana al ver esta debilidad del negocio de su madre, decidió comprarle una bordadora y Andrés fue el que recibió la inducción de uso; desde entonces, él es quien presta el servicio en su casa y los directores de colegios, familiares de estudiantes y dueños de equipos deportivos, llegan a esta a solicitar el servicio.  Sus ventas las realiza  unas veces de contado y otras a crédito que recupera semanalmente y para ello dispone de un horario de 8 de la mañana a 1 de la tarde, mientras compra en almacenes especializados en la industria de la confección, que venden los insumos que Andrés requiere.   Su meta es comprar más bordadoras y administrar el negocio generando oportunidades a personas para que se empleen. Pero su mayor desafío es que no cuenta con los recursos económicos suficientes para dar cumplimiento rápidamente a su sueño de prosperidad.
texts.en:
Andres at 30 years old is an expert at embroidery on his machine. His colleagues form part of his clientele as he does their logos. His need to be expedient is a priority and he needs to have another machine but he doesn't have the money to buy it. That is the reason he has requested a loan from Kiva, the first loan he has made through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. He will use it to buy a embroidery machine to meet his market demand.

Three years ago he started his own adventure of generating money on his own. He observed how his mother, an experienced sewer paid other companies to embroider and many times they failed to come through with their service. She stressed as she couldn't deliver her product on time having a negative effect on her business. So that is how his sister seeing this weakness in her mother's business decided to buy an embroiderer and Andres was the one who was taught how to use it.

Since then he has offered his services from his house and School Directors, student’s families and owners of sports teams have come requesting his services. Sometimes he sells in cash and sometimes on credit, which he collects every week. He works from 8 in the morning until 1 in the afternoon. He buys his supplies from warehouses specializing in the sewing industry. His goal is to buy more embroiderers and manage the business generating employment for people he hires. His challenge is that he does not have the money to quickly carry out his dream of prosperity.

loans.use: to buy an embroiderer.

loans.name: Sammy

texts.en:
Sammy has operated a retail shop business where he sells household consumables such as wheat flour and maize flour from home to his neighbors. In addition, he has a mechanical workshop for his business repairing motorcycles and cars.  

Sammy is requesting a 50,000 KES loan to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, and cooking fat for his business. In the future, he dreams of expanding to a wholesale shop. Sammy appreciates your support.

loans.use: to purchase of wheat flour, maize flour. and coking fat

loans.name: Urunisa

texts.ru: Урунисе 64 года, вдова, есть взрослый сын, который активно помогает матери по хозяйству. У Урунисы - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Уруниса занимается животноводством, стартовав 16 лет назад, с покупки скота на 10,000 сом (KGS). Целеустремленность и упорный труд позволили Урунисе развить свое хозяйство до 2 дойных коров. Ежемесячный доход составляет 10,000 сом (KGS). Уруниса входит в группу "Береке". В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Уруниса обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум"  за кредитом на покупку овец для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Уруниса планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на улучшение условий для содержания скота.
texts.en: Urunisa is 64 years old, widowed, and has an adult son who actively helps her farm. Urunisa has a high school education, and is the main breadwinner for her family through her work in livestock, which she began 16 years ago, with a purchase of one cattle for 10,000 som (KGS). Determination and hard work have allowed Urunisa to develop her farm to have two dairy cows. The monthly income is 10,000 com (KGS). Urunisa joined the group "Bereke" with two other people. As a result, there are three of them. Urunisa is the leader of the group. In order to develop their economy, Urunisa asked the bank "Bai-Tushum" for a loan to purchase sheep to increase their livestock. With the income from the credit Urunisa plans to invest in further increasing the amount of domestic animals, and plans to save enough to improve conditions for the livestock.

loans.use: To buy sheep

loans.name: Fredermand Cristopher

texts.es:
Fredermand está a unos cuantos pasos para culminar su carrera en una universidad de la ciudad de León. Es un joven activo, emprendedor y trabajador. Tiene 24 años de edad, está casado y es originario de la ciudad de Chinandega. Además de estudiar, trabaja en una tienda como supervisor. Es un hombre comprometido con sus estudios y su familia. Su propósito es lograr un futuro económicamente estable. 
Solicita el crédito para poder pagar los módulos de finalización de estudios, ya que no cuenta con los recursos económicos necesarios. Frehederman deposita su confianza en el préstamo, puesto que le brindara la posibilidad de cumplir uno de sus más grandes sueños, obtener su titulo como licenciado. Su plan futuro es adquirir un trabajo acorde a su carrera, en que logre poner en práctica todos sus conocimientos.
texts.en:
Frehederman is a few steps away from completing his degree in a university in the city of León. He is an active, enterprising, and hardworking young man. He is 24 years old, he is married, and he is a native of the city of Chinandega. In addition to studying, he works as a supervisor in a store. He is a man who is committed to his studies and to his family. His goal is to achieve a future that is economically stable.

He is requesting the loan in order to be able to pay for his final courses, as he does not have the necessary economic resources.  Frehederman is placing his confidence in the loan, as it will make it possible for him to achieve one of his greatest dreams—earning his degree. 

His plan for the future is to obtain work in his field where he will be able to put all of his knowledge into practice.

loans.use: to pay for his final courses.

loans.name: Mariamu

texts.en:
Mariamu is a single woman with three children, all of whom still attend school and are still under her care. They live at their own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Mariamu operates a clothes selling business, which she sells at the market to her town dwellers and her neighbours. She cites her major challenge to be the rate of stock turnover, which is affected by seasons. 

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase two bales of clothes to sell. 

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase two bales of clothes to sell

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora

texts.es:
La variedad de ropa y la buena atención, es lo que motiva a la clientela a visitar nuevamente la tienda de ropa de María. Es una mujer servicial, cordial y emprendedora. Ella tiene 36 años. Su negocio cumple un papel importante en la formación educativa de sus tres hijos, su sueño es brindarle un futuro próspero. Asegura que toda lucha requiere de esfuerzo y ella asegura dar lo mejor de sí para cumplir sus objetivos.
María solicita un crédito para aumentar su capital de trabajo, es decir, para la compra de pantalones, camisas y perfumería, tanto para hombres como mujeres. Estimando que el crédito a solicitud le será de mucha ayuda ya que podrá lograr el crecimiento de su negocio y mejor las condiciones de vida de su familia
texts.en:
The reason why people go back to María Salazar's clothing store is because she offers a great variety of clothing and good service. She is an attentive, cordial, and enterprising woman. She is 36 years old. Her business has an important role in her three children's education. Her dream is to give them a prosperous future. She says every fight requires effort, and that she always puts her best foot forward in order to achieve her goals.

María is requesting a loan in order to increase her working capital, that is, to purchase pants, shirts, and fragrances for both men and women. She estimates the loan she is requesting will be of great help to her because it will allow her to expand her business and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy pants, shirts, and fragrances.

loans.name: Aracelly Ruth

texts.es:
Aracelly de 43 años, muestra su arduo trabajo como comerciante de ropa en las calles de Granada. Camisas, pantalones y bisutería, rodean su vida, pues goza de su trabajo, porque hace con amor lo que le gusta.
Aracelly no inició su secundaria, pero la vida, su enfermedad y los deseos de superación que cuelgan de su mano, hicieron que progresara. En estos momentos sueña con que su negocio siga creciendo y que las ganancias sigan incrementando, pues ella y su padre, quien posee una sastrería, es el único que la ha apoyado desde que comenzó. Solicita el crédito para la compra de: Blusas, Pantalones, Camisas entre otros.  Ambos se ayudan mutuamente e idealizan el futuro de Aracelly con una tienda comprada con el sudor de su frente.
texts.en:
The tanned skin of Aracelly Dormes, 43, shows her arduous work as a clothing trader in the streets of Granada. Shirts, pants and costume jewelry surround her life. She benefits from her work, because she does what she likes with love.

Aracelly didn't start secondary school, but life, her sickness and the desires of getting ahead that hooked the hand of this sun kissed woman are what made her progress. Currently, she dreams that her business continues growing and that the profits continue growing. She and her father, who owns a tailoring shop, is the only one who has helped her since she started.

She is applying for this loan for the purchase of: blouses, pants, shirts, among others. Both help each other mutually and they idealize the future of Aracelly with a store purchased with the sweat of her brow.

loans.use: for the purchase of blouses, pants, shirts, among others.

loans.name: Juan Antonio

texts.es:
Juan de 56 años de edad,  estudio hasta 6° grado, debido a la situación económica que vivia su familia dejo de estudiar, esta casado y su esposa se dedica al cuido del hogar, tiene 5 hijos y todos están acompañados, solo viven 2 nietos con ellos uno de 12 y 8 años de edad.

 Juan se dedica a la agricultura desde que tenia 8 años, trabajo que aprendió de su abuelo, ya que su padre los abandono cuando el nació, siembra maíz y yuca,  para llegar donde trabaja hay que caminar unos 35 minutos, comenta que se levanta a las 4:30 para aprovechar la mañana, trabaja 6 horas, regresa a la casa temprano porque asiste a la iglesia. 


El crédito sera invertido en la siembra de 10,500 metros cuadrados de maíz y yuca, y en la compra de abono, pesticidas y semilla.  

Su propósito es poseer unas 5 vacas lecheras para pasarla mejor, mejorar la vivienda, (cambiarle techo) y pagar el crédito y tener las puertas abiertas a futuros créditos.
texts.en:
Juan, 56, studied until grade 6 due to his family’s financial situation. He is married and his wife is a homemaker. They have 5 children who all have partners, only 2 grandchildren ages 12 and 8 live with them.

Juan is farmer. He has been doing this work since he was 8 years old, work he learned from his grandfather as his father left when he was born. He grows corn and yucca. He has to walk about 35 minutes to arrive where he works. He says that he wakes up at 4:30 to make the most of the morning; he works 6 hours and returns home early because he helps at the church. 

The loan would be invested in the cultivating of 10,500 square meters of corn and yucca and for the purchase of fertilizer, pesticide and seeds. His intention is to have 5 dairy cows, improve his house (replace the roof) and repay the loan and to keep the door open to future loans.

loans.use: to cultivate 10,500 square meters of corn and yucca and for the purchase of fertilizer, pesticide and seeds.

loans.name: Mahina

texts.ru:
Махина трудолюбивая и ответственная женщина в возрасте 33 лет. Она замужем и имеет троих детей. Махина со своей семьёй живёт в маленьком посёлке. Она очень любит своих детей и старается дать им всё необходимое для того, чтобы они могли расти, развиваться и реализовывать себя в обществе. Для этого Махина занимается своим бизнесом, чтобы иметь постоянный доход. Муж также работает вместе с ней, помогает ей реализовывать её бизнес. 

Махина занимается купля продажей детский одежды. Закупает она свой товар на большом оптовом рынке и продаёт на местном рынке своего посёлка. Для этого у неё имеется собственная лавка. Сейчас Махина желает расширить ассортимент своего товара, ей необходимо закупить побольше весенней и летней  одежды, так как начинается теплый сезон. Но у ней недостаточно денежных средств, чтобы сделать большой закуп. Поэтому она обратилась в Арванд и желает получить кредит на покупку одежды. Махина очень надеется на положительный результат и заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en:
Mahina is a hardworking and responsible 33-year-old woman. She is married and has three children. She lives with her family in a small village. She loves her children a lot and strives to give them all that they need in order to grow, develop and establish themselves in society. For this reason, Mahina runs her own business in order to have a stable income. Her husband also works with her, helping her to implement her business.

Mahina buys and sells children's clothes. She buys her merchandise at a large wholesale market and sells them at the local market in her village. She has her own shop for this. Now Mahina wants to expand her assortment of merchandise. She needs to buy more spring and summer clothing as the warm season is beginning. However, she does not have enough money to make such a large purchase. This is why she requested a loan from Arvand to buy clothes. Mahina really relies on a positive outcome and thanks Arvand in advance for their support.

loans.use: to buy children's clothes for retail sale.

loans.name: Pahke

texts.en: Pashke recently bought some second-hand inventory items to re-sell, yet she did not have the money at that moment; so, she is requesting a loan from Kiva lenders through VisionFund Albania. The inventory that she previously bought with the loan from lenders,was used for the same reason; however, buying-selling used clothes is just a small activity according to her, thus, she could not put money on the site to re-purchase inventory this time around.

loans.use: to purchase inventory of used clothes to re-sell.

loans.name: Reza

texts.ru:
Реза жизнерадостная и трудолюбивая женщина  в возрасте 55 лет. Она не замужем. Дети у нее уже взрослые и имеют своих семей, но Реза живет с ними вместе и помогает им в хозяйстве  и финансово. Она обращается в Арванд уже не впервые, за возможностью получить финансовую поддержку.  В предыдущем кредитовании она ни разу не нарушила условия кредитования и показала себя с хорошей стороны. Они живут в сельской местности. Она не имеет высшего образования, так как не было возможности учиться в Университете из-за финансовых трудностей в семье. Сыновья Резы также не имеют образования, но они трудятся на поле, выращивая различную сельхозпродукцию для пропитания, а когда не сезон, то едут в Россию на заработки.

Реза сама швея и зарабатывает на жизнь этим ремеслом. Она шьет национальные платья для женщин, курпача, подушки, а также платья для невест. От данного дела она получает хороший доход. Сейчас  она хочет увеличить количество товара для расширения своего бизнеса. Поэтому она обратилась в Арванд и хочет получить кредит на покупку материала. Реза очень надеется на положительный результат и заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en:
Reza is a cheerful and hardworking 55-year-old woman. She is not married. All of her children are grown-up and have their own families, but Reza lives together with them and helps them both around the house and financially. She is turning to Arvand, not for the first time, for the opportunity to receive financial assistance. When she was lent money previously, she never once broke the conditions of her loan and showed a good side of herself. They all live in the countryside. She does not have a higher education as she was unable to study at university due to financial difficulties in her family. Reza's sons also do not have higher educations but they work hard in the fields, growing different types of crops to make a living and when it is not the growing season, they work abroad in Russia.

Reza is a seamstress and earns a living from this trade. She sews ethnic Tajik women's dresses, comforters, pillows and wedding dresses. She receives a good income from this business. Now she wants to increase her amount of merchandise to expand her business. This is why she requested a loan from Arvand to buy materials. Reza really relies on a positive outcome and thanks Arvand in advance for the support.

loans.use: to buy  materials

loans.name: Yohanna Del Socorro

texts.es:
Es medio día y al pasar por la casa de Yohanna se desprende un olor exquisito a comida recién hecha, cada día sorprende a sus clientes con un nuevo sabor y aroma. Tiene 38 años de edad y tres hijos, por los que lucha para brindarle un futuro mejor, su educación es lo primordial. Desde hace diez años está en el negocio de la venta de comida, al comienzo fue difícil, pero con la ayuda de su compañero de vida han logrado a salir adelante.
Ella solicita el préstamo para la compra de productos básicos, tales como arroz, frijoles, verduras, carne de res y pollo, entre otros. Deposita su confianza en Kiva y MiCrédito, puesto que serán de mucha ayuda en el aumento su producción y clientela, brindándole de esta manera más ingresos. Es una mujer soñadora y emprendedora, en la lista de sus planes futuros está mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda y aumentar su capital de negocio.
texts.en:
It’s midday and passing by the house of Yohanna, an exquisite aroma comes from the recently made food. Each day she surprises her customers with a new flavor and aroma. She is 38 years old and has 3 children for whom she works hard to provide a better future. Their education is the most important thing to her. She has been in the business of selling food for ten years. At first it was difficult, but with her partner’s help, they have been able to get ahead. 

She is requesting the loan to buy basic products, such as rice, beans, vegetables, beef, and chicken, among others. She trusts that Kiva and MiCrédito will assist her, because they will be of much help in the growth of her production and clientele, which will provide her with additional income. She is a woman with dreams and is enterprising. On the list of her future plans are improving her house and increasing her working capital.

loans.use: to buy basic products, such as rice, beans, vegetables, beef, and chicken, among others.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for an efficient cooking gas package

loans.name: Maura

texts.en:
Maura, age 50, is a certified organic farmer of Maya Mountain Cacao. She lives in the beautiful village of Santa Cruz. She, together with her husband, manages their one acre of mature cacao trees. Maura raised her 11 children, three of whom are still living with her and her husband. 

Maura and her husband became inspired to plant cacao on their own with the assistance of their dad. They grew up in a farming family which assisted them in ways and methods of farming as both a source of income for the family and for household use. Maura stated that her husband spends most of the time planting different types of farm crops such as corn, beans, rice, and other ground foods. She enjoys harvesting and selling products to the market. Maura stated that cacao is a source of income for the family and it is also a permanent crop, which requires cleaning and general maintenance to be highly productive.

Maura is requesting this loan to hire workers to assist her husband in cleaning their cacao farm. Her husband is presently busy with the harvesting of corn and beans as it is the peak season.

In the future, Maura envisions having better living conditions, expanding more into farming, getting her children to work more on her farm, and, if some of her children so choose, providing them with an education, or, if not, she would love to see her sons become cacao farmers.

loans.use: To clean 500 acres of mature cacao trees

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es: El es Carlos, un joven trabajador y entusiasta. Trabaja en una pizzeria y es cantautor, su amor por la música lo impulsa a ser mejor cada día. El préstamo lo solicita para una operación y comprar medicamentos, de esta manera mejorara su calidad de vida. Es casado y tiene un hermoso bebe. Su familia y él hacen un gran equipo, sus logros son la estabilidad familiar y su mayor satisfacción trabajar en lo que mas le gusta: la música.
texts.en:
This is Carlos, a hardworking and enthusiatic young man. He works in a pizzeria and is a singer-songwriter. His love of music drives him to be better every day. The loan he is requesting is for an operation and to buy medicines. This will improve his quality of life.

Carlos is married and has a beautiful baby. He and his family make a great team. His accomplishments are family stability and his greatest satisfaction is working at what he likes the most: music.

loans.use: To have an operation and buy medicines

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To hire someone to clear underbrush and clean his one acre of cacao trees

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for a clean cooking package from Liquefied Petroleum Gas

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El cliente de 25 años de edad se dedica  a la venta de yinas (sandalias) desde hace varios años, vende de forma ambulante por las diferentes colonias que se encuentran cerca de su lugar de residencia, con las ganancias que obtiene ayuda en los gastos del hogar, vive en casa propia con su familia,  el cliente está solicitando un crédito para la compra de yinas por mayor y asi poder seguir con sus ventas ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo y poder darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: The 25 year-old borrower has worked selling sandals for several years. He is a street vendor throughout the various neighborhoods located near his place of residence. His earnings help with household expenses. He lives in his own home with his family. The borrower is requesting a loan to purchase sandals wholesale to be able to continue selling because this is his only source of work, and to be able to provide a better quality of life for his family.

loans.use: to purchase sandals wholesale.

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
Luzviminda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 17,000 Philippine Pesos through NWTF to buy additional items to sell, including soap, shampoo, spices, milk and coffee, for her general store business.

Luzviminda has been in this business for 10 years. She earns additional income from buying and selling coconut.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she is requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Luzviminda has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell including soap, shampoo, spices, milk and coffee

loans.name: Jennie

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Jennie works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell vegetable business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling fish, and a general store. Jennie is asking for a loan of 22,000 Philippine Pesos through NWTF to buy vegetables to sell in her food stall.

She has successfully paid back her previous 19 loans from NWTF, and is now asking for a new loan to further build her business.

Jennie has been sustaining her business activities with her past loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to sell in her food stall

loans.name: Manuel De Jesus

texts.es:
Todos los días, Manuel enciende a las 6 de la mañana su microbús amarillo para iniciar de nuevo con una jornada laboral, transportando niños a sus colegios. A sus 64 años, después de haber trabajado en un departamento de la Alcaldía, decidió invertir en un negocio que lo mantuviera activo profesionalmente, ya que a pesar de haber terminado en su anterior trabajo por la edad, el desea seguir creciendo. Es por esto que el tiempo sobrante lo invierte en la comercialización de la lotería.
Su único ingreso extra es la pensión de vejez, de manera que solicita un préstamo para reparar su microbús y darle el mejor mantenimiento cuando se necesite.  Sus expectativas son altas, pues sabe que esto le permitirá ofrecerles a sus clientes un mejor servicio. En sus planes está cambiar la unidad completa, sin embargo, por ahora priorizará la mejor inversión para el mantenimiento  y la reparación del vehículo.
texts.en:
Every day at 6 in the morning, Manuel starts his yellow minibus to begin his workday, transporting children to their schools. At 64, after having worked in a department of the municipality, he decided to invest in a business what would keep him active professionally, because despite having worked until the age of retirement, he wants to keep growing. He spends some of his extra time selling lottery tickets.

His only extra income is his old age pension, which is why he is requesting a loan to repair his minibus and give it good maintenance when necessary. He has high expectations, knowing that this will lead to offering his customers a better service. He plans to change the whole unit, but for now he will prioritize the maintenance and repair of the vehicle.

loans.use: to repair his minibus

loans.name: Nimfa

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Nimfa works hard to support her family.

She has a business buying and reselling fish in the Philippines and also earns additional income from buying and reselling rice. 

Nimfa is borrowing 20,000 PHP through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy additional fish to sell for her fish business.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. 

Nimfa hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional fish to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies in order to care for her coffee crops.

loans.name: Gulchehra

texts.ru:
Гулчехра ответственная и трудолюбивая женщина. Она замужем и имеет двоих детей. Живёт Гулчехра со своей семьёй в небольшом посёлке. Сама Гулчехра работает швеёй на фабрике. Этой профессии она научилась, закончив швейные курсы и получила сертификат.  Но зарплата на данной работе не достаточна для удовлетворения всех имеющихся нужд её семьи. 

Муж Гулчехры работает в местной мастерской. От этой работы он также получает небольшую зарплату. Поэтому муж долго искал возможность поехать на заработки за пределы Таджикистана, чтобы найти там хорошую работу, от которой он сможет получать достаточную зарплату и копить средства на будущее своих детей. И сейчас он нашёл подходящую работу в России и собирается туда поехать. Но у него не хватает денежных средств, чтобы приобрести билет. Поэтому Гулчехра хочет помочь своему мужу, и для этого она обратилась в Арванд и хочет получить кредит на покупку авиабилета для своего мужа. Она заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en:
Gulchehra is a responsible and hard-working woman. She is married and has two children. Gulchehra lives with her family in a small town. Gulchehra herself works as a seamstress in a factory. She learnt this profession by taking sewing courses, receiving a diploma. But her wages in this job are not enough to meet all her family's needs. 

Gulchehra's husband works in the local workshop. He also receives a small wage from this job. For that reason her husband has long been looking for an opportunity to go and earn money outside of Tajikistan, to find a good job in which he would be able to earn enough money and save the means to support his children's future. Now he has found a suitable job in Russia and plans to go there. But he does not have the financial means to purchase a ticket. For that reason Gulchehra wants to help her husband, so she turned to Arvand and hopes to receive a loan to buy a plane ticket for her husband. She thanks Arvand in advance for their support.

loans.use: to buy a plane ticket to help her husband move abroad for work

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: la clienta de 29 años de edad se dedica a la agricultura desde hace varios años siembra maiz y con las ventas que realiza de sus cosechas logra solventar los gastos que tiene en su hogar, es una mujer responsable, honesta y trabajadora,  vive con su familia en casa propia. la clienta está solicitando un crédito para poder comprar insumos para su cosecha como: fertilizantes, abonos, semillas, fertilizantes, etc.  ya que con lo que gana no le alcanza para cubrir esos gastos y así tener mejores ingresos y tener una mejor estabilidad económica junto con su familia.
texts.en:
The client, age 29, has been farming for several years.  She grows corn, and with the sales from her harvests she manages to cover her household expenses.  She is a very responsible, honest, and hard-working woman.  She lives with her family in her own house.

The client is requesting a loan in order to be able to buy supplies for her harvest.  She will buy things like fertilizers, compost, and seeds, etc.  What she earns is not enough to cover these expenses.  This way she will have better earnings and better financial stability with her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, compost, and seeds, etc.

loans.name: Sarita Colonia Group

texts.es: LA Sra. maritza de 22 años de edad soltera y con 1 hijo,tiene una pequeña bodega(alquilado)  hace unos  2  años. La Sra.  Maritza con la ayuda de su familia a sabido salir adelante tanto así que  ha llegado a fidelizar  a sus clientes   el cual le ha generado ganancias para poder cubrir los gastos de su hogar,  En el futuro le gustaría tener un local propio donde poder vender su productos (menestras, azúcar, leche,gaseosas etc ) . Con el préstamo otorgado lo invertirá en comprar más productos y asi seguir satisfaciendo las necesidades de sus clientes y así poder salir adelante. A la vez  la Sra. Maritza y todos los integrantes se encuentran  agradecidos con Kiva  por el préstamo otorgado  y por la confianza que se  les ha sido brindada. La Sra. Maritza  es la primera de la mano derecha se le distingue por su hijo que se encuentra a su lado,Se despide  Dejando la promesa  que cumplirá todas sus metas propuestas.
texts.en:
Maritza, age 22, is single and has one child.  She has had a small grocery store (rented) for two years.  With the help of her family, Maritza has known how to get ahead as well as making loyal customers.  This has generated earnings in order to be able to cover the household expenses. 

In the future she would like to have her own place where she would be able to sell her products (beans, sugar, milk, and soft drinks, etc).

She will use the loan to buy more products.  This way she will continue to satisfy the needs of her customers, and she will be able to get ahead.

Maritza and all of the members are grateful to Kiva for the loan that was granted and for the trust shown in them.  Maritza is the first one on the right.  She is the one with her child by her side.  She says good-by with the promise of fulfilling all of her proposed goals.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, and beans, etc.

loans.name: Mizhgona

texts.en:
Mizhgona was born in 1990. She is married and has two children. Her children are little yet. She tries to provide them with all necessary things. 

She is a sewer. She sews national women's clothes. She has been busy with this business more than six years. She serves her clients in a workshop which is located in the center of her village. Mizhgona sews clothes with high quality so she has regular customers. 

Mizhgona is going to repair her house as it is in bad condition. She is asking for a loan of 6,000 TJS to buy building materials such as cement, wood, soil, etc., for repairing the house. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy building materials such as cement, wood, soil, etc.,  for repairing her house

loans.name: Mary Beth

texts.en:
Mary Beth is married and has one child. She is a hard worker who runs a sari sari, or general store. She also makes money buying and selling rice.

Mary Beth has taken out and successfully repaid nine loans through NWTF. She is now applying for a 17,000 PHP loan to buy canned goods, snack foods, sugar, soap, salt, and shampoo to restock her sari sari. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain enough savings to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to restock her sari sari.

loans.name: Gloria Edith

texts.es: Gloria tiene 43 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su hijo de 15 años y su hija de 17 años de edad. Gloria tiene 15 años de ganarse la vida por medio de la venta de variedad de ropa y productos de primera necesidad. Es una mujer emprendedora y muy trabajadora quien hace todo lo que este en sus manos para ganarse la viada y dar  a sus hijos lo necesario. Gloria solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la construcción de un corredor y de una pila para lo cual necesita comprar materiales como: lámina, ladrillo, cemento, arena, etc.
texts.en: Gloria is 43 years old and lives at home with her 15-year-old son and 17-year-old daughter. She has been selling a variety of clothes and basic goods for 15 years. She is an enterprising and hardworking woman who does everything in her power to make a living and give her children what they need.
