Gloria is requesting a loan through FUSAI to buy materials such as sheet metal, brick, cement, sand, etc. to build a hallway and a basin.

loans.use: to buy sheet metal, brick, cement, sand, etc. to build a hallway and a basin.

loans.name: Sylvia

texts.en:
Sylvia is a hardworking mother blessed with four children. Both she and her husband grow vegetables to sell. They aim to improve their farm so they can cover their daily expenses and continue sending their children to school.

To further improve the farm Sylvia is asking for a 18,000 PHP loan through ASKI to buy the herbicides and fertilizer needed for their vegetable crops. Her ambition is to improve their business as well as their living status.

loans.use: to buy herbicides and fertilizer needed for their farm.

location.town: Brgy. Bone North, Aritao, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Oysara

texts.en: Oysara was born in 1961. She is married and has 2 children. Oysara works hard from early morning till late at night to earn a living. She is a seamstress.  Oysara sews national men’s cloth, ‘chapan’. She sews chapan in her house and has her regular clients. Oysara sews quickly so she attracts a lot of clients. Oysara has been busy with this business more than 15 years. Her skills and experience help her to manage her business successfully. Oysara is going to increase her working capital. She is asking for a loan of 2000 Somoni to buy fabrics to increase her working capital. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy fabrics to increase working capital

loans.name: Jean

texts.en:
Jean is a hardworking entrepreneur who trades in fish in the Philippines. She has been in the business for five years. She also earns money selling prepared food.

Through her own efforts and with the help of loans from NWTF, Jean’s business is doing well. She successfully paid back her previous loans and is now applying for a 12,000 PHP loan to buy additional boxes of fish to sell. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Nigora

texts.en:
Nigora was born in year 1980. She is a hardworking woman. Nigora is married and has three children. She began her own business with animal husbandry three months ago. Nigora feeds cows. She sells cattle at a local market. Little by little, she improves her living condition. 

Now, she is going to develop her new business. She will repair her house from the profit. She is asking for a loan of 3,000 Somoni (TJS) to buy cattle for increasing the working capital of her new business. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy cattle for increasing working capital of the new business.

loans.name: Melca

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Melca works hard to support her family. She trades in fish and earns additional money raising and selling pigs.

Melca has borrowed and successfully paid back nineteen loans through NWTF. She is now applying for a 14,000 PHP loan to buy more fish to sell. She feels that through her hard work and these loans she will be able to further expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is married and works hard to support her family. For the past 31 years she has sold vegetables to earn a living and bought and sold peanuts as well.

Juliet has taken out and successfully repaid a previous loan through NWTF. She is now applying for a 40,000 PHP loan to buy more vegetables to sell in her market stall. She is working hard to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell in her market stall

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 51 years old, married and has two children. She has been farming vegetables for three years now.

Josephine has taken out and successfully repaid twenty loans through NWTF. She is now applying for a 29,500 PHP loan to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies to continue improving her farm. Her goal is to save enough money to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Bisharifa

texts.ru:
Бишарифа из города Исфары занимается изготовлением веревок на продажу. Она мастерица в этом деле. Пять лет назад Бишарифа открыла свой маленький бизнес в сфере производства веревок, который по сей день продолжает. Ей в деле помогает старшая дочь. Она тоже научилась у матери ее ремеслу.
Бибишарифа замужем и у нее двое прелестных дочерей. Ее муж работает продавцом на рынке. Бибишарифа дома плетет веревки и затем выводит на рынок на продажу. На сумму кредита она хочет купить шерстяные нитки для производства веревок. Она нуждается в кредите.
texts.en:
Bisharifa is from the city of Isfara and earns a living making and selling ropes. She is an expert craftsperson in this area. Five years ago Bisharifa opened her small rope-making business, which continues to this day. Her oldest daughter, who learned the trade from her mother, helps her with the work.

Bisharifa is married and has two lovely daughters. Her husband works as a salesperson at the market. Bisharifa braids the ropes at home and then brings them to the market to sell. With the loan amount she wants to buy woollen yarn to make ropes. She needs this loan.

loans.use: to buy woollen yarn to make rope for sale

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en: Milagros is 39 and married to a farmer. They were gifted with four children, and they live happily in a rural community. Due to financial hardships, Milagros engages in a hog-raising business to help her husband in generating income. She aims to strengthen this business, but she has limited capital. For this reason, she would like to avail a loan amount of PHP 18,000 to buy additional piglets, vitamins, feeds, and materials needed to improve the pigpen. Through this financial assistance, she believes that she will be able to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets, vitamins, feeds and materials needed to improve the pigpen.

loans.name: Sokchea's Group

texts.en:
Sokchea, 41 and a mother of six kids, is a resident from Kampong Cham province, where cassava is the popular cash-crop in the area among her neighborhood as well as for her. 

Besides cassava, she also grows rice to supplement her income. Nowadays, she can earn up to 35,600 KHR per day. This is the fifth loan for Sokchea and the sixth loan for her joint borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). The past loans, which she has fully repaid back, have enabled her to uplift her lifestyle better than before. 

Now, she and her joint borrower are seeking the same loan amount of 1,000,000 KHR each. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to pay for plowing fees, buy rice seeds, and pay for labor costs. She highly hopes that she can gain triple income from her agribusiness.

loans.use: to pay for plowing fees and labor costs, and to buy rice seeds.

loans.name: Sovann's Group

texts.en:
Sovann is 48 years old and married. She is one of the breadwinners in a family consisting of nine kids; three of whom are in school. To cover the daily cost of living, she does rice cropping on two hectares of farmland and works for others for extra income. She has occupied this business for two years. 

Sovann is not the first-time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). The past loans, which she has repaid back completely, have enabled her to improve her lifestyle better than before. For this cycle, she is seeking 1,000,000 KHR, while her joint borrower is applying for 500,000 KHR. 

As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer and rice seeds for her crop. She highly believes that she can gain a good income from her cash-crop, better than before.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and rice seeds for her crop.

loans.name: Semia

texts.en:
Semia is 58 years old and widowed. She lives in a rural community with one of her children. She is engaged in planting vegetables and root crops for sale. She aims to expand her plantation and increase her production in order to sustain their daily living and save some for future emergencies. 

Due to capital insufficiency, she would like to avail a loan of PHP 13,000 to buy fertilizers and herbicides needed in her farming business. Being an industrious mother, she believes that she will be able to improve her farming business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and herbicides needed in her farming business.

location.town: Brgy. Bone North, Aritao, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy plantain seed stock, fertilizer, tools and pay labor for a plantain project

loans.name: Paz

texts.en:
Paz is 49, married and blessed with four children. They are currently residing in a  rural community and make their living through farming. Due to financial hardships, Paz aims to engage in the hog-raising business to have an additional source of income. She has been in this business  but she didn't pursue it due to capital insufficiency. 

To continue this business, she is asking for a loan of PHP13,000 to buy feed, vitamins and piglets to raise. She hopes that her loan request will be granted so she can continue and improve the business.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins and piglets to raise

loans.name: Sopheak's Group

texts.en:
Originally from Kampong Cham province, Sopheak is 28 years old and a married mother of four kids. To struggle for a living, she plants cassava on one hectare of farmland as her main source of income and works for others for a fee to supplement her income.  

This is the first microloan for Sopheak’s group consisting of four borrowers with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). They are requesting the same loan amount of 300,000 KHR each. Sopheap, who is the leader, will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer and herbicide. She hopes that she can gain more yield from her crops and do better than before.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and herbicide

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase groceries such as rice, sugar, vegetables, and similar items.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase a solar home system that will take the place of alternative sources of lighting

loans.name: David Alejandro

texts.es:
David de 32 años de edad, estudio hasta noveno grado de educación básica, es casado y tiene dos hijos menores de edad que aún no estudian, su esposa se dedica  a los oficios domésticos, él es ganadero y también agricultor y comerciante, desde hace siete años se dedica al comercio de ganado, la agricultura casi siempre, el comercio de ganando es algo que aprendió con un padrino, pero se dedica  a las dos actividades, porque son ingresos extra, en época agrícola, siembra 14,000 metros cuadrados de sandía y después maíz.

El préstamo que está solicitando a CREDICAMPO,  es para comprar abono y pesticidas para sembrar sandía, pues los ingresos del comercio de ganado le ayudan a llevar el alimento a su familia.

Él sueña con que un día su hijo sea abogado y su hija secretaria pero también dice respetar la decisión de ellos, cuando sean grandes ya que nadie puede obligar a alguien a hacer lo que no quiere o no le gusta.
texts.en:
David, 32, has a 9th grade education.  He is married and has 2 minor children who are not yet in school.  His wife does the household chores and he works as a farmer, livestock trader, and merchant.  He has been in the livestock business for 7 years, and has just about always farmed.  He learned to deal in livestock from his godfather.   He works in both activities because it gives him extra income.  During the farming season he first cultivates 14,000 square meters with watermelons, and then later he grows corn.

David is requesting this loan from CREDICAMPO to buy organic and chemical fertilizers to cultivate watermelons.  With this activity and his livestock business he is able to feed his family.

David dreams that one day his son will become a lawyer and his daughter a secretary, but he also says that he will respect their decisions when they are grown, as no one should compel another to do a job that he or she does not like.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers to grow watermelons

loans.name: Siris Emileydys

texts.es:
Siris de 26 años de edad, madres solteras con dos hijos menores de edad, es originario de Achuapa, lugar que está ubicado en la zona norte de la región. Se caracteriza por ser trabajadora, responsable, con ganas de superación personal. Lamentablemente por falta de recursos económico no pudo cursar una carrera y se vio obligada a trabajar desde temprana edad. En la actualidad lucha, día a día para brindarle un futuro mejor a sus hijos.
Gracias a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante tiene por actividad económica la una pulpería es una pequeña tienda que vende productos comestibles como: arroz, frijoles, azúcar, leche, pan, huevos, jugos, gaseosas. Ella dedica a su negocio unas doce horas diarias ofreciendo su producto. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de productos comestibles, para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. Siris agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan  a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Siris is a 26-year-old single mother with two young children. She is originally from Achuapa, a place that is located in the northern part of the region. Siris is known for being hardworking, responsible, and having the drive to succeed on a personal level. Unfortunately, due to the lack of financial resources, she was not able to pursue a degree and was obligated to work at a young age. At the moment, she strives each day to provide a better future for her children.

Thanks to her efforts and her desire to move forward, Siris was able to open a small store where she sells food products such as rice, beans, sugar, milk, eggs, bread, juices, and sodas. She devotes approximately 12 hours to her business each day by offering her products. The purpose of this loan is to invest it as operating capital so that she can restock her business of buying and selling food products. In the near future, she would like to generate more income.

Siris appreciates the assistance that Kiva lenders provide to people who have limited resources and come from poor countries, such as Nicaragua, so that they can earn a decent living.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, sugar, milk, eggs, bread, juices, and sodas.

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en: Carmelita owns and operates a farm to make a living. For many years, they have earned well for the family's living. She always wants to provide her family a better living. Recently, she took a new loan from GDMPC micro credit to pay placement fees of her child for working abroad. In the future, she wants to have a better living with her family.

loans.use: to pay placement fees of her son.

loans.name: Milagro

texts.es: Milagro de 47  años de edad se dedica  a la venta de yinas (sandalias) desde hace 3  años, su negocio lo tiene ubicado en el mercado que se encuentran cerca de su lugar de residencia, con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, vive en casa alquilada con su grupo familiar conformado  por ella y sus dos hijos,  Milagro está solicitando un crédito para la compra de yinas por mayor y asi poder seguir con sus ventas ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo y poder darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida sin limitación alguna.
texts.en:
Milagro, 47, has made a living selling flip-flop sandals for three years.  Her business is located in the market near her house.  She's able to pay for some of her household expenses with her profits.  She lives in a rental house with her family, comprised of herself and her two children.

Milagro's requesting a loan to buy flip flops wholesale so she can keep on making sales and give her family a better quality of life without any limitations.

This is her only source of work.

loans.use: to buy flip-flop sandals wholesale

loans.name: Nilufar

texts.en: Nilufar is a smart woman. She is single and 23 years old. She has worked in a Court of her region for more than two years. Also, she studies in the University in absentia. She works and studies well. Nilufar lives with her parents. Her parents have no means to pay for her tuition. Nilufar decided to ask for a loan to pay for tuition. She will make payments from her salary. Nilufar is asking for a loan of 1,000 USD to pay for tuition. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to pay for tuition.

loans.name: Geraline

texts.en:
Geraline is 31 years old and married with two children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell, like chips, milk, sugar, eggs, noodles, etc.

Geraline has borrowed and paid eight loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from buying and selling ready-to-wear, and rice retailing.

She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell, like chips, milk, sugar, eggs, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Cathy

texts.en:
Cathy works hard to support her family. Cathy is single and has a dry goods business in the Philippines.

Cathy requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more dry goods to sell.

She has been in this business for four years.

In the future, Cathy would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more dry goods to sell.

loans.name: Merilyn

texts.en:
Merilyn works hard to support her family. Merilyn is married and has a dried fish business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to purchase fish to make dried fish.

Merilyn has been in this business for five years now. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase fish to make dried fish.

loans.name: Jinky

texts.en: Jinky is 33 years old and married with two children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 24,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell. Jinky has been in this business for six years, and has previously received funds through Kiva.  She aspires to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Iris

texts.es: Irsis tiene 29 años de edad y habita en un municipio muy cercano a la ciudad de Cartagena con sus dos hijos en las edades de 12 y 13 años. Su idea de negocio nació para apoyar los ingresos de  su familia al mismo tiempo que dirigir la administración del hogar y estar mas cerca a sus hijos. Con sus refrescos como gaseosas, dulces y jugos naturales, Iris es conocida en el sector por sus vecinos y gana dinero para aumentar su bienestar. Sus ventas las realiza de contado desde muy temprano hasta el final de la tarde. Su meta es incrmentar sus ventas teniendo mas inventarios que ofrecer, por eso se ha acercado a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará gaseosas, frutas y dulces para incrmentar sus inventarios y la posibilidad de impactar suis ventas con los mas deliciosos jugos naturales a base de las frutas tropicales de la region, mango, zapote, nispero, naranja, patilla, papaya etc,haciendo asi de el credikiva otorgado, su mejor inversión.
texts.en:
Iris is 29 years old and resides with her two children, ages 12 and 13, in a town that is near the city of Cartagena. Her idea for a business came about because she needed to generate income for her family, but at the same time she wanted an enterprise that she could manage at home so that she could be near her children. She decided to sell refreshments such as sodas, candies, and natural juices.

Iris is known among her neighbors in the area and is able to earn money to improve her well-being. She conducts cash-based sales from the early morning hours to the late afternoon. Her goal is to increase her sales by having more inventory to offer, so she approached Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. Iris will buy sodas, fruits, and candy so that she can increase her inventory. Her purchase will include tropical fruits of the region such as mangos, sapota fruit, loquats, oranges, watermelons, papayas, and other produce so that she can make delicious natural juices that could impact her sales. The Kiva loan that will be granted to her should turn out to be a good investment.

loans.use: to buy buy sodas, fruits, and candy.

loans.name: Myagmardorj

texts.en: Mr. Myagmardorj, 30 years old, lives with his wife and two daughters in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. His family lives in a traditional Mongolian  ger (portable felt dwelling). He has been providing taxi services to the local people since 2012. Besides taxi services, he also sells clothes at a trade center. His wife is an organizer at the trade center. He is requesting a loan of 4,000,000 MNT to buy a large amount of clothes from China so that he can continue to sell clothes without worrying about inventory shortages. He says that income from clothing sales is helping his family greatly.

loans.use: to buy a large amount of clothes

loans.name: Sayriniso

texts.en: Sayriniso is married and has a child. She has always wanted to provide him with a good education. She decided to start new business selling toys in order to generate an income so she can contribute to her home’s finances. She studied at the course, ‘To Get Ahead,’ from a women’s organization, and acquired skills about business. She will manage the business alone. She will be a very successful businesswoman, as she is hardworking and smart. She is asking for a loan of 5,000 TJS to buy toys for organizing her new business. She will sell the toys in a local market. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy toys for organizing her new business.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en: Being a responsible mother, Rowena is involved in a hog-raising business to supplement her husband's income. She is 38 and has three schoolchildren. Due to the high cost of school fees, she needs to increase her income to support her children's education and satisfy their daily necessities. With this regard, she wants to acquire more piglets to raise. Having inadequate capital, she would like to avail of a loan of PHP30,000.00 to buy additional piglets, hog feeds and vitamins needed in hog-raising. Being a kind and hardworking mother, she believes that she will be able to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets, hog feeds and vitamins needed in hog-raising.

loans.name: Charish

texts.en:
Charish and her husband are currently residing in a rural community. They aim to become financially stable in order to educate their three children and give them a better life. They work together in their farm land planting and harvesting vegetables for sale. 

They plan to expand their plantation to ensure a high production. Due to insufficient capital, Charish is asking for a loan of PHP19,000.00 to buy fertilizer and insecticides needed in planting vegetables. She believes that this financial assistance will enable them to improve their farming business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and insecticides needed in planting vegetables

loans.name: Noimelyn

texts.en: Noimelyn is a 33-year-old mother and has been gifted with two children. She and her husband aim to uplift their living conditions to give their children a better life. They help each other in cultivating their farmland, in order to earn sufficient income. They planned to expand their vegetable plantation but they don't have enough capital. For this reason, Noimelyn is asking for a loan of 20,000 PHP to buy certified seeds, fertilizer, and herbicides needed in vegetable production. Through this loan, they believe that they will be able to improve and expand their farming business.

loans.use: to buy certified seeds, fertilizer, and herbicides needed in vegetable production

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida is 52 years old and married with one child.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell, like soap, canned goods, spices, etc.

Zenaida has borrowed and paid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from buying and selling fish.

She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, like soap, canned goods, spices, etc.

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.en:
Magdalena is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a restaurant business in the Philippines.  She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF in order to buy additional utensils and ingredients for her restaurant.

Magdalena successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.  NWTF is re-listing Magdalena's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional utensils and ingredients for her restaurant.

loans.name: Aurelia

texts.en:
As a widowed mother of seven children, Aurelia works hard to support her family.

She has a blacksmith business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from charcoal retailing.  Aurelia is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF in order to buy materials needed for her blacksmith business.

Aurelia has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for her blacksmith business.

loans.name: Thavy's Group

texts.en: A local farmer from Battambang province’s Moung Russey district, Thavy is 52 years old and a married mother of six children. Her entire household solely counts on rice cropping as the single source of income to support her big family. With VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), Thavy is an eighth-time borrower and her joint borrower is a seventh-time borrower with successful repayment of past loans. Thavy’s living conditions are improving. Thavy is a group leader for this loan cycle. She is seeking 1,200,000 KHR and her joint borrower is also applying for the same loan amount. As for Thavy, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy potash and to pay for plowing and reaping fees. She highly believes that she can gain more yield than before.

loans.use: to buy potash as well as to pay for plowing and reaping fees

loans.name: Dilshodoy

texts.en:
Dilshodoy is a woman who has a kind heart. She lives with her husband and three children in the north part of Tajikistan. 

Dilshodoy 15 years ago began her own business with growing potatoes. She has a great experience in this field. Dilshodoy is the main provider for her family as her husband has a small income. She works hard and always tries to develop business. 

She is going to make a new sowing of potatoes but she has no money to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers. She is asking for a loan of 7,000 TJS to buy seeds and mineral fertilizer. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy seeds and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa is 45 years old and married with six children, four of whom are in school.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested an 11,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase stock to sell, such as canned goods, sugar, soap, snack foods, and other groceries.

Elsa has borrowed and paid back seven loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from buying and selling fish as well as farming rice.

She successfully paid back her previous loans and now requests a new loan to further build her business.

Elsa aspires to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase stock to sell, such as canned goods, sugar, soap, snack foods, and other groceries

loans.name: Carmela

texts.en:
Carmela is 34 years old and married with three children.

Carmela works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 9500 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Carmela has borrowed and paid back three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from E-loading (mobile prepaid load) and a bakery.

Carmela aspires to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is 58 years old and married with three children. She is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

She has been raising pigs for twenty-six years now, and has borrowed seventeen times in the past from NWTF and more recently, from Kiva to sustain it. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Ma. Cristina

texts.en:
Ma. Cristina is 28 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by pig fattening in the Philippines. Ma. Cristina is borrowing 15,000 PHP through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Ma. Cristina has been pig fattening for 10 years and also earns additional income from buying and selling rice.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca works hard to support her family. She is single and has a general store business in the Philippines. Rebecca has been in this business for eight years now, and also earns additional income from food vending.

She requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell in her store. In the future, Rebecca would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her store.

loans.name: Farzana

texts.en:
Farzana is a 31-year-old vigorous married woman. She is a mother of three children. She has had a business of hand-embroidery for the past three years. She is zealous about her work, and client demand is strong, but business challenges, combined with family expenditures, frustrate her nearly every day.

Farzana’s embroidery patterns are very popular on her street and she is the best earning resource in her household. She wants to grow her business so she requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to buy raw materials such as thread, sequins and pearls in large quantities to meet the increasing demand. She is in her third loan cycle with good credit history.

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as thread, sequins and pearls in large quantities.

loans.name: Hing's Group

texts.en: Hing is 61 years old and a widowed mother blessed with five kids. Her main source of income solely counts on her paid-working. Hing has borrowed three times with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), with a successful repayment of her past loans, which have enabled her to uplift her lifestyle better than before. Now, she has teamed with a group of two to get a new loan. As a group leader, she will spend her entire loan portion on renovating her house. She strongly believes that she will fix her house quickly so that she does not have to worry much during the upcoming raining season.

loans.use: to renovate her house.

loans.name: Bagum

texts.en:
Bagum is a 42-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store with her husband at the corner of her house. Her husband assists her by purchasing stocks of goods from the market as he has maintained many contacts over the years. 

She is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing, and health. She wants to grow her business so she requested a loan of PKR 50,000 to buy packs of salts, biscuits, and beverages to meet with the increasing demand at her store. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy packs of salts, biscuits, and beverages.

loans.name: Thab's Group

texts.en: Residing in Moung Russey district of Battambang province, Thab is 50 years old and has seven children.  Two schoolchildren still rely on her. To struggle for a living, she does rice farming and works for others for a fee. She has been in this business for more than 20 years. Now, her living condition is getting better, as a result from the positive impact of her past loans, which she has paid back completely.  For this cycle, Thab is a leader of her group consisting of two borrowers with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). Thab, will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer, rice seed, and insecticide for her crop. She hopes that this purchase will boost her crop output better than before.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, rice seed, and insecticide for her crop.

loans.name: Shahida

texts.en:
Shahida is a vigorous married lady; she has been stitching clothes for many years. She stitches for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. 

However, due to lack of availability of funds she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. For this reason, she requested a loan of 45,000 PKR from Kashf Foundation. 

She intends to use this loan amount to buy more spools of thread in different colors with the packs of laces, zippers, and buttons to create a means of increasing revenues so she may able to generate a healthier source of income. She is in her fifth loan cycle with good credit history.

loans.use: to buy more spools of thread in different colors with  packages of laces, zippers, and buttons.

loans.name: Nazran

texts.en: Nazran is a 45-year-old, married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store in her community for many years. She offers various goods for daily use. She has good communication skills and counts on a good client list. Her husband is employed in a small factory and earns insufficient income to support his family alone. She is a mother of seven children. She is motivated to provide for her family. As she wants to grow her business, she requested a loan of 45,000 PKR to buy stocks of rice, sugar and flour from the market at lower rates. She then would be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. She is in her 5th loan cycle and has shown excellent repayment behavior. She wishes to utilize part of her revenues to deal with personal expenses and to increase business capital.

loans.use: to buy stocks of rice, sugar and flour .

loans.name: Zeenat

texts.en: Zeenat, age 26, is a married woman. She has four children. She has been running a business selling animals for a period of about six years. She buys animals (baby goats & calves) at low prices, brings them up and then sells them out in the market for higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute to the family income. She needs to improve her business to bear her household expenses. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied a loan of PKR 40,000 to purchase more animals. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level. She is in her 3rd loan cycle and has shown good repayment behavior

loans.use: to purchase more animals.

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en: Shamim is a 32-year-old, married woman. She is the loving mother of four children. She enjoys her business weaving rugs and shawls. Shamim has in-depth knowledge of high quality weaving and earns a good amount of income to contribute in the family income.  She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf foundation. Currently she is in her 7th loan cycle and applied for a loan of PKR 40,000. This will help her to purchase more spools of thread, wool in different colors, with some packs of needles and cutters. She is hopeful to increase her sales, which ultimately will help in generating more cash.

loans.use: to purchase more spools of thread, wool in different colors, and some packs of needles and cutters.

loans.name: Sughran

texts.en: Sughran, age 38, is a married woman with four children. She enjoys doing hand embroidery. She started doing this work with her daughters. Her embroidery patterns are very popular in her territory. Her husband is not in a good physical shape to support her family. She is motivated to provide her family with the basic necessities of life including food, clothes and education. In order to meet the growing demands for her embroidery, she needs to buy more frames, needles and threads of different colors. For this reason she applied a loan of 45,000 PKR; it’s her 6th loan cycle.  She expects a boost in her earnings, and dreams of expanding her business in the near future.

loans.use: to buy more frames, needles and threads of different colors.

loans.name: Nutifafa  Apape Group

texts.fr:
Présidente du groupe NTIFAFA, commerçante et ménagère, Aya Biawova est une femme âgée de 33 ans vivant dans le quartier d’Adidogomé à Lomé capitale du Togo ou elle vit en couple avec ses 2 enfants et exerce depuis 2009 son petit commerce qu’elle a commencé avec le soutien de son mari. Accueillante, Aya Biawova est presque la seule commerçante de charbon de bois de son quartier, ce qui l’amène à solliciter un prêt qui lui servira d’acheter 8 sacs dans le but de répondre aux besoins de sa clientèle mais aussi sa lui permettra de réduire sa fréquence d’approvisionnement à une fois le mois au lieu de deux.
Les membres du groupe sont essentiellement composés de femmes revendeuses des produits de beauté, les produits végétales, de la farine de blé, les habits de la friperie, des céréales et produits alimentaires, les ustensiles de cuisine et les protéines, …; Elles  sollicitent un crédit pour renforcer leur activité.
texts.en:
The president of the group NTIFAFA, as well as a merchant and housewife, Aya Biawova is a 33-year-old woman living with her two children in the Adidogomé district in Lomé, the capital of Togo, where she lives as a couple. Since 2009, she has been operating her small business she started with her husband’s help. An accommodating person, Aya Biawova is nearly the only charcoal merchant in her area, so she is requesting a loan for purchasing 8 sacks [of charcoal] with the goal of responding to customer needs and also enabling her to reduce how often she stocks up on supplies to once a month, instead of twice. 

The group members are essentially composed of women vendors of beauty products, vegetables, wheat flour, secondhand clothing, grains, grocery items, kitchen utensils, proteins,…;   The group members are requesting a loan to bolster their businesses.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal and some vegetables

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La clienta de 28 años de edad habita en casa de un familiar con su tía y su suegro, su esposo se encuentra en estados unidos,  la clienta  es una mujer emprendedora y luchadora. Hace 2 años se decidió en poner un pequeño negocio en cual consiste en una pequeña tienda que con gran esfuerzo y dedicación ha logrado mantener a lo largo de varios años. Cuenta con mucha clientela ya que para ella lo más importante son los clientes, siempre los atiende con una sonrisa y mucha amabilidad, razón por la cual se ha ganado la confianza de muchos en la zona y a demás porque siempre tiene lo que los clientes buscan. El negocio está ubicado en su lugar de residencia. Ha decidido invertir en su negocio en la compra de más artículos. Es por esta razón que se motivo en solicitar este crédito a INTEGRLAL para poder invertir en su tiendita y abastecerla con todo tipo de productos como: arroz, frijoles, azúcar, leche, café, golosinas, aceite, papel, detergente, y de más productos atractivos para los clientes. Confía que de esta manera logrará cumplir su sueño de mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en: This borrower is 28 years old. She lives in the house of a relative with her aunt and her father-in-law. Her husband is in the United States. She is an entrepreneurial and hard-working woman. Two years ago she decided to set up a small business, which consists of a little store that, with great effort and dedication, she has managed to maintain for a number of years. She has many customers, since for her the most important thing is her customers. She always serves them with a smile and great friendliness, and for this reason she has won the confidence of many people in the zone and also because she always has what the customers are looking for. The business is located in her place of residence. She has decided to invest in her business by buying more articles to sell. It is for this reason that she was motivated to apply to Integral for this loan, to be able to invest in her little store and stock it with all types of products such as rice, beans, sugar, milk, coffee, candies, oil, paper, detergent, and other products that are attractive to her customers. She is confident that in this way she will manage to accomplish her dream of improving her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, sugar, milk, coffee, candies, oil, paper, detergent, and other products for her store

loans.name: Simity's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe est crée depuis le 20 Décembre 2012, est constitué de 26 membres qui sont tous de la même localité. leur activité principale est le commerce.

Fanta qui se trouve debout a l’extrême droite de la photo et levant le bras, est âgée de 42 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 04 enfants dont 02 garçons et 02 filles. Elle évolue dans le commerce de tissus, d'anions et elle est boutiquière aussi.

Avec son financement, elle compte acheter 03 caisses de boissons à 4000f l'une,les 55000 seront investis dans les serviettes hygiéniques et le reste pour ces dépenses personnelles. 

Les objectifs visés pour son bénéfice sont de subvenir aux besoins de ces enfants,payer leurs études et renforcer son épargne.
texts.en:
This group, created on December 20, 2012, is composed of 26 members who are all from the same town. Their main work involves commerce. 

Fanta, who is standing at the far right in the photo, is 42 years old, married, and a mother of four children (2 boys and 2 girls). She does commerce in fabrics and onions, and she is a shopkeeper too.

With her financing, she intends to purchase 3 cases of beverages at 4,000 francs each, while 55,000 francs will be invested in sanitary napkins, and the rest, for personal expenses. 

The profits will be used for the purposes of meeting the needs of her children, paying for their schooling, and bolstering her savings.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise, such as beverages, cloth, and other shop goods.

loans.name: Vilma Emerita

texts.es: Vilma de 58 años de edad habita en casa de su propiedad junto con su esposo y sus hijos, ella se dedica a la confección y venta de prendas de vestir. El negocio está ubicado en su casa de habitación. Vilma es una mujer es muy trabajadora y responsable, además, muchas personas dan buenas referencias de su persona y de su trabajo. Elabora variedad de prendas de vestir  a precios muy accesibles. También ofrece calidad en su trabajo, razón por la cual muchas personas la prefieren. Tiene muchos años de dedicarse a esta actividad por lo que ya cuenta con mucha experiencia y sobre todo con clientes fijos que cada día la prefieren más. Ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL para  invertir en su pequeño negocio en la compra de los insumos necesarios (telas, hilos, elástico, etc.) para la elaboración de variedad de prendas de vestir. Todo esto lo hace con el fin de dar un mejor servicio a los clientes de tal forma que los clientes se sientan motivados a seguir solicitando sus servicios y así sus ventas e ingresos se vean incrementados. Espera lograr su objetivo y mejorar su calidad de vida
texts.en:
Vilma is 58 years old and lives in her own house with her husband and children. She makes and sells clothing. Her business is located in her house. Vilma is a responsible and hard-working and many people speak well of her and of her work. She makes a variety of clothing at accessible prices. She also provides quality in her work so many people prefer her. She has done this business for many years so she has lots of experience. She has a large clientele that continues to increase.

Vilma has decided to request a loan from INTEGRAL to invest in her small business buying necessary supplies like fabric, thread, elastic, etc. Then she can male a variety of clothes. She is doing this with the aim of providing good service for her clients so that her clients remain inclined to request her services. So she should see her sales and income grow. She hopes to achieve her objective and enjoy a higher quality of living.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, elastic, etc.

loans.name: Sartasiñani Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “SARTASIÑANI” iniciará el noveno ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Villa Exaltación, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Mery es la Secretaria. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de frutas, taller de costura, taller de pintura, venta de ropa de bebe, costura de faldas y busos.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Mery es integrante, ella indica que hace tres años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de lencería; da a conocer que este negocio lo inicio hace varios años al observar el buen comercio que tienen estos productos decide emprenderlo en las ferias de la Ciudad de El Alto.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de lencería por mayor) que adquirirá en las tiendas de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener a su familia ya que ella vive en concubinato y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el servicio de salud que le ofrecen en la institución.

En al aimagen se encuentra una señora de sonbrero azul que acompaña al grupo, ella es hermana de una de las socias
texts.en:
The communal bank “Sartasiñani” will begin its ninth cycle in Pro Mujer, as part of the Villa Exaltación Focal Center. It is composed of eight members, and it is directed by a board of directors of which Señora Mery is Secretary.  The businesses in which the members of the communal bank are engaged are varied; among them are: selling fruit, a sewing workshop, a paint shop, selling baby clothes, and sewing skirts and sweat suits. 

The loan that they are taking will benefit the little women micro entrepreneurs of whom Mery is a member. She says that she joined Pro Mujer three years ago at the invitation of a friend who is a member of the institution. She sells lingerie, and she says that she started this business several years ago upon observing how well these products sell, deciding to undertake it at the fairs in the city of El Alto.

The purpose of her loan is to increase her capital with the purchase of wholesale lingerie, which she will buy in the stores in the city of El Alto and sell later in her retail space. This work allows her to generate resources for supporting her family, as she lives with her partner and has two children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says that she likes the health services that the institution offers.  In the image there is a lady wearing a blue hat. She is the sister of one of the group members.

loans.use: to purchase wholesale lingerie.

loans.name: Miguel Ángel

texts.es:
Miguel se gana la vida trabajando independiente en su negocio de abarrotes, en el cual ofrece diversos productos de la canasta familiar, helados, bebidas y frituras, además de esto, trabaja como agricultor en compañía de sus hermanos. La gran ventaja que posee es que es el único negocio de ese tipo que hay en el sector donde vive, por eso posee unos clientes establecidos.
Miguel desea aumentar sus ventas, por lo que requiere un crédito para surtir su negocio de productos que sus clientes necesitan pero que en estos momentos él no posee, sabe que la base de su negocio son sus clientes y desea ofrecerles los mejores y más variados productos.
Su mayor sueño es poder progresar con su negocio y tener un ingreso adicional cultivando hortensias, así podrá dejarles un legado a sus dos hijos que son un apoyo incondicional en todo momento.
texts.en:
Miguel earns a living working independently in his grocery business, in which he offers various products for the family food basket: ice creams, beverages, and fried foods. In addition to this, he works as a farmer along with his brothers. The great advantage that he has is that this is the only business of this type in the sector where he lives. For this reason, he has an established clientele.

Miguel wants to increase his sales, for which he needs a loan to stock his business with products that his customers need but that at this moment he doesn't have. He knows that the base of his business is the customers, and he wants to offer them the best and most varied products.

His greatest dream is to be able to make progress with his business and to have an additional income growing hydrangeas. Thus he will be able to leave a legacy to his two children, who are an unconditional support at every moment.

loans.use: to stock his business with products that his customers need but that he does not have at the moment.

loans.name: Azra

texts.en: Azra is 39-year-old married woman, and mother of four children. The man shown in the photo is Azra’s husband who is a driver by profession and provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family’s expenses, but now it requires proper maintenance to keep it in its functional routine. For this reason, Azra has applied for a loan of 50,000 PKR, for her husband. He wants to buy new tires with some tools for his vehicle. This will help him drive more smoothly, and provide better transport services to his passengers. Azra is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband, and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to buy new tires with some tools for her husband's vehicle.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en: Amina is 52 years old and works from home as a tailor. She has been in this line of work for eight years now and is proud to be contributing to her household income. When Amina was not earning her family was going through a severe financial crisis that compelled her to use her stitching skills in a productive manner. Her husband was the sole breadwinner of the family so Amina felt it obligatory to change her family’s living standards and she started working from home. Her hard work helped her establish a good clientele but she is having difficulty in fulfilling large orders. She has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR. In this way she will be able to purchase spools of threads, packs of buttons and laces in different colors. She is in her third loan cycle with good credit history.

loans.use: to purchase spools of threads, packs of buttons and laces in different colors.

loans.name: Uuganbaatar

texts.en: Mr.Uuganbaatar is 27 years old, and lives with his wife and a son in their Ger, a traditional nomadic yurt, in Arhangai province, Mongolia. Uuganbaatar started his family business with his wife in 2008, renting a rental counter in the local market. They have been selling organic fruits and vegetables to local customers for years and have already built a strong customer base. They are well known with their welcoming service and friendly attitude.  They are a hardworking and happy family. He is now requesting loan of 1,700,000 MNT to purchase large amount of fruits and vegetables to sell from their counter

loans.use: to purchase large amount of fruits and vegetables to sell from their counter in the market.

loans.name: Nusrat

texts.en: Nusrat is a 32-year-old married woman, and the mother of six children. The man shown in the photo is Nusrat’s husband who is a driver by profession and provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family expenses, but now it requires proper maintenance to keep it in its functional routine. For this reason, Nusrat has applied for a loan of PKR 40,000, for her husband. He wants to buy new tires with some spare auto parts for his vehicle. This will help him drive more smoothly, and provide better transport services to his passengers. Nusrat is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband, and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to buy new tires with some spare auto parts for her husband's vehicle.

loans.name: Mumtaz

texts.en: Mumtaz has successfully built her business, selling milk, with the support of Kashf Foundation and Kiva. She is very experienced in her work and earns a sufficient amount of income to contribute to the family income. Previously, with help of Kiva loan she purchased a cow. For meeting the increasing demands of her customers, she needs to purchase one buffalo. For this reason, she applied for a loan of 40,000 PKR through Kashf Foundation. It will help to inflate her sales and profits. She is in her 5th loan cycle with good repayment behavior.

loans.use: to purchase one buffalo.

loans.name: Flor Naciente Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “FLOR NACIENTE” iniciará el séptimo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Villa Exaltación, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Wara es la Secretaria. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de ropa, artesanía en miniaturas, venta de dulces, venta de cosméticos, venta de pan, confección de deportivos, juegos recreativos, venta de electrodomésticos.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Wara es integrante, ella indica que hace dos años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de ropa; nos cuenta que este negocio lo inicio hace varios años al observar el buen comercio que tiene, desde entonces decide comercializar el mismo en las ferias de la Ciudad de El Alto pese a no contar con un puesto fijo.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de ropa por mayor) que adquirirá en las vendedoras mayoristas de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará de forma ambulante en las ferias. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener a su familia ya que ella es casada y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el servicio de salud que le ofrecen en la institución.
texts.en:
The “FLOR NACIENTE” communal bank will begin its seventh cycle in Pro Mujer as a part of the Villa Exaltación center. It is made up of eight members and is led by a board of directors, of which Wara is the Secretary. The businesses that the members of the communal bank have are varied. Among them are selling clothes, artisanal miniatures, selling candies, selling cosmetics, selling bread, making sports clothing, games, and selling appliances.

The loan they will take out will benefit small business women, including Wara. She says that she has been a member of Pro Mujer for two years. She joined at the invitation of a friend who is a member of the institution. Right now, she has a business selling clothing. She tells us that she started this business several years ago when she saw what a good business it was. At that time, she decided to do the same at the markets in the city of  El Alto, despite not having a permanent spot.
 
The loan she will take out now is to increase her capital by buying clothing wholesale. She will acquire it from wholesalers in the city of El Alto. Later, she will sell it as a street vendor in the markets. This type of work allows her to generate income to support her family, because she is married and has one child. 

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says that she likes the health services that they offer in the institution.

loans.use: to buy clothing wholesale.

loans.name: Lorena

texts.es:
Esta historia comienza  en una familia más bien popular, en la cual nació una niña llamada Lorena, la cual desde muy pequeña siempre soñaba con algo distinto a lo que estaba acostumbrada la familia, soñaba llegar lejos  en todos los sentidos de la vida alcanzando las metas de ser una profesional, de darle mejor vida a los padres que siempre se habían  esforzado por darle a ella lo que necesitaba, solo que no se atrevía a compartir los sueños con nadie, porque tenía miedo que se burlaran de ella o que simplemente le impidieran hacer lo que quería y lo primordial para la casa era el diario vivir. 

Un día, ya estando grande, decidió desafiar a los padres y amistades, dándoles a conocer lo que quería, pero le dijeron que ella no era capaz de hacer lo que soñaba que era ser una maestra, dar lo mejor de sí para los niños, enseñarles  lo hermosa que es la vida y cuanto vale cada una de las vidas de esos pequeñines, pero la principal meta para con ellos era ser una guía  y enseñarles que los sueños si se pueden cumplir si se propone hacerlo, la interrogaban y la juzgaban al decirle que como iba a ser posible que una persona como ella lograra algo así. Pero sin importar lo que le dijeron, Lorena decidió iniciar los estudios y avanzar en la vida profesional dando cada vez mas pasos hacia la meta.
En el camino encontró  todo tipo de personas, buenas  y otras no tanto, pero con la personalidad y esfuerzo solo fueron pequeños momentos que no cambiaron para nada la visión, al ver la familia que ella estaba logrando lo que se propuso, comenzaron a apoyarla y de esta manera la situación se componía  ya que se sentía sola, pero logrando tener apoyo y amor , brindo eso a los estudiantes mejorando también la calidad de vida de ella y la familia.
texts.en:
This story begins in a rather poor family, in which a girl named Lorena was born. Since she was little she always dreamed of something different from what her family was used to. She dreamed of going far in every way of life, reaching goals to become a professional, and giving her parents a better life, since they had always made an effort to give her what she needed. She did not dare to share her dreams with anyone, because she was afraid they would tease her or that they would simply prevent her from doing what she wanted, since the main concern in the household was the day-to-day life. 

One day, already being a grown up, she decided to challenge her parents and friends, letting them know what she wanted, but she was told that she was not able to do what she dreamed. She wanted to be a teacher, be the best she could be for the kids, teach them how beautiful life is and the value of each of the lives of the little ones, but the main goal was to be a guide and teach them that dreams can be fulfilled if one decides to do so. She was interrogated and judged by people asking how it would be possible for a person like her to achieve something like that. No matter what she was told, Lorena decided to start studying and move forward in her professional life, each step getting her closer to her goal. 

Along the way she met all kinds of people, some good and others not so good, but with her personality and effort there were only a few moments that did not change her vision at all. When the family noticed that she was accomplishing what she set out to do, they began to support her which fixed the situation, considering that she was feeling alone. Being able to have love and support, which she extends to the students, also improves the quality of life for her and her family.

loans.use: to pay for one semester of tuition.

loans.name: Manzoor

texts.en: Manzoor has expertise in embroidery and has been using her skill to provide for her family for over five years now. She started this line of work at a very young age. During the initial years of her business, she barely made enough money to purchase the required materials. Today, she is proud to be famous in her community, to be the best at making beautiful patterns with thread and beads. Now she has requested for another loan worth 40,000 PKR to purchase spools of thread, packs of sequins, and beads and stones in different colors. She dreams to provide a better standard of living for her six children.

loans.use: to purchase spools of thread, packs of sequins, and beads and stones in different colors.

loans.name: Mawinby Leiffer

texts.es:
La señorita Mawinby Leiffer tiene 17 años de edad, está realizando un técnico de auxiliar de enfermería.
Ella una señorita que nació el 12 de abril en la ciudad de bogota, la cual tiene un hermano de 19 años de edad, cuyo padre falleció hace 9 años en un accidente automovilístico y cuya madre vive con ella, cuya niñez tras esta tragedia no fue muy feliz ya que tuvieron que pasar por muchas adversidades junto con la madre y hermano para así poder salir adelante, después de tanto esfuerzo logra terminar el bachillerato y así una vez graduada, ella  con muchas metas y sueños por cumplir decide empezar realizando un técnico, para así poder tener una base para seguir construyendo el futuro profesionalmente. 
Ella ha planeado el futuro de tal manera que cuando termine el auxiliar en enfermería y ya con esta base, ella pueda conseguir un trabajo  estable y rentable el cual le permita costear la carrera de pediatría para que así pueda llegar a cumplir uno de los tantos sueños, queriendo recompensar de una u otra manera a la madre por tan grande esfuerzo que ha hecho siempre para que ella sea alguien en la vida, Y así ella poder seguir creciendo como persona y llevando a cabo todos los sueños de querer viajar explorando y fotografiando la naturaleza.
Ella necesita el convenio con kiva ya que es una ayuda muy grande para la madre que es la que la está apoyando y ayudándole económicamente para que pueda sacar este técnico adelante, la cual no cuenta con muchos recursos de pagar una cuota tan alta ya que posee más gastos aparte de este, por esta  razón ella decide informarse sobre el convenio con kiva para que sea una ayuda y que así no le quede tan pesado pagar la mensualidad.
texts.en:
Mawinby Leiffer, 17, is studying to be a nursing assistant.  She was born on 12 April in the city of Bogotá and has a brother, 19.  Her father died nine years ago in a car accident and she lives with her mother.  She didn't have a very happy childhood because of that tragedy, and she and her mother and brother suffered a lot of adversity so they could get ahead.

After a lot of work she managed to get her diploma.  Once she graduated with a lot of goals and dreams, she decided to start studying to be a specialist so she can have a foundation on which to keep on building her future as a professional.

She has planned the future so that when she finishes her program, she'll have the foundation to get a stable and profitable job to pay for a program in pediatrics.  That way she'll achieve one of so many of her dreams.  She wants to repay her mother in some way for the big effort she has always made so Mawinby will be someone in life.  She'll be able to keep on growing as a person and realizing all her dreams of wanting to travel to explore and photograph nature.

She needs the arrangement with Kiva because it's a big help for her mother, who's supporting her and helping her financially so she can get ahead.  Mawinby doesn't have much money to make such a high payment and she has other expenses as well.  That's why she decided to inform herself about Kiva so it could help her, and it wouldn't be so hard to make the monthly payment.

loans.use: to pay her tuition for a semester

loans.name: Tahira

texts.en: Tahira, age 28, is a married woman.  She deals in the business of selling animals. She buys animals (baby goats and calves) at low prices, brings them up, and then sells them out in the market at higher prices. She makes money through her business to contribute to the family income. She needs to improve her business, to bear her household expenses. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of PKR 40,000. She will use it to purchase more animals. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level. She is in her third loan cycle and has a good credit history.

loans.use: to purchase more animals.

loans.name: Haseena

texts.en:
Haseena is a 40-year-old, married woman. For about 10 years she has been working in hand embroidery. She makes beautiful patterns for the people of her community. Her designs are much in demand, and she has managed to consolidate a clientele that allows her to contribute to the expenses of her home.

To help her to continue her operations, she has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR. She will use it to buy thread in different colors and packs of beads, sequins and stones, for embellishment. In this way, she would be consistently able to cater to more customers. She expects a boost in her earnings and wishes to spend it on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to buy thread in different colors and packs of beads, sequins and stones

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more wooden inventories and planks needed to meet clients' orders on time.

loans.name: Enhtuya

texts.en:
Mrs. Enhtuya is 31 years old and lives with her husband and two sons in their small house in Arkhangai province, Mongolia. Her husband Erdenesuh runs their family business, a butcher shop at a rental counter in a local market. Her two sons attend local schools. 

Enhtuya and her husband started their butcher shop business more than a decade ago. They have built close relationships with suppliers and customers over the years. They are hardworking and diligent people who want to raise their children to be well-educated and well-behaved people in their future.
 
Enhtuya is now requesting loan of 3,000,000MNT to purchase large amounts of meat products from countryside herders to sell to local customers, and make a small margin of profit.

loans.use: to purchase large amounts of meat products from countryside herders to sell to local customers.

loans.name: Francisco Antonio

texts.es: Francisco tiene 28 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su esposa y sus dos hijas de 5 y 3 años de edad. Francisco se dedica a la venta de verduras en el mercado central de su localidad y es así como se gana la vida y lleva el sustento a su hogar. Francisco desea reparar el techo de la vivienda dado que se encuentra en mal estado y no es seguro para su familia. Por lo anterior solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de lámina galvanizada y polines para repara el techo de la vivienda lo antes posible.
texts.en: Francisco is 28 years old. He lives in his own house with his wife and two daughters, aged 5 and 3. Francisco works selling vegetables in the central market in his community. That is how he earns his living and supports his home. Francisco wants to repair the roof on his house because it is in poor condition and it is not safe for his family. Because of this, he is asking for this loan from FUSAI to invest in buying galvanized sheeting and rods to repair the roof on his home as soon as possible.

loans.use: to buy galvanized sheeting and rods to repair the roof on his house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more food ingredients for her business, including meat, fish, and rice

loans.name: Divine

texts.en: Divine is a thirty-three year old Cameroonian who is married with three children. The older child is eleven and in secondary school while the youngest is four  and in primary school. He has been in this business for over two years, which makes him experienced and stable. His business is likely to succeed because it is located in an urban area with many potential customers. This loan will be use to increase his capital by forty-four percent and his profit by fifty-five thousand FCFA.

loans.use: to buy planks and other materials for the manufacture of chairs and tables.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more plantains, sausage, fish, oil, soft drinks, water, etc., for her business.

loans.name: Angelita

texts.es:
Angelita tiene 54 años de edad, ella solo logro estudiar hasta sexto grado, es divorciada tiene 3 hijos los cuales ya son mayores de edad y ya no viven con ella, Angelitra vive con una hermana, ella se dedica a los oficios del hogar y a la agricultura de la cual logra sacar los necesario para su sostenimiento.

Angelita se dedica a la agricultura y a la ganaderia ella aprendio este trabajo de sus padres, quien desde que tenia 12 años la llevaban al campo para que aprendiera la siembra de maiz y el cuido de las vacas.  

Con el prestamo que ha alquirido ella desea comprar un toro, para asi no andar acarriando las vaca. Ella espera que con el toro que compre sus vacas puedan quedar cargadas para sacar leche, cuajada y crema para  vender y tener una fuente de ingresos para ella y su hermana quien tambien le ayuda en lo que es la agricultura

El sueño de Angelita es tener su propio negocio de leche, crema, queso y cuajada y vender dentro de su comunidad y en los pueblos mas cercanos lo que producen sus animales y poder tener en su vejes una vida mas estable.
texts.en:
Angelita is 54 years old. She only went to school through sixth grade. She is divorced and has three children who are already adults and do not live with her. Angelita lives with a sister. She does the household tasks and works in agriculture, from which she manages to get the necessities to sustain herself.

Angelita works in agriculture and livestock raising. She learned this work from her parents, who ever since she was 12 years old took her to the fields so that she would learn to raise corn and care for cattle.

With the loan that she has acquired, she wants to buy a bull so that she doesn't have to keep transporting her cows. She hopes that with the bull that she buys, her cows will become pregnant to give milk, curd cheese, and cream to sell and she will have a source of income for her and her sister, who also helps with the agriculture.

Angelita's dream is to have her own milk, cream, cheese, and curd cheese business and sell what her animals produce within her community and in the closest towns and be able to have a more stable life in her old age.

loans.use: to buy a bull

loans.name: Babita

texts.en:
Jarmundi village is located at Deoghar, Jharkhand. Basukinath temple is located here and hence attracts a lot of tourists. Around ten lakh people visit this place per day. People in this village have different occupations, but there exist hardly any beauticians. Hence, there is quite a demand for beauty parlour services. Babita grabbed on to this occupation, took up training and has been into this business for the last seven years.

Babita is 38 years old and married. She has four children, two sons and two daughters, all studying in school. Her husband was running a men’s salon, which he let Babita convert into a beauty parlour for women, and he started doing a dairy business. The income from the parlour is around INR 8,000 and from the dairy farm is around INR 3,000 per month. It is difficult to manage their household expenses and their children’s education. 

Babita wants a loan to buy more cosmetics and other beauty products, which will help her to expand her beauty parlour. 

Babita plans to save for her children’s education and their bright future.

loans.use: to buy more cosmetics and other beauty products.

loans.name: Chabbi

texts.en:
Jarmundi is a religious place in Jharkhand, which consists of lots of temples that bring many devotees and tourists here every year. 

Chabbi, 35, is married and the mother of three children, two daughters and one son, all going to college. She has studied until fifth grade, while her husband studied until tenth grade. Her husband is into the cloth business, as there is good demand for it. He sells cloth and ready-made garments at a weekly market and also goes to different villages. He earns around INR 8,000 per month.
  
Their income is not sufficient for the family, and her husband is also finding it difficult to travel every now and then. So, they are planning to establish a shop in Jarmundi, for which Chabbi is requesting the loan of INR 18,000.

Chabbi hopes to save enough for her children’s education. She wants to buy a television for her house.

loans.use: to establish a cloth shop and buy textiles and ready-made garments.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a large amount of inventory to sell at her counter from Erlian, China.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase large amounts of meat, before the meat price increases to the top, to provide healthy and affordable food to local customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more wood for her business.

loans.name: Rosaline

texts.en:
Rosaline is a Cameroonian, aged thirty two. She is not married, but has three children. Her oldest child is nine years of age and in primary school, while the youngest is a year old. 

Rosaline has been in her business for over two years now, which makes her very experienced and stable. Her business is likely to succeed because it is located in an urban center with many potential customers. This loan will be used to increase her turnover by twenty-four percent and increase her profit by fifteen percent.

loans.use: to buy a 3 in 1 photocopier.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy plates, bowls, buckets, etc., for her business.
